everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent and the rooms are very tidy and comfortable.
title: Great Stay, Excellent Customer Service
comment: The staff at the Belvoir Garden Grove met all of my expectations and went above and beyond to help me when I had to book an extra room at the hotel when it was pretty much full. I will certainly keep staying here when I travel back to the area. Clean rooms, great service, great location. 5 stars.

title: No sleep on vacation
comment: Upon checking in, I was surprised that there was a long line with only one desk person working and not a separate line for platinum or gold members. The desk staff was friendly and welcoming. She upgraded me to a suite which was great at the time.

title: wonderful view of the beach
comment: hotel still under going renovations during my stay but i am impressed with what i have seen so far - room was light and airy - front desk pleasant and professional. location was on the quieter end of the boardwalk which is what i preferred but still within walking distance to all the major attractions. my one complaint was the dining situation - in both instances i was charged incorrectly (lunch and breakfast) but the problem was quickly corrected. don't know if this is a new summer staff and the kinks are still being worked out or a little more attention needs to be paid by the staff.

title: Hotel
comment: We had a wonderful time while staying at your hotel. Everything was just perfect. We will definitely recommend it to our friends.

title: Great Staff
comment: This was a great hotel - clean and comfortable. Starbucks in the lobby, great bar and restaurant.

title: Great Staff
comment: This was a great hotel - clean and comfortable. Starbucks in the lobby, great bar and restaurant.

title: Very nice hotel but several serious flaws
comment: Spent 5 nights at the hotel with my wife celebrating our 10th anniversary. Absolutely loved Chicago and will be back soon. However, we will not stay at the Belvoir Hotel & Tower again due to 2 serious flaws. The first and more serious of the 2 flaws was the internet connection speed. The entire stay our connection speed in our room (both wired and wifi) was consistently between 0.3 and 0.4Mbps which is only slightly faster than dialup. If you are a business traveler or somebody that will do more than just check email then you are going to be very frustrated. A hotel of this caliber should have much better internet speed. The second flaw was the TV reception. Throughout our entire stay there were several channels (both major network and non network) that were "black" and even one day that the service was totally down.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's right down the street from all the popular things you've heard about New York: Broadway, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Manhattan Mall
title: *shrugs*
comment: The hotel was nice, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was cute. The location of this hotel is perfect, it's right at the heart of everything. I appreciate the front desk guy who was overly patient with me during check-in. The bellhop guys were nice and friendly.

title: Great location, BPG benefits below expectations
comment: This hotel was in a great location, close to Cumberland Mall with access to many restaurants. My teens loved it! The room was nice and spacious. I was very disappointed to find out that they did not have a club lounge when I arrived. I typically take advantage of this feature and look forward to it each time I travel. This was especially surprising since the welcome email I recieved days prior to my arrival mentioned club advantages. This is false advertising to me and I felt deceived. Also, when I checked in, no one asked to help with my bags nor did they even offer a luggage cart. I was traveling with 3 children, and it was quite a feat to accomplish getting to the room without help. I was also disgusted with the fact that I had to pay for internet. If I could have had club access, this would have not been the case. Parking was not free either, and there was no choice but to park in the garage, which was pretty scary, no security guard, and not well lit at night. This should be complimentary for preferred members. The staff was generally nice and accomodating in the end. After complaining, they provided me with complimentary breakfast in the restaurant for my family each morning of my stay. I would suggest this hotel to others because of the location. It was about 10 minutes from downtown ATL with convenient access to Coca cola factory, aquarium, and other popular attractions.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect for a walk to Central Park, shopping, Times Square and theater district.
title: Staff is very personable and helpful.
comment: Front desk staff could not have been more helpful and polite, as were the bar staff and those at the coffee bar in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect for walking to Fenway.
title: Best Hotel in Boston
comment: This hotel has everything you could possibly want or need. We stayed 5 nights and it was absolutely perfect. The Director of Front Office Operations, Alex, assisted with pre-stay details of our reservation. Mr. Lee, Front Desk Supervisor, checked us in. Both gentlemen were extremely helpful, polite and personable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice Clean Room For The Money.
title: Great Room For The Money
comment: The room was very clean and spacious. The furniture, carpeting, and bedding was very nice. I didn't see any worn, torn, or dirty spots anywhere. I was very pleased with our room and the service. Easy access from Interstate 81. I would recommend this hotel to all those who are traveling. Thanks Belvoir for the nice stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have kids - this is the place you should stay in Waikiki!
title: Something for All Ages
comment: This is the perfect BPG Hotel for a family. There is something for the young and young at heart. Good night life and plenty of kid-friendly activities. The BEST swimming pool and water activities for children plus a separate pool area for adults. BPG recognition perks were a huge bonus with complimentary breakfast in the morning and social hour(s) in the early evening. All top notch not just pastries or cheese and crackers. Rooms are not spectacular but good size and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is expensive everywhere, so you might as well park here.
title: Good Location and value
comment: Good for conferences. Quiet but central location. Plumbing broke, but was promptly fixed.

title: Avoid, the place is a joke
comment: The rooms are old, tired and dirty. The staff simply don't care, the valet takes 30 minutes to get your car. As a Platinum memeber, I was given access to the club lounge, when I visited the lounbge to get breakfast one morning at 8 AM, they were already out of food and the attendent told me that they had no plans of replenishing. Avoid this place.

title: Perfectly met our needs
comment: This was the last leg of our vacation on our way home and the Belvoir at Bucks County perfectly met our needs. Traveling with two young boys (2 and 3 years old) is challenging under perfect conditions and having a clean and comfortable place to rest the kids just makes our lives a whole lot easier.

title: Great Location, I will return!!
comment: Just returned from Belvoir FT Lauderdale. Great beach, cabanna boys work hard and are very polite I give them 5 stars.. Front desk/starbucks/valet jockey's very friendly. If you don't have a car not the best location for amenities. Concierge James was informative yet not very friendly. He never once smiled or seemed happy. He made both myself and my mother feel like we were bothering him. I certainly was not impressed by his level of customer service. I work in the largest Gaming facility in North America and I know how important the Concierge role is.

title: Great place
comment: This is a great place to stay. Friendly staff, nice rooms, and a great pool are the highlights of this hotel.

title: Avoid at all cost
comment: I stay in hotels almost 200 nights per year. My company makes me stay in this one once a year and it is BY FAR the worst hotel we stay in.

title: Rude Staff
comment: The claim they gave me a upgrade, but the phone in the room was missing more buttons than it had on it. On top of that I could not see out the window because of water between the two panes of glass and the list goes on. I have emailed the hotel 3 times now. Sent the emails to every email address listed on the contact page plus a few more and not one person at this hotel has been willing to even email me back.

everyoneShouldKnow: You really need to meet Mr. X. L. Fox
title: Wonderful all around
comment: I really like the cash and points option. Hotel is very nice and Shula's sandwiches are huge and delicious. The bell man, Mr. Foxx is a terrific assett to the hotel upon your arrival.

title: Loved this hotel!
comment: This hotel was very nice. It was across the street from the beach. The staff was very helpful, they helped us set up dinner reservations and gave us advice on what to do. The suite was fanatastic. We will be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have any issues or concerns they will NOT be addressed!
title: Unhappy BPG Member
comment: first the door had to be blocked the lock wasn't working, and no rooms availableto move to. the microwave had food in it, the tub had private hairs in and around it, the garbage cans still had garbage in them.i was told my account would be noted and a manager would contact me, still no call.

title: Very very poor customer response - Billing twice on credit card
comment: The problem with this resort is that they billed me twice, almost an additional $1000, and have never resolved it even now after 2-3 weeks after checkout. IF you want your money's worth be careful here, as they may never return the money. Hopefully the General Manager can review this on top priority and resolve this. After 3 phone calls they only say another few business days, though they accept there is a billing error. Very very poor customer response. I would not recommend this place if they are billing customers twice, and not efficient in resolving issues.

title: No Recognition
comment: Aside from acknowledging that my BPG # was attached to my reservation I received no recognition for being a member. I was not placed on the preferred floor, where I appreciate and enjoy the free bottled water that is generally provided. I requested a room other than a double bed room and was not accommodated, either. Had I not been forced to sleep in a bed smaller than I am accustomed I would rate the room comfort higher. The best part of the stay was the fitness facilities. The pool & whirlpool were great as was the gym. Nothing special about this place.

everyoneShouldKnow: The FRONT DESK doesn't know there job, do there job or care about your Disney Experience. There are no DISNEY oriented people at this property! Have a great time!
title: Poor Impression from the Beginning
comment: Front desk very disorganized, didn't know if room was ready, it was at least an hour after check in time, that should have been a given. No one went over amenities with me or gave me the Dolphin information sheet, put credit card of other travellers on my room instead of correct room. Do you know you can save $.75 a day if you refuse the USA Today paper, now you know. Did you know that the hotel will give you a $5 food/beverage credit if you refuse housekeeping services per day, well now you know. This is information the front desk failed to provide me upon checkin. They relied on a little plastic card on a table in my room that I read the last day I was there. As well as the fact that my $14 a day resort fee covers 1 hr of local calling if needed as well as the two bottles of water in the room, which they don't deliver until later afternoon.(If you don't get the Dolphin information sheet from the disorganized front desk then you won't know this) The housekeeping staff will hound you as early as 9am to get in the room to clean it if you haven't left for the park and they'll be there at 2pm (during the heat of the day) when you want back in of course. But, hey all of that could have been avoided if the FRONT DESK had done there job and I would have gotten a $5 food and beverage credit to boot! If you go to PIcabu's don't take your kids through the line unless you want to pay $5 per candy item, which is just ridiculous and also you may not have to tip the person bringing your food to the table but don't worry about that beacuse they've got you covered as they add a service charge to your bill, check your receipt. The Bell Hop guy outside when I asked for a cart to bring our luggage looked at me like I had asked for the moon or something since I didn't pull up in the valet area I was treated like I had a disease or something. WOW, I have been to the Disney Resort 15 times now and this was the worst service I have ever gotten. Granted the Dolphin is not an "Official" Disney hotel but they still have Disney's name on it and I expected a DIsney quality , "magical" vacation experience and this hotel feel really short. Giving a 3 star rating is being generous to say the least.

title: Needs upgrade
comment: The television had to be unplugged and plugged in repeatedly to reset the satellite connection. Air conditioners are loud. I Drpped some crumbs on the floor from a snack and left some business receipts on the desk. Cleaning staff through away the receipts (which I needed for my expense report) and failed to vacuum the floor or replace the used shampoo. I told the staff and they will tell the cleaning staff(?). The hotel just

title: Great Value
comment: The staff is great. The room is spacious. Club lounge is good for breakfast and light dinner. Have stayed five times already in past two months and have already booked two more stays for June.

title: More than Expected
comment: When we arrived, we requested for a fridge; to our surprise, they upgraded our room to an extra microwave and a refridgerator. The room they gave to us had a spectacular view of Lower Manhattan. We could see all the buildings across the Hudson River, especially the World Trade Center Site. The hotel staff was very friendly and they made our stay enjoyable. Housekeeping always gave us a fresh room after a long day of touring New York. The only thing is, the nearest convienience store is about three blocks away. Otherwise, we would recommend this hotel to our friends and family; we most likely will come back.

title: Don't expect BPG Recognition!
comment: As an BPG Gold Owner we received no recognition other then the sleeve the clerk put our room keys in. No Upgrade. No BPG Room, No comp water, as is standard operating procedure. No BPG club option, even though the hotel has a club. No review of BPG options. Horrid!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for people who want to go on cruise ships and Airport.
title: Hotel with great view
comment: I found hotel of my choice situated at very scenic and convenient location for cruise ship trminal.My one nite stay was very enjoyable and club room offer I took came out very well and enjoyed the facility and the food.Hotel staff very amicable and curtious.

title: Worst Grandbourne Property Ever!
comment: It is hard to believe this hotel is even considered to be a part of the BPG collection. It is tired in very respect and need some serious attention. We went to HI to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and enjoyed every aspect of our trip except the hotel.

title: convenient and comfortable
comment: Other than the fact that the room needed some refurbishing, this hotel is ideal for travelers

everyoneShouldKnow: the location at the Belvoir pasadena is central. you are able to walk to most of pasadena from here. it is jut a great location.
title: three times is a charm...
comment: this was my third visit to the Belvoir pasadena hotel for the month of may, [YEAR-0]. and i did enjoy each of my visits. my first impression of this hotel was the friendliness and professionalism of the front desk staff. you are met cordially,receive your room key package in no time and you're off to your room. enjoyed my breakfast buffet at the soleil restaurant with all day coffee refills. regretfully, i did not make it to the gym. at this hotel's location, we are in easy walking distance to the south lake avenue district and old pasadena. best of all, you are right back of paseo colorado - a shopping mall with macy's, scores of restaurants and bars and shops. best of all was gelson's super market with everything you could possibly need. the Belvoir pasadena hotel is centrally located in pasadena. enjoy the staff, the facilities and the location. great.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the best hotel on Disney property to stay when you don't want that Disney-themed hotel experience. It has a resort feel but still offers all of the Disney extras that the other hotels provide.
title: Love the Dolphin!!
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Dolphin! We have stayed here numerous times over the past 3 years and have enjoyed it every time!

title: Superb property
comment: Thanks Belvoir Jacksonville, you guys once again showed me what a wonderful hotel this is. A special thanks to JT and Mary who took us out in the shuttle van, your expertise of the local area was so helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is very convenient & staff is very friendly.
title: Bartender Jan rocks!
comment: I stay at Belvoir Uptown almost every time I come to Albuquerque. Jan is always on duty behind the bar & I just want to say that she is efficient, professional & friendly. She is an asset to your organization!

everyoneShouldKnow: Close by to Plano Business and High Tech Park. Lot's of good restaurant within walking distance.
title: Excellent service as usual.
comment: Excellent hotel close by to Plano high tech park. I've been using the Belvoir Stonebriar for 2 years now. Service is always excellent. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable.

title: Convenient Location
comment: Next door to Tribeca, SoHo and Chinatown; a convenient subway ride to Midtown.

title: Service with a Smile
comment: I must compliment your concierge service desk and bring special attention to one individual who went well beyond the call of duty - Dan. His response to one of my requests was done with such immediacy and respect that I felt as if I was the most important person in the building! This kind of service is rare today and instills in me the desire to stay at the Belvoir Dallas next time I'm in town. Well done, Dan!

title: Needs New Mattress
comment: We liked the hotel and location of it. Room service was great. The downfall was that our bed needed a new mattress. It was dipped in on each side so, we didn't sleep well at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is close to everything!
title: ACHA[YEAR-0]
comment: The staff was great at the Belvoir for my conference. My room was clean and the view was nice; I felt very comfortable. The only areas I see for improvement are the roughness of the towels (they need to be softer), the hallways to the rooms are in need of some freshening up, and the food served in the hotel eateries is much too expensive.

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid the roof top bar. It is not part of the hotel and employees an exceptionally rude staff.
title: Great hotel - avoid roof top bar
comment: Hotel is great. Hotel staff is great. Avoid the roof top bar. It is not part of the hotel and employes an exceptionally rude staff.

title: Doesn't Deserve the "Belvoir" Name
comment: This was the WORST hotel stay I've ever had (and my first ever negative review on this site). First, the air conditioner did not work and it was not fixed as promised. Then the waitress at the hotel restaurant rolled her eyes at us when we showed up at 8 pm for dinner. A party of 8 showed up after us and it was made clear to us that we would not be served for well over an hour (we went, instead, to McDonald's). Last, the hotel staff asked us to leave after the first night (we booked 2 nights) and not only did I have the e-mail confirmation of this, but the hotel itself had written the CORRECT checkout date on our key card holder). The beds were lumpy and uncomfortable. They should not be a part of the Belvoir or BPG family. The spa was not functioning,

everyoneShouldKnow: It's the best for mature adults.
title: Feels like home
comment: I love the intimacy of the hotel as opposed to the 'conference-type' behemoths. The staff is always gracious and accommodating. It's easily accessible to anything in Manhattan & walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge. Preferable to the madness of Times Square.

title: The hotel was fine.....
comment: A great location....a short walk to the outlet stores (which are great especially on a holiday weekend!) And the room was large and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Internet use of laptops in mezzanine for free is a nice feature...plus the lack of a casino was a nice feature if you were not looking for one...I certainly enjoyed the relaxation.

title: BPG gold membership not recognized
comment: I am a gold member and i was not asked about of gold member gift when checking in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not all staff is friendly and happy to have you as a guest.
title: Front Desk Staff Less than helpful
comment: my first encounter with the hotel was with the front desk help. The woman was very rude and condescending. I was sure I requested a king size bed and asked for such when I was told it was two queens. I was ignored with attention being paid to other guest who came in after I did. I asked about several issues and was treated as if I had no right to be a guest at that hotel. I even called the 800 number because I was not getting any answers or respect from the front desk in person. My experience at lunch in the hotel restaruant was not any better. I asked for spicy mustard and the waiter acted as if I had made a foreign request. He was very hestitant about meeting my request.

everyoneShouldKnow: Servers aren't friendly in the resturant
title: Pretty resort but rude servers
comment: Some servers and bartenders seemed like they didn't want to be there at all and were very rude and not helpful at all. I work at a Belvoir and the service at ours compared to there's was mind blowing. The hotel is beautiful and rooms are very nice. I just wished I had servers that were nice to me. It's hard to go eat somewhere when you feel like your a burden to them.

title: Awful!
comment: We were traveling with a boys soccer team and they were not very helpful. Room and bathrooms were ok, but could have been cleaned much better. Candy and drink in rooms should be clearly marked with price and not but in drawer. Pool area never had enough towels for everyone. We will never stay at a Belvoir again.

title: Great value!!
comment: Great location, can get to anything in Atlanta from here without trouble. Can walk to ANY type of dinner/nightlife you would like from hotel. Get fridge in room, separate "living" area, 2 large flatscreens, bar area, bathroom with separate enclosed shower/commode, fast elevators, plenty of FREE parking, all for a price that is difficult if not impossible to beat without staying at a discount property.

title: Needs more
comment: It would be great to have free internet and a small frig. in the room. The price you paid for the rooms and all the food places around the hotel, sometimes you take food back with you. The bed was great, the chair next to the bed was hard and the back was to short. Great staff. the restaurants was great. The ice was free.

everyoneShouldKnow: Molly Mallone's bar and restaurant in the ground floor for relaxing after the day's hectics work.
title: Good hotel to stay
comment: I stayed at Belvoir for three nights recently and I liked the comfort that the hotel provides. There is a good bar that privdes drinks and food in the ground floor. The overall hospitality provided by staff and hotel facilities is great. I would definitely love to stay at Belvoir during my future visits to Framingham.

title: Unhappy with meeting facility
comment: The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff were friendly and professional. I was dissapointed in two areas, the first of which is internet service. I was shocked when required to pay for internet service in my room, and I was appalled when that service did not transfer down to the meeting rooms where I spent most of my time. If the hotel charges for internet service, then that service should be reliably available throughout the entire facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will do everything in their power to make you happy.
title: It Was Superb
comment: I stayed 3 weeks in your hotel and from the very first warm hello to a final good by I felt cared for. It seemed to me that every need was taken care of if not anticipated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great service
comment: Kiana in the restaurant was a delight. Her friendly manner made our stay very memorable

everyoneShouldKnow: Thats easy the world class location.
title: Pleased
comment: I was most pleased with The Dolphin hotel. The staff was most helpful. I loved the location of my room and of course the Hotels location is world class.

title: R.Harden
comment: The front counter staff was extremely professional and helpful. My room was not cleaned or touched the two days that I stayed.

title: Excellent Hotel!
comment: We thought this hotel was really nice. We had a King junior suite which was beautiful and very comfortable. The location is great with lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. We were only there for one night but I understand that there is a beautiful pool too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be mindful of the stocking of food/beverages in the rooms. Very high cost of items.
title: Room beverage/food stocking
comment: I was disappointed the room did not have a refrigerator for use as part of the room package. I also was astounded in the "sensor"system for the items stocked. You couldn't touch anything without being charged. I would hope there would be another alternative, knowing the curious nature of people in general. I cannot imagine being a couple with small children!

everyoneShouldKnow: Used to be our favorite hotel
title: Great hotel that is now poor
comment: Checked in at 6:00 PM, 2 rooms 5 people. Rooms on club level not ready. Took about 45 minutes for front desk to check with housekeeping on when rooms would be ready. Bell Hop did not know what he was doing. Ended up in different rooms. Bathrooms too small. Faucets handles touched walls. Only two sets of towels in each room. Air conditioners were very loud, located next to bed, cycled on and off every 5 minutes throughout the night. Got stiff neck from hard pillows. Called from desk at 10:30 AM, 1:00PM 3:00PM to send up feather pillows. At 4:00 housekeeping shows up at my room with toilet paper and tissues. Sheets in king bed where half size. Club Lounge ran out of food every day. One of the worst says we have had in this hotel. Been staying there for over 20 years.

title: Wonderful Rooms
comment: It makes a vacation a vacation. Nothing like trying to relax in a nice room. The beds are inviting and the pillows are amazing ha. Coffee pot wasn't working and they immediately brought a new one up. Great service. And location was nice too.

title: Excellent Cutomer Service
comment: I was pleasantly surprised to receive a beautifully upgraded suite as a BPG Gold member. The service and sincerity here is amazing! I would definately stay here again.

title: Overall, a disappointment for BPG
comment: The lobby was great, and service at check in was wonderful, but there were some suprising misses with the room...

title: Great downtown location and friendly staff
comment: The restaurant menu has been upgraded recently - very nice upgrade! Starbucks in the hotel lobby is very convenient as well. Nice place to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Away from heart of downtown - 15-20 minute walk.
title: Always reliable
comment: Another very good stay at this hotel on my annual Anchorage vacation. Staff is friendly and generally accommodating. Location is a bit away from heart of downtown but definately walkable (not an issue if you have a car).

title: I little overpriced
comment: I little overpriced for some of the rooms, but the hotel does offer some of the best views in Chicago.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fitness center and pool are great.
title: Great Stay
comment: This hotel was great and very convieniant for my needs. Fitness center and pool were great. The staff was very friendly. I would highly recommend.

title: Room issues
comment: The room was very nice but I was surprised by having no soap in the bath and a wet spot on the carpet.

title: Tired old Facility
comment: Having stayed at many Belvoirs in the US, this facility did not meet my expectations. Specifically,

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid the rooms below the roof top bar!
title: Turn off the music!
comment: This would have been a lovely stay except for the thumping from music at the roof top bar. The thumping invaded every corner of my (expensive!) room. All the fancy bedding in the word cannot make up for the fact that sleep was impossible until the band quit for the night.

everyoneShouldKnow: it's a short drive to the beach
title: it's all good
comment: my stay was only 2 days long, but everything was excellent. the staff was very nice and accommodating (especially the sisters in the club lounge). the room was clean, the bed comfortable, fitness center was clean. I was very satisfied.

everyoneShouldKnow: don't stay on this hotel !!! they will charged you for $10/a day for parking...
title: BAD EXPERIENCE..BEWARE...
comment: 1.) $10/day - self parking..yess you red it right.you booked this hotel & they will charged you for $10 a day.

title: Awesome staff
comment: Hotel was exactly what I expected, except for the staff which was amazingly helpfuly and understanding.

title: Unclean disgusting Rooms
comment: Stayed one night instead of planned two nights. The first room we received had a horrible nasty smell in the room and the carpets were disgusting not to mention the bedding didn't look clean. The next room smell was not as bad as the first one but the carpets and rooms cleanliness were appalling and I have pictures to prove it. Since it was 3am decided to stay for the night but left early the next day. I couldn't walk on the carpet. The bathrooms door looked like someone had thrown up on it.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have small children you better plan on ordering food and or beverages well in advance because the wait is exceedingly long.
title: Disappointing
comment: First let me say the staff is extremely friendly but things have really gone down hill from our trip last year. The pool area was filthy on Saturday morning. We were told that someone was to have sprayed/ cleaned down the pool area early in the morning. But whoever came on duty obviously didn't make sure this was done because the same spilled drink and food mess was still there from the day before, there were straws all over, and bird mess all over the chairs and cool deck. Pool service was INCREDIBLY SLOW for both ordering, delivering and pick up (this is bad because the birds and flies are extremely aggressive in attacking left over food). It was surprising how slow considering the pool area was truly not that busy. The pool area was cleaner early Sunday but the garbage was overflowing from the trash bins that had not been emptied from the day before. On both days of our visit there were a lot of dead bugs in the pool, so much so, our children did not want to into one of the pools. In addition, many of the umbrellas are broken with metal arms hanging (my hubby hit is head on one) and the material is flipped up and ripped on many. In this 100 plus degree heat the umbrellas are desperately needed. The staff is AMAZING with the children for activities around the pool and in the club. We had dinner at Koisin and the food is pretty good but a 1/2 hour wait for food is too long with small children waiting to eat. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable but our patio was sticky from something being spilled on it and our friends who travelled with us had soiled duvet cover on their bed. It seems to me a manager should really walk the property as to its pool condition and there should be more staff for service.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is construction going on getting ready for the 2013 Super Bowl.
title: Great Location
comment: Always hesitant about booking online and only reading reviews or seeing pictures. But we took the leap and it was well worth it. There is construction going on, and we were notified on check-in. We chose to stay as high as possible and were informed that was where the construction was. We were given the option to move, but decided to stick it out. The front desk was clear about when construction started and ended. We were planning on being out during those times anyway, so it was not a problem. Everything was better than we expected as we must have been on a recently renovated floor. We were very pleased with everything about our room - beds, bath, TV, movies, etc. I had only one issue with little hot water one day, but the other mornings, it was just fine. Hotel was within walking distance of almost everything in the French Quarter. We walked everywhere. Staff was exellent. Only had one rude staff member at the tour desk, but every other employee went out of their way to help us. Will definitely stay here again when we return.

title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
comment: OVERALL GOOD EXPERIENCE- WISH THAT WE WOULD HAVE RECEIVED MORE BPG PERKS.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's old and outdated and they are tidying up the room between guests. They are not cleaning the rooms.
title: Horrible. Not clean at all.
comment: I stayed at this hotel June [YEAR-0]. It was a terrible experience. We arrived to find a room that was not even cleaned. Where do I start.......The grout on the bathroom floor was brown it was so dirty. The tub had a layer of soap scrum on it as well as the walls. In the corners of the bathroom there was dirt and around the toilet there was spots. We were staying in this hotel on our way to our resort the next day so my expectations were not very high. However, I do expect the bathroom in any hotel to be clean and disinfected. It was late when we arrived (after 10 pm) but I could not stay in that room and requested another room. I showed the front desk rep pictures of my room and they apologized and immediately switched my room. The next room was no better but since I had a one year old with me and a tired husband I went ahead and stayed in the room. I laid a bath towel in the tub and stood on it while I took a shower.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't count on the reservation to hold a room for you.
title: what are reservations for?
comment: We had a reservation so imagine our surprise when we got to the hotel and they did not have a room for us in it. You can just go to the other hotel down the road and come back tomorrow morning and we will get you a room here. WHAT? Oh then we got " we will move your suitecases to the new room no worries." We got back guess what no suitcases. and no one downstairs seems to know anything about it. WHAT? 2 calls and quite a while later they finally came. This is NOT how a "top notch" hotel should run. We have been in many different hotels and NEVER had anything like this happen. Very disappointed!

everyoneShouldKnow: We love this hotel and stay often, before and after our vacations.
title: This was a horrible stay (unusual)
comment: Had to write a review, so you are aware of a horrible experience we had the last time we stayed.... as noted above, unusual. We had just arrived after a long day and not feeling well to boot, so we ordered room service. After a call at the 50 minute mark to see where our food was, it arrived 10 min later....WITHOUT UTINSELS to eat it with. The server said he'd be right back with the utinsels..... THANK GOD I had some plasticware that I travel with because it took him 20 MINUTES to get back to us.....by then the food would have been cold right? Although the food was good, this as a horrible experience for us. Had problems connecting to the internet WIFI also.

title: Cox Family
comment: We enjoyed our stay. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The rooms were updated and clean. We would highly recommend the hotel...location was the best!

title: Close to Convention Center
comment: Excellent place to stay when you need to be close to the convention center or Disneyland

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a great restaurant, independently owned, just two blocks away called "Chef Joseph's at The Connoisseur Room", this is outstanding!
title: A good choice for Downtown Indy
comment: We thought this a great choice, convenient for walking around the downtown area and close to the restaurant we were there to try out. The staff was gracious and accommodating, and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and easy access to freeways
title: Rangers Ballpark Family Reunion
comment: We had three rooms for 1 night, great place for the family to gather for a mini-family reunion. Enjoyed a Rangers game, and Six Flags visit with the whole family from Dallas, Springtown and Mississippi. Room was clean and comfortable, hope to continue this every year.

title: Front Desk Staff Rude
comment: The front desk staff is very rude and condescending. There are several poor reviews of the front desk staff. I am o.k. if a mistake is made, they happen. But, I expect you to accept your mistake and attempt to make it right. Instead, I was told the mistake was my fault and I am an BPG Gold member! The problem seems to be isolated to the front desk, I found the pool staff and restuarant staff to be very helpful. I picked the BPG hotels because I thought I would have a better experience that other hotel chains. This hotel is making me question my decision.

title: Comfortable stay
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir because we had a family member in the hospital. It was the closest hotel to the hospital and they offered free shuttles. The room was clean and comfortable and the beds were amazing. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. I wish they had a mini fridge and microwave, it would be helpful if we were there for an extended period of time. You have to pay for wifi in the room, It would be nice if Grandbourne preferred guests had that included. If you aren't on a budget it's worth moving up to club level to have that included. Overall it was a great stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Belvoir has the best beds and pillows!

title: Very Welcoming Property
comment: The young lady who assisted with our check in was amazing, sorry I did not get her name. She has a great personality, very helpful and remembered us later in the evening, first class staff member. Also the gentleman out front were very helpful. Overall amazing staff, exceeded our expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel charges for storage of luggage.
title: Better Than Reviews
comment: I really enjoyed this hotel. Things started out great with check-in. Hopefully, you will get Nicole who has wonderful customer service! The rooms are lovely, and clean. This is the perfect location for 30 Rock, Times Square, Shopping, Drug store access,food and so much more. The internet connection is a little shaky, so get out and have some fun!Be prepared to pay a fee for storing your luggage. I will make the Belvoir my "go-to" hotel for every New York Trip.

everyoneShouldKnow: It doesn't feel like a large hotel.
title: Big hotel with a small hotel heart
comment: I stay at this hotel every time I'm in Phoenix and I stay in 25+ different hotels a year. This hotel continues to be one of my favorites because it feels intimate even though it's a large hotel. Rooms are very well kept, clean, and modern. Internet connection speeds throughout the hotel are super fast with a stable connection. Fitness area is bright and all the machines are always in proper working condition. Finally, the staff is personable. All the way from the valet department to the front desk staff that always steps out from behind the desk to present keys, greet, etc., to the lounge and District staff that is always conversant and efficient. Did I forget the food? The bacon wrapped dates and shrimp tacos are delicious. District is by far the best dining option downtown and in the Phoenix heat it's best to be near a good restaurant.

title: Pubes on Toilet
comment: When I checked in, there was a really long line at the BPG counter - the line moved quicker if you weren't in the BPG line.

title: Excellent location!
comment: The location of the Dolphin is perfect. Very easy walking distance to EPCOT, efficient boat transportation to Hollywood Studios and bus transportation to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. Many restaurant choices at all price levels. Great service from Mercy at the Swan Garden Grove. Madera Spa treatments were excellent! very relaxing wait area but no spa facilities to enjoy (sauna, pools, etc). Airport/Hotel transportation booked through the hotel was amazing. Our driver, Bill, was personable and knowledgeable about the parks and hotel amenities. Very convenient to be able to purchase park tickets at the hotel. On the down side, requested turn down service on 3 separate occassions, never received it and we were celebrating a very special graduation event that was never recognized even though at check in I was told something special was planned.

title: A Good Stay
comment: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and I have always enjoyed it. The front desk staff are absolutely fantastic, and the other staff including cleaning and kitchen staff are great as well. All problems or issues that I had while staying there were quickly solved. Overall, a wonderful stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: They have a very knowledgeable and friendly staff that caters to your needs.
title: This hotel has great features
comment: The rooms are well appointed and the beds are very comfortable. The check-in was speedy and the staff was friendly and courteous.

title: Great place.
comment: Very thing went well - great bed and great service.

title: Amazing
comment: I stay at the Belvoir at least once a year. I am never disappointed. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff go out of their way to be kind. Super customer service!

everyoneShouldKnow: World class executive chef, named Kurt Zuger.
title: Wow! VIP treatment!
comment: I travel a lot and I see a lot of hotels, so trust me when I say that my stay at the Belvoir in Overland Park was absolutely top notch! For me, it's all about the people. The food service staff were very professional, warm, and friendly. I ate several meals in and the cuisine was excellent. I can always tell a well run hotel by the attitude of the staff. I would highly recommend the Belvoir at Overland Park.

title: Loud construction noise & thin walls
comment: I was woken up both mornings of my 2 night stay with construction noise and an alarm clock going off at 5am in another room.

title: Nice, great location- but stairs lacking
comment: Stayed with my daughter during Animazement convention (May 25-27, [YEAR-0]). Great accommodations except the stairs are lacking as a regular avenue for guests. We were on the 11th floor and there was a power outage Saturday night so I walked down the stairwell along with many others during the suggested evacuation and the directions are mainly geared for the employees, not guests. Our only way out was through employee areas. I realize few guests probably use the stairs, but it shouldn't feel as if one is in areas that are not permitted. My daughter's a little fearful of elevators so we'll likely request the lowest floor next year. Bathroom towels a bit rough.

title: The hotel has good features but some staffs did service in unpleasant manner
comment: I am happy with Belvoir room but I had unpleasant moment with staff in baggage storage area. He treats his customer in angry mood. He is not polite.

everyoneShouldKnow: It does not meet the service expectations and if you are an individual traveller, never stay in the hotel on the weekends. They always have large events of multiple parties, block elevators dedicated to those large groups, run out of food, water, supplies - its just chaotic!!!
title: This hotel needs a lot of improvements
comment: I was a long staying guest at this hotel and it was the biggest mistake I made by expecting that the hotel and its staff will meet my requirements. Desptie being a platinum member of Grandbourne, I had to struggle for almost everything. If this is the way a platinum member is treated, I pity all the others that end up using this property. The stay has been nothing but disappointing and I would neither recommend this hotel nor come back to stay in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close enough to Times Square without the hassle of Times Square crowds
title: Mostly good
comment: I stayed at this hotel as part of a conference (the conference was actually further into Times Square). The location was good because I didn't want to get flooded with everybody from Times Square and there were a few subway stops nearby as well. The only issues I had were cleanliness. I saw a dead moth on the floor by the window, the toilet was clean except for an old stain inside the bowl, and I noticed that although housekeeping comes in to replenish toiletries and make my bed they didn't really bother to wipe the mirror (after I inadvertently splashed water on it).

title: Fantastic renovation
comment: Great location for lots of Orlando activities - renovation of guest rooms looked great. Enjoyed the multiple F&B options on property and really large pool area.

title: Overrated
comment: The club room/lounge was not stocked and hors were not replenished at 7:30 pm 6/2/[YEAR-0]. The room was too tight and I could not reach the outlet to plug in my laptop. Too much furniture in such a small space. The grout around the bath tiles is getting discolored/not cleaned thoroughly. The value of this location experience is dwindling quickly. I was disappointed b/c we paid for the extras but did not receive them.

title: Comments
comment: Wallpaper in room was ripped. No pen or pad by phone. Remote did not work on sleep mode.

title: Disappointed
comment: We stayed at this hotel for a wedding, and were really surprised by the staff's attitude upon check in. The block had been reserved for months as was our reservation. You would think that staff would take utmost care in making sure guests of a large event, which is bringing the hotel lots of money, were happy and taken care of. In talking with other guests of the wedding, we found our opinion was not alone. Step it up next time, or you may find large parties become a thing of the past.

title: The staff was awesome
comment: My husband and I chose to spend our 1st anniversary at this hotel. The room, location, staff and food was great!! I wish they had a few more food options but other than that the stay was awesome. I would like to persally thank the staff for making our stay awesome!!

title: Nice Hotel but Parking Nightmare
comment: Arrived on Friday night for a weekend stay. Front desk staff was nice at check-in, no offer of BPG check-in awards for Platinum members. In a way of making up for not having a Club Room, gave coupons for breakfast buffet for one and half-off other members tab, but should have really given 2 buffets instead of seeming cheap. Room was great, minus the missing balcony that Executive Suites are advertised as having. I used Suite Upgrade certificates and get a suite without a balcony that is advertised on the hotel's website. Went out to dinner and came back to a full parking lot, except for the valet lot that only had 2 cars in it. Parked in valet instead of having to park out back in the poorly lit construction area. Went in to alert front desk staff and was told I had to ask valet as they are a separate company, desk attendant would not call the valet to the desk or go out to them to ask about leaving my car there, poor customer service for Platinum members. I was offered to park across the street but I could not park in the empty valet lot. Came back on Saturday night and now valet area has moved and the space they had reserved and let stay empty right in front of the entrance on Friday night was now open for guests to park in. Why was this not left open on Friday?? Very poor management. Food on breakfast buffet was pretty bad, no omelette station and soggy waffles instead of fresh made ones. Service was good, but food was really lacking (thank god we only had to pay for half of one buffet otherwise we would have walked out and went somewhere else). In summary, nice room even if not as advertised, nice amenities and pool but very poor customer service and breakfast. Additionally, doors could seal better as they and the ceilings let in a lot of external noise.

title: AWESOME SERVICE!
comment: We booked two rooms for three days because we had a wedding to attend. ALL the staff was AMAZING! The day of the wedding when we got back our beds had the cutest swans made of towels. We will definitely stay with Belvoir again!

title: Pre-conference R&R
comment: Did Cash & Points prior to conference for personal use. Very pleased with the room I was given. Large room on the Club Floor. Great location on 16th.

title: Not the place to come for good customer service
comment: During our four night stay in a junior suite on the club level, we were met with frustrations constantly. Check in was 2 1/2 hours late. Club Level entitled us to the Club Lounge for breakfast, hors d'ouveres and drinks. We encountered many times not enough food and drinks. The staff was rude and said they were out of food and would not be ordering more to be sent upstairs to the Club Lounge. It was a big waste of money to opt for the Club Level. Never once during our issues did I hear an employee apologize for any problem. The room was nice and big. Cleaning service offers green choice by putting what towels you want replaced on the ground. Doesn't matter because they took the ones hanging, too. The water in the shower changed temperatures from cold to hot during each shower and the faucet for water is on the outside of the shower!!!

title: Convenient and comfortable
comment: Very comfortable sweet sleeper bed, nice size room and bathroom. Amenities included free water and wireless internet. There was construction going on during the day but this was barely audible and the very short water outage did not affect me at any time. The fitness center was probably one of the best that I have used in a hotel so far. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Will stay at this hotel again.

title: Nice quiet room
comment: We stayed in the Club level for one night and had a very relaxing time. Hallways were quiet and even though the hotel was next to I405, it was still very quiet throughout the hotel. Staff was very quick and eager to assist us in everything we needed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will disappoint you and the amenaties are sub-par.
title: Horrible Resort
comment: This was my first and last time staying at a Shertaon resort. My fiance and I were looking for a relaxing get-away. We both work 7 days a week and attend grad school and was really hoping to spend some quality time together and visit Universal/Islands of Adventure. When we first arrived, the property looked great. The person at check-in was friendly. The property itself was average and does not offer many activities for people who are not there for a time-share. There was only one restaurant with sub-par food options (stay away from the mushroom pizza). Our room was on the first floor, which was fine but the shower door would get stuck. The shower itself was not clean. I would not bathe in it. There were NO vending machines for snacks and bottled water. There is a tiny "market" on the other side of the property which did not offer many options. The staff clearly did not communicate with one another, nor are they fully trained. We asked for a movie rental at the front desk and was told the activity center would have a selection. When we made our way there, the individual working the desk said they never carry dvds and that we would have to go across the property to the market. We were told there was complimentary shuttle service when I called prior to booking the reservation and found after arrival that the free shuttle service was not to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure. We ended up having to cab or ride a shuttle that packed people in beyond the maximum amount allowed legally on a bus. Furthermore, my Fiance left his Kindle in the room upon check-out. I have called 3 days in a room with promises from the staff that someone would call me back. I have yet to hear from anyone. This is the 4th day now. The incompetence of the employees there certainly has steered me away from ever wanting to stay at any of the Belvoirs or affiliate.

title: Amazing
comment: Absolutely awesome. Great price, incredibly sweet people, and awesome experience. Anytime we needed anything at all, the staff would bring it right up with a big smile on their face!

title: Renovated room with excellent location
comment: Stayed here on the night of my birthday. I was very fortunate to upgrade to one of the big Parlor Suite overlooking Manhattan Time Square and Central Park on the 24th Floor (Note: Presidential Suite is on this floor as well). The hotel have undergone a complete renovation, with the exception of the meeting room area, everything else have been refreshed as of June [YEAR-0] to match current Belvoir Brand Standard.

title: Lack of service
comment: This hotel seemed to be having rather serious labor or management issues. Room service seemed nonexistent. My room was not cleaned once in a 3 night stay. I signed up for the green program (no linen or towel service unless left on the floor) so it took a while to realize nothing was being cleaned. Trash baskets were full, the floor needed vacuuming and no clean glasses or fresh coffee for the coffee maker. I also noticed other rooms on my floor with room service trays on the floor for days. I guess I should have complained but I was so busy and tired and just kept hoping that each night when I got back it would have been cleaned. The other issue was the lighting, in the room and the lobby was so dim at one point I had to go outside to read something I needed. I had asked the concierge twice

title: My Vacation Disappointment.
comment: My boyfriend and I decided to take our vacation in Denver, CO. and after looking through all the hotel packages we decided to book our stay in an Executive Suit at the Belvoir hotel in downtown Denver. However, we were extremely disappointed to find that our "Suit" had a less than mediocre bathroom. It was half the size of an average bathroom, with barely enough room to turn around in. Also, our "Suit" lacked a mini fridge as well as a microwave. We were provided with a minibar with a couple water bottles and yet no where to store them...disappointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and friendly, location in great, just off the interstate and right outside the entrance to Downtown Disney.
title: Great Place to Stay
comment: Great location within walking distance to many restaurants. Valet staff met me and was very attentive. Desk clerks where quick and cordial, room was very clean and had a nice decor. This is my first stay at his particular location, and would definitely come back.

title: Belvoir Chicago
comment: The stay at the Belvoir was very nice. The only complaint i have is upon arrival at the hotel the receptionist was not very inviting nor friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: perfect location, wonderful rooms, fantastic staff!
title: Beautiful Renovations
comment: If you stayed here before the renovations you wont believe the change! Beautiful modern look. Very comfortable design both rooms and lobby. The pool area is as good or better than many on Disney property. But maybe the best thing about the resort is the staff. You are always greated with a smile and some nice small talk. Made to feel like a valued guest. Brenda who works at breakfast was a joy to deal with every morning. The resort is perfect for families with childtren of all ages.

everyoneShouldKnow: There ia a $50 Pet Fee not listed on the website.
title: Doggy Event
comment: All in all, I had no problems. Came with my pups and all was good. Would def stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is not a lot to do in area, and after a day at Legoland you really need a car
title: Less than normal
comment: I stayed here with my family for a short vacation. The pool while supposedly heated was a little chilly, I had to discuss with the cleaning people one day about whether they were going to clean my roon (I voted yes) and when I attempted to rent a car for a day trip through the hotel, they managed to mess up the reservation completely.

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL AND STAFF
comment: The Belvoir Jacksonville always exceeds expectations! The staff and management are alqays ready and willing to assist. From the desk staff to the restauarant and bar staff to the room and maintenance staff, they are all happy to provide the guest with everything they need to feel at home.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not up to most Grandbourne standards
title: What a disapointment
comment: Checking other reviews of this property we certainly expected a much better stay. First of all we waited over 45 minutes for an airport pickup. Although we arrived later than expected we were dismayed that there was absolutely NO food or drink service available (this was at about 11:30 pm.) The desk clerk was rude and acted as though we had no business checking in at this hour. The room was no more than adequate. Clearly this hotel serves a business traveler and doesn't care about repeat guests. We certainly will find other alternatives to this hotel when flying into BWI. Even though we are Gold Members we were told that free internet was not available - the first time at ANY Grandbourne Hotel that this has happened.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are roomy and everyone is so nice!
title: What great memories!
comment: I love this hotelresort! EVERYONE from wait staff to house-keeping to front desk to ground keeping and so polite and nice and happy. But the manager gave our family outstanding service. My daughter celebrated her 16th birthday at your hotel. This gave me a place where familyextending and estranged family a place to wish my daughter happy birthday. Thank you for gving my daughter very happy memories of her 16th birthday. Marvelous Stupendous Exceptional service !

everyoneShouldKnow: Confirm and reconfirm your check-out time
title: Surprised by the Rudeness of Front Desk Staff
comment: My husband and I always stay at this hotel when in NY every year, and some years, twice a year. Upon check-in, I requested a 4PM check-out for my day of departure as I had a very late flight. I was told it was no problem. Unfortunately, when I called the night before checking out to confirm, I was told very abruptly that 4PM is not offered. I tried to explain what I had discussed days earlier, and was told that it was not true, and 4 PM check-out is not allowed. I asked for a manager who told me my request was never noted. After some discussion on my part, she agreed to a 2PM and complimentary baggage check. I appreciate how she offered this to assist me, but as I needed to go to Red Hook that day, the 2PM check-out left me rushed, and very inconvenienced.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy in/out location with no noise; walk to downtown events; not a place for kids
title: 5-Star Mid-range Hotel
comment: If you need to lounge in a pool cabana, choose an BPG resort in the area. This is a fine downtown business hotel for the price. Room was well-appointed & clean.Staff was efficient, competent & professional, but friendly. Underground self-parking is free if you cannot expense the valet. If you don't want the 500 extra Star Points, have Housekeeping clean your room. It's nice to have a choice, right?

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff, great location and beautiful beach.
title: What a Great Place
comment: My husband and I had a great 25th anniversary get away at this hotel. The facility, staff and restaurants were great. Recommend the Club Room when booking. It was really nice to have breakfast and afternoon appetizers. Will definitely stay here again -- we live in Florida and try to get away a couple of weekends a year. Also hope to use this hotel for our annual girls trip next spring -- easy access to airports for those coming out of state and great beach, pool and bars which is what those northern girls like.

title: Business Stay
comment: I travel to our Bristol facility and this is my Hotel of Choice. The staff is very friendly and customer service is top of their priority. I give this hotel A+.

title: Very Nice Stay in Tampa
comment: I booked this hotel primarily for the rate, and because I was renting a car and therefore location was not a huge factor.

title: In the heart of NYC
comment: Stayed in a newly refurbished room at the Belvoir New York Hotel, which was nicely decorated, very comfortable bed and amazing view down over Times Square. Thankfully the hotel is a couple of blocks north of Times Square, so there is some respite from the crowds, however the hotel itself is enormous, so there is always people coming and going. BPG guest recognition is good, which helps avoid queuing for both check-in and check-out. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was perfectly adequate, but nothing out of this world. The hotel is also perfectly located for MoMA nearby, and Central Park just a few blocks north. Staff were consistently friendly and efficient, there was an error on my bill at check-out however it was corrected quickly and with a smile. Given how constantly busy they are, I was pleasantly surprised at the level of personal service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is an average hotel; not the typical Sheaton
title: Average Hotel
comment: As a Grandbourne preferred guest, I was expecting more staying at the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have any special need, just ask the front desk; no request is too big for them, but they aren't mind readers and cannot guess your wants. For example, my room only had decaff coffee when I arrived, but the desk remedied that immediately!
title: Mother's Guest House ~~ !!
comment: Went to visit Mother, who lives in Alexandria House, just opposite this Belvoir Suites. On arrival, the front desk was most helpful in providing a room where I could wave 'goodnight' across the way to her, as well as a refrigerator for meds. Have stayed here previously, and though the hotel is older now, it has remained wonderfully updated and always immaculately clean. Kudos to the staff! So close to Reagan National Airport and just minutes from all the action in Old Town. The Hoof Restaurant is an intimate and welcoming venue for drinks or a meal, and the computer services are exceptional, with every amenity. Even the elevators are fast and reliable. In all, probably the best bang for the buck in Old Town Alexandria . . . thanks, Steve W, for keeping Mother's guest house up to standard!!

title: Perfectly Appointed
comment: We had a great stay at this hotel during a recent business trip. We took many of our meals in the hotel restaurant, used the business center and took advantage of the fitness center. I would totally recommend this hotel.

title: What's that noise?????
comment: I was in room 502... every 45 minutes or so there would be this big "bang" coming from the AC vents. Woke me up several times, extremely annoying. Upon departure, the desk staff made no concessions for my uncomfortable stay... oh, they bought me a cup of coffee...

title: unexpected nice
comment: I enjoyed my stay. Liked the pool and staff was especially nice. I will stay here again.

title: A bit crazy...
comment: Gold member, but don't think that translated into a better room. It was really crazy when we checked-in and system was down, so may have influenced the outcome.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellence in Customer Service>> Airport Shuttle Drivers / Front Desk Staff / Club Lounge Staff / Housekeepers>> ALL most helpful, friendly and welcoming
title: Hidden GEM in heart of "The Crossroads of the West" ! !
comment: This hotel has so many strong points going for it>>Terrific LOCATION; FREE airport shuttle [also to key points downtown]; wonderful restaurant; free parking; EZ walk to NEW City Creek Mega MALL & Temple Square. What tops all that>> the STAFF. Someone forgot to tell the staff they are a Category 2 hotel. The professional, accomodating, welcoming and super helpful staff here makes us feel like we're at a Cat 6+. Was here first weekend of June. Heard similar comments of praise from other guests I encountered throughout my stay.

title: Under construction
comment: Beware, this hotel is going through a major remodel right now. Don't stay here unless you get a serious discount for the hassle. Bar is closed and most of the downstairs is all torn up.

title: 4 stay review wrap up
comment: overall this is a great hotel. I'm from the richmond area and this hotel has been here for years (closer to decades now) so directions for me were easy though the traffic pattern (on route 60) is a bit silly trying to get into the hotel.

title: Surprisingly great experience
comment: Overall, this was one of my best Belvoir stays. I wasn't expecting such a positive experience at a category 2. In fact, I was a little nervous. But the staff and stay were just great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots more parking in the back, and there is a back door entrance.
title: great bedding
comment: This hotel has great linens, nice colors, and nice views of the Sandia mountains. The location is great for access to hip restaurants and the Sandia Tram. Parking is ample (more on the back side) and the pool and hot tub are nice. The F&B assistant manager is very attentive to detail and very receptive to comments about the food. The bartender was very sweet as well. The lounge area was very relaxing and inviting with free wi-fi, too.

title: Very comfortable choice
comment: Despite its size, the Belvoir Phoenix doesn't feel nearly like a 1000-room hotel; service was friendly and efficient and the bar and restaurant never crowded. The public areas, like the rooms, are well-appointed and in nearly-new condition.

everyoneShouldKnow: Room types vary significantly - do your research ahead of time.
title: Excellent staff, property, and location
comment: Overall, we were very happy with our recent five-night stay at the Belvoir Maui: having done some research beforehand, it was exactly what we expected.

title: Great location
comment: Renovated hotel is great. Location is perfect with many restaurants within walking distance. Pool bar is best renovated feature at the hotel.

title: Awesome hotel!
comment: Great remodel! Great staff, great new pool area with water slide,volleyball,and basketball hoops.Sean at front desk even downloaded our Southwest Airlines boarding passes while we enjoyed the day at Disney.Beds are clean and comfortable with nice deck overlooking new pool area.Great value and close to Disney,Universal Studios, and tons of restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Worst Experience
comment: The lobby was over crowded and we were unable to use the pool because of this. The noise level was terrible. I was assured we would be away from the noise, we were in the south tower but the noise was still in the south tower. I had to explain to my kids why some guests were drinking alcohol in the lobby while we were checking in. Also we had problems parking because of the others guest s were blocking the lot. WAS NOT A FAMILY ATMOSPHERE!!!

title: good location
comment: this hotel is across waikiki beach, good location and good price. the hotel is little outdate for interior,but the room is comfortable and clean. the resort fee which included wifi and parking fee is little higher but it will cost you more if you park on same street on difference parking lot. Overall, the hotel is good bargain to stay.

title: Missed the mark
comment: I was turned off by my very first encounter at the hotel. A large group was checking into the hotel; it was being handled very efficiently. However, their busses blocked the entrance, so I had to manuever into the hotel. When I got in, two "bellman," "doorman" (their title was never explained to me) walked by me as I stood helpless not sure what to do with my car, which was not in the normal place to check in. They came out again talking to each other and refused to make eye contact with me. I went to the front desk and the gentleman there was very helpful, but I was standing right in front of him and annoyed at the initial contact. The service staff did what they were asked, but made no effort to go out of their way on their own. That is why I cannot recommend this hotel. Ultimately, an expensive "motel room" in the DC area.

title: Run Down Hotel
comment: It's time to close this place and renovate. Everything in this hotel is tired and run down, including the staff. I've stayed her many times, and my last stay will be my last.

title: Stay for the location, not platinum benefits
comment: The location is obviously great but don't expect to feel special as a platinum guest - staff are looking to register the person behind you and room service, repair, etc takes longer cause of enormity of hotel and number of guests . Platinum breakfast isn't hearty

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not upgrade to the club level. Worst club level of any hotel I have visited anywhere in the world.
title: Do not pay extra for the club floors
comment: the hotel room was fine, staff was helpful but not overly friendly. I made the mistake of paying extra for the club floor ($23 per night extra) and what a waste of money. The afternoon snacks consisted of sliced fruit and $9 drinks. The TV in the Club Lounge did not get most channels. The Club breakfast was meager at best . My recommendation is to not waste your money on the club floor upgrade.

title: our favorite place!
comment: this is our 5th time we have stayed here. love this hotel and will still continue to stay here on every california trip in the future!

title: Not worth it
comment: Not on the beach or walking distance to it, staff that weren't very helpful at the front desk and a barista who asked me a couple of times if I needed room for cream and sugar after I order my coffee black... Not typical of my Grandbourne experiences, I will not be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will get your walking in...
title: A great place to go for a conference
comment: The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was always polite and helpful. I like the fact that right outside the door you can catch a bus to Disney.

title: Amazing Staff
comment: What an amazing place - From Niles Harris to Andre and everyone that supported our stay. Andre made our stay in Atlanta amazing. We enjoyed such fantastic restaurants...What an amazing place not only for the room comfort but the people made the place.

title: Nice place to rest and feel welcomed
comment: I've stayed at several Belvoir / Grandbourne hotels in Cali & across the USA and have never had a bad experience. The staff here were helpful and friendly (especially Christina at the front desk), the Maid service was prompt also. The hotel was clean inside and out and up to date, they even have the fruit water in the lobby waiting for you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient link to LA Metro, lots of good dining nearby
title: Responsive service, great room
comment: I have stayed here multiple times over the last ten years.

title: Nothing Special
comment: Rooom was average. Bathroom sink drain was SLOW. You could not run water. Hall light did not work. Balcony was great but had no divider so there was no privacy. There was a couch and chairs but no lamps except by the bed. The sockets in the bathroom were put on the wall crooked. (I know that is picky but it all adds up.) The bar around the pool was torn up while we were there. Just not a good experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Friendly People and Safe good location
title: Just What you need at the end of the travel day
comment: This hotel was exactly what we needed. The desk person was so friendly and recommended the Shulas' which was attached and it was excellent. We got a coupon for $2 desserts which were so yummy. We felt welcomed and safe and I would definitely go back.

title: SHOULD HAVE 6 STAR CATEGORY
comment: stayed the night of our wedding. staff could not have treated us better. even upgraded to suite.

title: The lady and the gentleman that work the club on the club florr 26.
comment: We have stayed on the club floor on two different occasions as the late snacks and the breakfast were perfect when we had appointments. I must say that you have two treasures in the two people you have working. The lady is exceptional and is such an asset to your hotel. I observed her attentiveness to a family that was a regular because of an illness with their child. She made them feel so special and knew everything about their circumstances. She was so compassionate. The gentleman was equally as cordial and efficient with his dealings with myself as well as others. They are amazing people and deserve to be recognized! They give your hotel the recognition it deserves.

title: Alot of Money for Nothing!
comment: for a 9 day stay it was outrageous to charge $15 per day for refrigerator, $13 per day for internet, breakfast extra cost, no coffee or hot water in the early morning, no laundry facility on site, $9 parking charge nightly, room not cleaned 2 days in row

title: Chicago
comment: Hotel room was tired and overpriced

title: Way below my expectations
comment: The only plus I can say about this hotel is that it is right off the highway so it is easy to access and they have a parking lot right in front which is also hassle free. Otherwise, I found it below standard for an BPG hotel. Upon arrival after 4PM (we did not check in early) our room was still not ready. I also had paid extra for a reservation with club access which includes breakfast though my key nor did my companions keys work to enter the club and when we went down to ask them to switch the key and went back up, yet again it did not work and I just gave up and did not bother going down a second time. The facilities look more like an upscale college dormitory building than a hotel. Upon checkout, when I told the clerk at the front that I was really upset about the fact that I could not access the club facilities she just shrugged her shoulders and ignored my comment.

title: Friendly Staff
comment: I stayed at your hotel recently and wanted to let you know how wonderful your staff were. I specifically have to mention Vivean at the breakfast counter who made me a delicious omlette each morning. He was so nice and a great start to my day. He should be recognised for this as he has a hard job putting up wtih all walks of life.

everyoneShouldKnow: location is great! Shuttles and bus service is great! Staff are excellent!
title: Great first stay!
comment: This was a pre-cruise stay at this hotel and our first time staying here. It was great. The first night we were awakened by noise in the adjoining room so I called Guest Services and they offered to move us to another room. It was really too late for that but they sent security to the room immediately to have the noise cease. The next day they moved us to the BPG floor and for only a sight cost, we were able to have snacks and breakfast! The gym and the pool are excellent facilities! The shuttle to the airport and the Mall was awesome too. Even paying a few dollars to get to another mall was a good deal! It would have been great if I had been recognized as a BPG member at Check-in though. Then I would have availed of the upgrade on the first day instead of the second. Overall, the staff were really great at meeting our needs and helping with our inquiries.

title: Park Avenue on Green Acres Budget
comment: Belvoir Chapel Hill has taken the lead to be the best place I have ever stayed. From the moment I walked in I was greeted with an effervescent smile. My room was beautiful and very clean. I slept the best I have slept in months as the bed is not to soft and not to hard, but just right. The staff at Shula's 347 Grill was exceptional-they made me feel not only like royalty, but family. My shuttle bus driver's made sure to get me to and from my destination safely and they were always prompt to pick me up. On a Green Acres budget this hotel delivers Park Avenue care, amenities, and food. A definite booking for future visits to Chapel Hill.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are very friendly and helpful!
title: Very good hotel
comment: There are four guests in our party. But there were only two sets of towels provided. The pull out sofa bed had a frame in the middle and I got hit by the metal frame. It's a small room if you get the sofa bed out.

title: Reward Program - No Benefit
comment: This is the only rewards membership that does not credit the points/awards to the individual when a company is paying the bill. I belong to numerous other "award" programs, and I receive the benefits, not my company. After all, I was the one who was away from home, not the company!!!

title: Needs Improvement
comment: Restaurant staff and service was terrible. Ordered room service the first night (appetizer and soup) and 35 mins later received a call that they were out of both. The next morning had breakfast downstairs and waiter dissapeared after the order was taken (literally). We received no refills and had to hunt down utensils. In a rush to turn over the room our glasses were taken while half full. The bill was inaccurate and the food subpar. Tried again the next day hoping it was just my bad luck and again had poor service. Ordered simple pancakes and received no syrup and reheated coffee. I'd write more but you get the picture

title: Excellent Staff service
comment: Excellent service staff and front desk staff, especially Ranjit. Very helpful and accomodating! Only complaint is slow elevators -- the doors take too long to open and close at each stop causing noticable delays at peak periods.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, less than 10 minutes from downtown but bad customer service.
title: Bad customer service
comment: 1. Poor customer service from the beginning to the end of my stay.

title: Not What I Expected
comment: I checked in my room and noticed 2 things, a strong musty odor and a big spider. I took care of the spider myself and since there were no other rooms available(?) they ionized the room which worked pretty well. What I noticed is that there was no follow up from staff to find out if the problem had been taken care of which I would have expected. Also in regard to service, the staff in the hotel restaurant was very slow. One evening I had to go over to the bar and ask if there was anyone that could help me. I will try another hotel next time....

title: Not Good for Business Purposes
comment: I stayed in this hotel for a conference last week, and was very disappointed to find out there was no wireless internet anywhere except the lobby. This caused problems for the conference, especially when we did pay for the Ethernet internet in our room, it was still SLOW.

title: Great getaway!
