comment: We frequently stay @ this Belvoir~~reservations desk, Club Lounge & support staff go out of their way to make our stay memorable.

title: It was all right
comment: 1. The air conditioner was NOT in sync with the thermostat. I set it at 65 for the whole day and when i returned at night, it was still warm in my room. Unit was obviously not working.

title: Your staff are simply the best
comment: My wife and I have stayed at the Steraton Waikiki every May-June for the past 12 years. This past year it was great to see that the staff of the hotel are as friendly and helpful as they have been on all other visits. They just can't do enough to ensure that we had a great time on our vacation, including: making sure we had a room on a suitable lower level; making us comfortable throughout; meeting and greeting us at breakfast every morning; providing excellent service from poolside to the bars; and just being nice people. Thanks and hope to see you all next May.

title: Good overall, but a disappointing incident
comment: The hotel was as I expected for a Belvoir - great bed and pillows for a good nights sleep.

everyoneShouldKnow: be careful of the lincoln or SUV the hotel offers you
title: staff
comment: I am extremely disappointed that the valet parking people advised us to take a company lincoln or SUV and we were told the driver is only a couple of dollars more than a Taxi when we arrived at our destination the driver charged us $50.00 for one way and then said he would come back to get us we called and he never showed up or answered his phone also the Taxi was only $26.00 for one way and we feel we were taken advantage of the driver said his name was million

everyoneShouldKnow: Definitely stay there if you are attending a conference in the same facility, very convenient.
title: Very helpful guest services staff
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, especially with an upgrade to an Executive Suite, which I highly recommend if you are staying with children. The guest services staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. The staff member who brought up our luggage offered to fill our ice bucket, and told us about a refrigerator rental option of which we were not aware.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is HUGE!! Maybe a bit to big to efficiently care for all guest needs.
title: My Dallas Experience
comment: My experience with this hotel was not as pleasant as expected. I arrived expecting to have the basics such as fridge and mircrowave; but was hit with $20 charge for the use of a fridge (which I paid as I needed one). Upon entering the room I was met with dust everywhere. I had to dust the furniture before I could actuallly unpack. My safe did not work; it took 1 day before it was finally fixed; I opted to GO GREEN and not request room service each day as the plackard requested and stated I would receive points. Upon check out I was notified that I had to OPT into this at check-in; however, it was never mentioned to me at check-in. I had to request toilet tissue on my first day as they failed to replace the previous roll. On 2 occassions we stopped at the concierge only to find that they were not available at that time. Then when I went to use the guest laundry that was another unsatisfactory experience. Change machine did not work; the detergent machine was not working; the dryer did not work. I did not have an overall excitement about this hotel. but it served the purpose while I was on official travel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location on Florida's West coast for great sunsets, easy access north to Clearwater and South to St. Pete with lots of restaurants and activities within easy driving distance. 45 min drive from Tampa International. Jolley Trolley available. Very quiet, family friendly beach. Pool is not that large, but it is a short, enjoyable walk to a really nice beach. It will never be Trunk Bay with crystal clear Carribean waters but just as nice as Myrtle Beach or similar location state-side.
title: Wonderful, relaxing getaway!
comment: Stayed at Belvoir Sand Key from 6/1/12- 6/8/12 and had a great experience. We began travel as a family in [YEAR-7] and have stayed at several Grandbourne resorts and hotels for our summer vacations and all have been wonderful, but the Belvoir Sand Key is THE friendliest, most polite and cordial staff we have ever encountered!!! I don't care who we saw, be it a maintenance tech passing by in the hall, housekeeping, pool staff, front desk staff or any of the wait staff in the restaurants and Club Lounge, we were always met with a genuine smile and friendly greeting and a deep desire to satisfy our every need.

title: Front Desk needs improvement
comment: I've stayed here many times, usually it's fine but expensive. This last week's visit was very unsatisfactory. The check in line at the front desk was huge and there was only ONE agent!!! I arrived at about 9:30 pm Monday June 4th. I waited about 10 minutes, decided to run across the street and get a soup, came back line was worse. Waited 35 minutes. THe ONE person at the desk got NO help from others, she was repeatedly asked by people in line to go get help. Many other staff were milling about and no one helped her. I then didn't get the room I had asked for, and decided to just forget it, not worth going back down. Really disaapointing., The Grandbourne elite desk had two people and no line and they didn't offer their help either.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful pool, adjacent to one of the pristine beaches on the Gulf of Mexico.
title: Great Hotel and Location
comment: This Belvoir is located near to many fine restaurants, and has a beautiful sandy beach. It is also close to many activites in the Clearwater area.

title: excellent, but 2 problems
comment: Excellent comfort, club lounge breakfast and refreshments, service. Would have rated 5 stars, except: (1) elevator signal too loud- echoes down the hall and disturbs sleep

everyoneShouldKnow: Belvoir At The Falls' personalized and outstanding service that always exceeds ones' expectations.
title: An Outstanding Hotel In Every Area
comment: Belvoir At The Falls has enhanced its facilities to match its outstanding service in every area. A new Link by Belvoir Business Center has four computer terminals in an attractive setting near Starbucks. The new Core Performance Fitness Center provides the very latest in fitness equipment. Its Jade Room for breakfast has expanded its offerings such as fruit filled crepes.

title: 2 Day NY stay
comment: Hi - I loved the location of this hotel- Off times square but very accessible. However , the room left a little to be desired. The furniture, TV etc were acceptable but, I had 2 problems

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is very large and can be very confusing when trying to get around. This should be shared with the guess on check in.
title: Customer Service
comment: For the most part customer service was great. The problem I experienced was with the AC. My room was at 72 degrees when I arrived on that Sunday and remain that way until Thursday. I called twice and the electricians did come up but I only felt cool air when I called the second time. I spoke with the Representative in peron on Wednesday and she told me she would send someone up and they never came on Thursday I received a call asking if my AC was working correctly. At that point I was tired of trying and did not respond and the hotel had a stale smell.

title: This Hotel needs major upgrades
comment: Our check-in was fantastic. Very friendly, easy and went smoothly considering we where at a 3 day State Convention with over 5000 people. When we got to the room it was late. We unpacked got ready for bed and discovered the TV didn't work. Front desk sent someone right away and fixed it. He was very nice. He gave us coupons for a free breakfast the next morning. The next morning the TV went out again. We called the front desk to let them know. We were at convention until 9pm got back to our room and TV was still not fixed, room was not cleaned. We call the front desk again, they sent the same guy up to fix it. He was very very nice, fixed it and left. Same thing happened again the next day too. We finally gave up on it. The toilet and bathtub needs to be replaced. I'm sure they were clean but they were so stained that it looked really bad. I thought the price for the room was very over priced for the condition it was it. The prices in the dining room was outrages. The room was very quiet but house keeping never changed our sheets. This is a great location for the convention center but it needs work. The staff was so friendly and we enjoyed talking with them. The valet was fantastic as were the night tech that fixed our TV all those times.

title: Unable to sleep due to beeping in hallway
comment: In general the hotel was as expected. There was a cleaning rag left in my room, but the room was otherwise clean.

title: Very nice stay
comment: I stayed at the hotel for a conference and brought my family along. We all enjoyed the good room, location, and time away from things. Highly recommend the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: To check their bill carefully for extra charges.
title: Needs Improvement
comment: Make sure you look over your bill carefully. Even though I didn't use anything from the minibar, I had touched a bottle of wine and tried to put it back in it's correct place, but was unable. Never tampered or opened it and explained it to the host who came to check the mini bar, but they still charged me the $33.30 for the bottle of wine. The front desk finally took it off my bill, but I didn't appreciate the host listening to what happened and still going ahead and charging me. Makes me wonder how many other people they've done this to.

title: Inconsistent
comment: On the evening of my arrival I had to change rooms at 10:00 PM, after calling for maintenance an hour and a half earlier. I had to call to have my new room keys delivered to me the next morning. Upon changing rooms, I tried to call guest services to change my wake-up call, there was no answer. I did however receive a wake up call two days later. Bags of trash were left in the hallways and uncollected garbage was strewn about near elevator banks for the first day and a half of my stay.

title: AWESOME STAFF!!!
comment: We just had a huge family reunion at the Belvoir and they went above and beyond in servicing our large groups needs. A few minor glitches were fixed quickly. Front desk staff always fast and friendly. The van drivers are like our FAMILY!! Paval, Raphael, Johnnie, Freddie always great us with smiles and hugs.

title: Dining While Staying at the Belvoir
comment: The hotel resturant and bar menus do not offer a multitude of choices, but what they do offer are good. There aren't a lot of choices for dinning that are within walking distance of the hotel, in my opinion; however, there are a lot of breakfast and lunch facilities at the Mall of America.

title: Not recommended
comment: I strongly recommend that people do not stay at this hotel. The location is right on the boundary of a commercial district and a very rundown part of Baltimore. Sadly, the hotel suffers badly from this. The inner harbor is the place to stay. I stayed in another hotel from the Grandbourne chain right after this and the contrast was striking. This hotel is also very "tired". During my stay there was demolition work across the street and the windows totally failed to block the sound, which started at 6am. Valet parking is exorbitantly priced. The one positive I can report is the staff, who were all friendly and helpful, despite being a union workforce.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very nice on the inside, the atrium is beautiful!
title: Great hotel!
comment: Our stay was great, the staff is well educated about surroundings for those of us from out of state. The restaurant food was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's 'almost' in Tribeca...barely, and can be a bit noisy.
title: Great housekeeping, so-so front desk
comment: I've stayed here before, so figured I knew what to expect.

everyoneShouldKnow: Building metro very close so if stop is nearby it should be a big plus.
title: 2 night review
comment: Had 2 different rooms when we stopped at Tyson's on our way to PA, then came back through. Common problems were bad bathroom lighting, 2 minimum towels in room (in fact first room did not have washcloths and when will they learn that women usually need an extra towel for hair), and no constantly running fan system so the fan was on for two minutes, then off for five all night. On the plus side rooms were clean.and newly renovated although first bed was pretty lumpy.

title: Very good hotel and staff is excellent!
comment: The staff is great, they were very helpful with everything! Hotel overall is very clean and nice!

everyoneShouldKnow: This property overbooks and does not provide adequate lodging for disadvantaged guests
title: Unprofessional Policies and Staff
comment: I was speaking at a large conference hosted at the Belvoir Gunter hotel and had made a guaranteed reservation several weeks in advance for a two night stay. Upon my arrival at approximately 9 pm the night before I was to speak at the conference, I was told by the front desk that there were "no rooms available," in spite of my guaranteed reservation, and that I was being bumped to another nearby hotel. Despite my protestations, the unsympathetic front desk clerk with a pasted-on fake smile began the process of giving me a voucher to the new hotel only to find out midstream that it had no rooms available either. They sent me to another hotel on the other side of downtown that was dilapidated, filthy and completely substandard. I returned to the Gunter and demanded a better alternative. After 20 minutes of calling, the manager on duty shrugged and said I had no other choice. At which point I called my business travel advisor who said there were plenty of rooms available at the hotel next door (the one they originally planned to send me to). Either the Gunter had no pull with this hotel, or they were unwilling to pay a higher rate--even though I was the one being inconvenienced. To add insult to injury, while I was arguing with the front desk, more than a dozen flight attendants and pilots breezed in (by now it was after 10:30 pm), checked in and were given rooms. Obviously the Belvoir Gunter valued the repeat business of the flight crews over my business, even though I am a senior executive with a national company with over 40,000 employees. The manager on duty the following day told me that this overbooking happens "frequently" and that dealing with it is "his least favorite part of the job." This hotel seems to have an aggressive overbooking policy, which hurts its customers. To their partial credit, they comped my room the second night with a suite. I was glad they saved my company money the second night, after me having to pay a higher rate to move to the new hotel the first night, but it did little to soothe my extreme exasperation and aggravation from the night before. It was a shame, because the suite and decor was decent when I finally got a room. However, this can't overcome the extremely poor and unprofessional customer service I experienced. I travel regularly and to San Antonio frequently, but this was my first and last stay at the Gunter.

title: Great Grandbourne Hotel south of DCA
comment: What a nice full service hotel south of the airport. The staff represents the Grandbourne Brand so well, probably the best ive seen staying in Grandbourne hotels for years. Unlike other Grandbourne properties ive been too, I really liked how upon checkin the staff acknowledged my status as a gold member, it makes you feel appreciated for all the hard work it takes just to become gold.They even upgraded me to the Club level was the absolute best! I chose this hotel because of the suites and their seperate living area. Theres even a door in between the room and the living room with a pullout sofa. Even better, the bathroom is connected to both the living room and the bedroom, so you dont have to pass thru the other early in the morning to use the bathroom. Hotel has 10 levels, Club level is on the 9th floor, and restaurant/bar, fitness center pool, and a courtyard. Parking is safe and secure underground. Of all the friendly staff, the two that stood out was Max and the female supervisor at the Front Desk whos first name starts with a D(cant remember the name). I like how they remember little details about your requests and followed up on them.

title: Disappointed
comment: Disappointed with the cleanliness of the room -- during my stay, only the bed was made. The bathroom nor the room was cleaned. While the staff was initially friendly upon check-in, the remainder of the stay found the staff to be very inattentive and, at times, rude and short. Other than the convenient location to the airport, I would not recommend staying at this hotel. Very disappointing for a Grandbourne property.

everyoneShouldKnow: right on the beach great pool
title: Made a great choice
comment: our first night we were awaken by repairs. In the am I asked to switch rooms and we were moved to a beautiful cabana room. The a la carte breakfast was great!

title: Smelled like mildew
comment: Good: Staff very helpful, supplied extra towels and tried to accommodate for the poor internet service. Horrible: The room smelled like mildew, mold/dirt covered the tops of the curtains. The couch, chair, and foot stool all had tears in them. Couldn't print boarding passes. We had just washed all our clothes from our timeshare, and had to wash them all again when we got home because the smelled like mildew. Suit case had to be placed outside. Shuttle van had no a/c and was in poor condition, smelled like it was on fire. DON'T STAY HERE until after an extensive upgrade. Definitely not Grandbourne Quality

title: Adequate and functional
comment: The top drawer to the dresser was broken. The beds were very comfortable as I've come to expect. The soaps would not lather when used. More than adequate number of towels. Did not really recognize me a an BPG member as other properties have.

title: Great hotel in great location
comment: This Belvoir exceeded my expectations by providing a warm and welcoming experience with full recognition of my BPG status. The staff goes above and beyond and the roof deck offers one of the more beautiful views of the city and empire state building you'll find in NYC. I'd recommend it to anyone.

title: they dont care
comment: The hotel does not care about you. When showed up at the hotel it was a mess. Standing in the middle of the street when the only (one) valet was talking with someone. I asked to valet my car and habe a bell get my bags. I was told to self park. So i ran inside ti get one of the bells. Not one of the 7 that was standing around could help me. They said leave your key with him and completely ignored my request for a bell. So i drove around the Conner to park which was 51 for over night as opposed to the 50 for valet listed on the web site. So i carried my bags ( no bell to help). In the side door as i walk in no one said welcome as i walked in or held the door with all my bags. No line for BPG memers. The lady who checked me in was rude upon asking for two doubles as opposed To the one king i booked i got the vibe that i was asking her to move mountains not change my room type. The room was nice, comfortable and cleen. It had a good location to times square. Overall not worth the money

title: Best fitness center
comment: Hotel is in great location, accessible to many restaurants and bars. This hotel has an excellent fitness center - a full size room with 15-20 weight machines and an equal number of cardio machines, plus a large dumbbell set. One of the best hotel gyms I've seen.

title: Oops
comment: BPG made a mistake in my reservations. The staff at Cuyahoga Falls came to my rescue, espeically a young man named Vince. He knew exactly what to do, made the necessary calls and actually put me up in the Penthouse and upgraded my status so I could use the clubroom. Thank you

title: JFK REUNION
comment: STAYED @ THE HOTEL FOR A REUNION OF THE USS JFK. STAFF WAS GREAT, AND THE HOTEL WAS SPECTACULAR.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to LAX, excellent service by front desk staff
title: Very nice hotel near LAX
comment: I stayed only one night following a week of meetings elsewhere in CA, to catch an early flight home the next morning. The front desk staff was very friendly and made me feel welcome. They upgraded me to a corner suite (due to my platinum status). I wish I was staying longer to really enjoy the room and the other hotel facilities. I will definitely return to this hotel when my travels take me near Los Angeles. Keep up the great work.

title: GREAT hotel, poor clubroom attendant
comment: Very nice clean hotel with a great lobby and cleaning staff. The problem came about with the woman working the BPG Clubroom in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful club lounge food. Terrific customer service.
title: Terrific Service - FANTASTIC food in club lounge
comment: This is a great little property. They recently renovated the lobby, which really opened and freshened up the lobby. It's much brighter now. The rooms are what you would expect from a nice Belvoir. Very comfortable beds. My one little suggestion for improvement is that I don't find the wing back chairs particularly comfortable. I think for a hotel room a club chair with ottoman is better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pull up at the front to unload, then bring your car to the back parkade.
title: nice view
comment: Once again received a room with a lovely view of Lake Superior. Beds were comfy and room was clean. One problem was the hallway noise late night. I wish guests would be more considerate of others when they are returning to their rooms late at night. Maybe the exterior room doors are too thin?

title: One-night Stay
comment: Excellent location to downtown - lots of nearby Starbucks. Close to airport commuter train. Bed very comfortable as was entire room. Extended check-out an hour for us. Would stay again if using Grandbourne points.

title: Good business option in Orange County
comment: Central location and new room product. When i am traveling and have simple business needs, this is a great option- I like the small feel of the hotel and easy access to area businesses- while close enough to Disneyland to have some evening entertainment and dining options. This is a very comfortable hotel for business when you are looking for the basics.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not much life going on outside the hotel. Need to travel to really enjoy Dallas.
title: This is a Belvoir hotel?
comment: Maybe I'm spoiled with 4 star hotels, but I was expecting so much more from a downtown Dallas Belvoir hotel. The rooms were small. The bathroom seemed to be just a little bit bigger than an airplane lav. The A/C was outdated and did not keep the room cool. One would expect to be very cold at 65F, but i was in shorts and t-shirt. The pictures on the website didn't quite match up with the actual hotel. Now the staff was very nice and helpful, and the bed was comfortable (had some good sleep).

title: worst night sleep
comment: I stayed at this hotel to be close to the airport for an early morning flight. I spend most of the night awake trying to get comfortable in a bed that had to be the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in. After a few hours I ended up sleeping in the chair. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good nights sleep based on my experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best Pool I have been to
title: Excellent Belvoir
comment: I have stayed in many Belvoir hotels and this was among the best ones. The resort was clean and the location was great. The pool was the best part of the resort since we have young children. If you want to go to the beach, I would highly recommend taking a trip up to Bahia Honda State Park (MM 37) vs. the beach here (which had lots of seaweed on it).

title: Absolutely Awesome
comment: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting. The staff was fabulous. The room experience was flawless and the food was wonderful, I think the renovation is really great but the people at the hotel were even better. I will be back soon!

title: Location, location, location!
comment: This was our second stay at this hotel. Great location. Right on 16th Street Mall. Great shopping and restaurants/bar in the area. However, the hotel bars, 15/Fifty AND Mix were great. Would not have had to leave the property! Rooms clean. Trevor recognized our anniversary at check-in and gave us a bottle of champagne! Gabby in the 15/Fifty bar was very friendly and a great mixologist!

everyoneShouldKnow: Secluded drive to it for about a mile.
title: Relaxation
comment: This was the first time that i stayed here and it was dor my wife's 40th birthday celebration, rooms exceeded expectations staff friendly and accomodating, prehistory culrurald relevance everywhere, a great place for romantic getaways and family stay-cations.

everyoneShouldKnow: adjoing rooms are noisy but most of the staff is very friendly.
title: Noisy Neighbors in 1236
comment: Everyone was very nice except for the woman in the Club Lounge. She was sitting and reading the newspaper when I entered for breakfast 12 minutes before it ended. She was visibly put out and there was only a few scrambled eggs, one slice of bread, no bacon, very little OJ, no yogurt and a few pieces of melon left. I had to request she get more bacon which she did reluctantly and kept repeating, "We close in 5 minutes". If you close in 5 minutes (which was really 10-11, then I would think that mean you are open. She DID have her tip plate displayed! Other people came and she was very upset.

title: Belvoir Novi
comment: Excellent facility and location

everyoneShouldKnow: FRIENDLY, PLEASANT AND KNOWLEDGEABLE STAFF THAT WERE WILLING TO SHARE A CONCERN IN HELPING MY WIFE AND i.
title: Pleasant and Relaxing Stay
comment: My wife and I recently had an opportunity to stay at the Belvoir-Charleston Airport and found the staff from our check in to our departure truly pleasant to offer their services. We dined in the sports bar, good food, very pleasant waitress and the chef actually made himself available to check on our meal, what a surprise. We found the shuttle service prompt and our driver offered a bit of local history and answered questions my wife had on local shopping at the Tanger's Mall nearby... We look forward to returning to Charleston and will certainly stay at the Belvoir Airport location. Thanks for the memories!

title: Good room, bad food
comment: I was here recently for a conference. While the room with clean and comfortable, the food was not good at all - particularly lunch and dinner. Poor selection of healthy foods and fairly tasteless overall. The shining expection was breakfast for which I had a delicious omelet three mornings in a row.

everyoneShouldKnow: Smaller hotel but with lots of character in a historic part of town.
title: Renovated Rooms are Great - History at the Front Door
comment: I was in town for a large conference (June [YEAR-0]) and was pleasantly surprised by the Belvoir Society Hill. I enjoyed having so much history right outside the front door and its very easy to walk anywhere downtown from the hotel (though it will take 15 mins or so) Cabs were plentiful if you needed to get someplace and didnt want to walk.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a lot closer to Disneyland than you might think
title: Great value at this spotless hotel
comment: The title pretty much says it, this hotel is spotless and very affordable via starpoints (paid rates also are very reasonable from what I have seen). Staff is super friendly and helpful. Was kind of bummed that there wasn't a room available on the BPG floor. Non-BPG room was similar except it's view was of a big vent and it had no fridge. Still, the room was very comfortable. This is now my go-to Disney area hotel.

title: Great staff here
comment: They accommodated every need and were extremely friendly. The location of the hotel is very convenient, saddled between 16th St. Mall and the Capitol. The fitness center is also much larger than any other hotel's I've been to and is well-equipped.

title: As always the Belvoir Suites in Cuyahoga Falls is a spectacular hotel at its finest
comment: My husband and I live about 35 minutes from the hotel and we decided last minute that we needed to get away for a night and have a break away from our two young children. The staff were very accomodating, the atmosphere is cheek but also comfortable. In the suites my husband was able to relax and watch a basketball game while I got ready in a seperate room. Love this hotel, and would not chose anywhere else to stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Would not recommend staying at this hotel
title: Do not stay
comment: I am a loyal Belvoir hotel visitor. This was probably the worst property that I have stayed at in the last 2 years. Check in was long and room not ready. Valet slow and very disorganized. Would not reccomend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel is right across the street from Sesame Street. Very accomodating to children.
title: Very accommodating to your needs
comment: Though the hotal could not find my original room request; the substitute was adequate and the additional amenities were wonderful. The breakfast buffet has a wide variety of choices and the pool is clean and warm.

everyoneShouldKnow: Peaceful and friendly with great location and parking
title: love the space and decor
comment: Overall extremely pleased. We were there on a busy event weekend (sand soccer) and could tell the staff were moving well to keep up. Our housekeeping was thorough and the public area kept amazingly well with plenty of towels at the pools and hallways cleared. We obviously had one of the recently completed rooms as it had no shower curtain and it took a bit too long to get someone up there (10 pm) but she was so kind and friendly and conscientious it worked out okay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located at the south end of the Ponchatrain causeway, small but efficient.
title: Great points stay
comment: Stayed one night on points. Very convenient hotel, staff was very friendly and offered alternative parking since the garage was full due to a party in the hotel bar. Room service was very prompt. Room met expectations, did not use internet. Overall, very pleasant experience and I will stay at this hotel again.

title: Comfort Level of Room
comment: Stayed at your hotel with a Conference, the first room was in disrepair, with what could have been water damage in the bathroom and the door on the closet was broken and did not work, actually at an angle. The room for the price was small and cramped. From a comfort point of view, the AC system did not keep the room cool and I had to order a Fan after a couple of days just to be able to sleep. I discussed this with a couple of colleagues and they had the same problem. Your maintenance staff took a look, but would only say that it was working as it should have been. Never got cool. The hotel itself is beautiful, the location is excellent and the staff helpful. For the price, not impressed with the rooms and their comfort level.

everyoneShouldKnow: When there are several conventions going on it's almost impossible to eat at the hotel as they only have 2 restaurants and the hours are not great. There is a Subway outside the building but it's really small. Other than that you are almost out of luck.
title: Beds are great!
comment: Overall my experience was great. The rooms are usually really clean however this time the bathroom could have been better. The king size bed is really comfortable and were the pillows. The appearance of the hotel is neat and clean and the staff are very polite.

everyoneShouldKnow: The aim to please great customer service!!!
title: 5 stars!
comment: I enjoyed my stay at your hotel! It was a great value, great customer service and perfect location! I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and i look forward to staying at your property in the near future.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The Hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice. The best part of the hotel is the pool area. Big outdoor pool with wirlpool. The waterfall and fish pond were a bonus. Great Fitness area. The Pizza Hut in the lobby was great and they stayed open late for those of us that attended the concert at Cowboys Stadium.

title: Great hotel in convenient location!
comment: I've stayed here 4 times in the past 8 months. This hotel is conveniently located to everything in Dallas. The rooms are modern, spacious and clean. The hotel staff is very responsive. Great customer service! They recognize me when I check-in.

title: Elevators needs urgent attention
comment: Very unsafe having only one elevator available for all these crowd, there were too many people on the lobby and no control.

title: Nice hotel and got a good night sleep but...
comment: It's a nice hotel and the location is good for the college. It's not to far from 80 which makes it a good option from the highway hotels. But, they need to get with the times and stop charging for Wi-fi.

title: Great Location !!
comment: Excellent location for getting around . Literally a 5 min walk to NHL Hockey , 15 minutes to MLB and 25 min to ARCH !! Train drops you off directly across street and makes for easy access , no car is really needed for a great sports weekend

title: Fix the WiFi
comment: The WiFi was expensive at $10/$15 but it was extremely intrusive. On essentially every new page, it posted a ribbon at the top selling higher bandwidth (even though I had already paid $15 for the 'fast' speed). I travel a lot and have been at lots of hotels and I've never had to deal with WiFi that was interfering so much in my browsing. Nearly all hotels have free WiFi. Get on board Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very disorganized, poor management practices, lack of training.
title: Last visit
comment: This will be our last visit to Belvoir Arlington. We tried to check into room at 2:30 and were told that room was not ready but would be soon. Did not get checked into room until 5:00!!! The whole time we waited with dozens of others we were never offered a water, a discount, a coupon for food, nothing..... The management was obviously overwhelmed did not know what to do. It was a disaster! Missed part of the concert that we were in town to see!!!!

title: GM and Staff
comment: Everything was excellent! Nice job!

title: Older property
comment: My room felt dirty and old. The bed was not very comfortable and the remote didn't always work. Not worth $109 a night.

title: Home away from Home
comment: I have probably stayed here no less than 100 nights within the last year because of work here in Miami. I have to say the stay is absolutely great. The valets greet me by name. The front desk, specially Torri P. is great, she always has everything done for me and greet me by name. And the guys in the bar area, Yury, Victor and Miquel are great. I have probably had everymeal on their menu a few times and its always consistant.

title: Great Place
comment: I checked in and had two rooms. (I had to ask if my BPG number was listed). One of the rooms (536) smelled horribly of smoke and the person that was sent up accused us of having done something. If he was joking, it did not come across that way. All that was done was a little air freshener. My room door (537) was ill fitting and had to be slammed to shut it and was very hard to open. Your evening staff of Michelle and Mohammed are great and very personable. I give them high marks. Your restaurant is way over priced and $2.00 for a can of soda - really??? Your parking is also a bit of a problem.

everyoneShouldKnow: You don't need to bring anything but yourself, a bathing suit and a few clothes for dinner somewhere. It is all there for you.
title: Certainly beat my expectations
comment: We only spent one night in Myrtle on our way from Charleston to Charlotte. I haven't been in Myrtle in 40 years and had heard it had changed sooo much and not necessarily for the better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Has a lot to do within walking distance.
title: A good hotel for an overnight stay!
comment: I've stayed at the Belvoir AC on more than a few occasions and for an overnight stay it's a good choice. This hotel has great city views and is within walking distance of a lot of shops and restaurants. If you plan on going to the casinos you can take a quick drive (under 5 mins.) or grab a cab. I have never experienced bad customer service and am always greeted with a friendly smile at check in. My only negative comment about the hotel is that the property already seems to look a bit dated and most rooms I have stayed in are starting to show some wear and tear. I hope a remodel is in the near future for this hotel.

title: Belvoir CARLSBAD CA
comment: Had a great time at this very accomodating and cofortable hotel. Service was excellant. Food very good. Had a great SLEEP. Great workout at the gym. Glad I used Grandbourne.

title: Convenient location to MIA but needs fixing up
comment: I have stayed at this hotel before but only for a couple of days. In my most recent stay, I had to change rooms three times and then I changed hotels.

title: Clean and Quiet
comment: I am very picky and have no complaints about this hotel. The staff was helpful in providing directions to the thru-way and even helped me find the hotel when I took a wrong turn.

title: Excellent hotel and staff
comment: Special thanks to restaurant staff: Matthew, Ludmila, et al! We traveled with a toddler, and they were very accommodating to our needs.

title: Critical failure
comment: Upon arriving for check-in at 3:30 pm on (I was told that 3 pm was the allowed time), I was informed that our room wasn't ready. There were about 2 dozen people on the wait list ahead of us and they would call my cell phone when the room became available. Since we were due to go to a concert in an hour and planned to get ready in the room, this left us with the only option of dressing and preparing (wife's make-up) in the lobby bathrooms. My good-natured wife soldiered through a packed bathroom to get ready, but heard a very large number of very irate women voicing their collective displeasure at this shared discomfort. I finally got the phone call that the room was ready a full two hours later while at the concert. How does a hotel of this size not staff the housekeeping adequately for what was surely an expected full house? The place was packed and I doubt it was a surprise.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking and Internet are NOT included in the price of the room.
title: Shocked by the fees
comment: The location of this hotel is a HUGE plus along with the comfort of the room, however, the disclosure of applicable fees were NOT discussed when reserving my room. I was not aware of the parking/Internet fees until my arrival. The quoted price that I received was within budgetary restraints but once additional fees were added e.g. parking and internet, the price was comparable to equivalent hotels in the area. Last but not least, I was quoted the government rate as I am retired military but the agent that assisted me during check in charged me the standard rate and the matter took days to be corrected. Had the fees been disclosed at the time of reservation, I would have rated this hotel much higher.

title: GReat people, great hotel
comment: From the minute we arrived, which was late, we were treated as royalty. The staff was extremely accomodating and the front desk had all the answers. We felt right at home.

title: Bad Customer Service
comment: Given the fact that this hotel has a stable market of conventions and conference, it has grown to be complacent in providing the excellent quality of customer service a Grandbourne hotel is known for. Their staff fail to take ownership of their mistakes and are very inefficient. I have been staying in this hotel for the last 11 months.

title: Club Lounge
comment: The friendliness and service in the club lounge was outstanding...welcomed and recognized every time I walked in. Also your IT department went above and beyond when our computers would not logon. "JD" was great on the phone, and then two gentlemen had to come and replace the modem. And this on the craziest weekend of AKon. You all were super!!

title: Great Hotel and Location
comment: From the check-in to the check-out the staff was very friendly and accomodating. The location is perfect to park the car for the weekend and walk the town. So many shops and restuarants to explore. The only issue we had was the champagne I ordered to be in the room, was not there and was never delivered. So after an hour I called and cancelled the order. That was a little disappointing and this had happened to my parents 4 years ago so that has not improved. (Need to work on this.)

title: Hotel needs improvement
comment: The hotel looks old, the people are very rue specially h valet parking,and the front desk personel are very unprofessional. Also he location it's very confusing and hard to find.

everyoneShouldKnow: Valet parking is $30 per day. We parked in the parking garage on Houston street (across the street from the hotel) for $9 per day. There is another parking garage on the other side of the hotel on Travis street also.
title: Awesome Hotel
comment: This hotel is in a great location. Basically, it is one block from the Riverwalk, a short walk to the Alamo and a couple of doors down from the Childrens museum. The staff is very professional and accomodating.

title: Great Stay
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Music City on 2 different occasions over the course of a week. Both stays were delightful - the staff was quite friendly, our rooms were clean and well maintained and the location was ideal for our travels.

title: Nothing Special
comment: The room was small with 2 double beds which were not comfortable with our 2 children. The bathroom was old and in desperate need of updating. Not what I would expect in Chicago. The location was great but when we asked to check out 45 minutes late, they said NO. Not very service oriented, when you are a Grandbourne Member. Bring your own bottled water or expect to pay $7+ for each in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: That it is in a very noisy area, the walls are thin, and the restaurant's food at this point is pretty dismal.
title: Deluge Restaurant
comment: This hotel is situated ideally for La Guardia travelers, and the staff is so nice and accomodating. Room 1207 met my expectations, although my husband had a shower in a clogged tub, and was not happy at all. The walls are quite thin, making it difficult for exhausted international travelers to rest when the adjoining rooms are filled with noisy revelers and the elevator dings about once per minute. The real problem is the food in the restaurant, Deluge. What a beautiful atmosphere, and such nice staff members, especially Anthony, our server! But the food was just about inedible...worst Chinese food I have ever had, and so overpriced. You need a new chef. I am not expecting this review to be published, I just thought you need to know this. Thank you very much.

title: Hawaii [YEAR-0] Vacation
comment: We stayed in the Sherton for 4 nights and 5 days. This hotel is Beautiful and we had a wonderful time in this resort. The pool area and the beach area at this hotel are gorgeous and fun!! The poolside restraunt/bar was also a fun hangout area. Staff was wonderful and our room was cleaned very well daily. Would highly recommend this hotel for vacation! Also, I do not have kids, but this hotel is Kid Friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff strives very hard to please.
title: outstanding staff
comment: The staff went out of their way to accommodate my special request. Very enjoyable stay there.

title: Nice hotel
comment: We always stay at this hotel but this time we were disappointed with the front desk staff. The lady that checked us in was rude. I asked about upgrading to the club level for access to the club lounge for $20. She stated that only platinum member could do that. We have always had access to the lounge. The lady in the morning when we checked out was very nice and said that we should have been able to do the upgrade for the additional fee.

title: loved my stay
comment: great hotel

title: Spectacular Experience
comment: Upon checking in I was disappointed there were no upgrades available, but encouraged that checking back the next day I might be able to find one. The room was pretty small and smelled of fresh paint, however that didn't matter in the long run. There was a beautiful gift shop on site, a fun and exciting scene downstairs at the bar and the service by the senior members of the staff was next to none! We had an issue with the gate not opening for the parking garage and the valet did not handle it the way I would have liked, and when the head of the valets asked about my stay later and I told him he told me he would personally follow up with the overnight valet attendant, encouraged me to report the fresh paint smell and the smaller room to the desk and request a room in the previously renovated tower. I did so, was immediately moved to another room and treated like royalty. I appreciated the service, the smiles, and the eagerness to please from the entire staff. I would definitely go back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is very near the airport, but right on the water!
title: Room good, but facilities messy
comment: The hallway and common areas in the tower I stayed in needed a cleaning. They were not vacuumed and there was a good deal of trash lying around. We checked in at 4:30 and trash was still out and about the next morning.

title: THE WORST HOTEL MY FAMILY HAS EVER BEEN TOO
comment: THIS HOTEL THE ROOMS ARE SMALL! AND WE HAD TO SWITCH ROOMS BECAUSE OF ALL THE MOLD ON THE BATHROOM WALLS, AND THIS ROOM WAS JUST REMODELED WHAT A JOKE. THEN THE JOY UP GETTING EVERYTHING PACKED UP AND MOVED TO ANOTHER ROOM. WASTE OF 4 HOURS, THANKS THAT WAS ALOT OF FUN. OH AND THE FIRE DRILL ARE YOU KIDDING ME WE ALL HAD TO LEAVE OUR ROOMS FOR THE FIREMEN. WITH A CONVENTION GOING ON FOR MORE THAN 2,000 PEOPLE JUST FOR THAT ALONE. I DONT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANY ONE AND THE SERVICE WAS LIKE YEAH WHAT DO YOU WANT, REALLY FOR A 2 NIGHT STAY AND PAID OVER 300.00 FOR THAT ALONE ...OMG NEVER AGAIN. NO HAPPY PEOPLE AT THE FRONT DESK - JUST CHECK IN WITH THAT WHATEVER ATTITUDE, LIKE I WAS TAKING AWAY THERE LUNCH TIME? WHO KNOW'S AND REALLY WHO CARES. NEVER EVER WILL I SAY GO TO THIS HOTEL!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in the perfect location in Midtown between Times Square and Central Park.
title: Wonderful Update!
comment: This hotel looks fantastic! Every element of the guest room was new and it looked and felt completely different -- and better -- than the last time I was here. The mattress and bedding were just as comfortable as a Westin. The sofa was just the right size, there was a perfect amount of light. I really enjoyed the little table tucked next to the sofa which was small enough to be out of the way when I didn't need it and perfectly sized to hold my MacBook and my room service breakfast. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great, Comfortable hotel
comment: This was my first stay at the Overland Park Belvoir. While the hotel is very nice, comfortable and friendly staff, I did find the rooms to be noisy. I was right across from the ice machine and was kept awake by people using it at 1am! There was also some strange clanging noise every 5 minutes that I could not identify. Doors slamming was also an issue. Next time I will make sure and request a room at the end of the hall... I enjoyed the complimentary computer use in the lobby area. Nice amenity for those of us wanting to check emails quickly, etc. Overall I enjoyed my stay, but did not get a good nights sleep! =)

title: Hotel Staff
comment: Staff in this hotel excellent without exception. Bellmen,doormen,wait staff, front desk in particular. Special mention to Trudy who went out of her way to have an item I had left in the hotel returned to me. Minor issue, we had no tv the first night we were there and they were unable to fix it until the next day. Because of the great staff we would definitely recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Decent rooms, terrible parking and a club lounge that feels like a day-care
title: Nice water views, terrible parking charges
comment: This is a big hotel with two sections in the main building and a completely separate section across the parking lot. Facilities are good, with 2 pools and a decent gym. Also restaurant and bar. I had an upgraded room as a Platinum member which was nice and roomy, with standard bath. Service was a little spotty. Front desk forgot to ask what I wanted for my Platinum amenity, and couldn't answer some basic questions I had at check-in. I asked to speak to a manager and waited close to 15 minutes for someone to appear. Called for a robe and it never came - had to call a second time. The club lounge was nicely decorated and roomy, with good view, okay snacks in the evening and better choices at breakfast. No drinks specials, seemed like regular menu from downstairs. It seems that families frequent this hotel so there are lots of unsupervised children in the lounge - and that's with the parents present! Running, playing, squealing, etc. That was both in the evening and in the morning. Certainly doesn't make for a business like, adult atmosphere.

title: Another excellent stay
comment: This is our third time here and each time has been great. Great location and very good facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to stay for cma fest
title: Great limo service
comment: Al our limo driver for the hotel really made this trip to Nashville the most memorable by far. He was available by phone or text and always out front of the hotel when we needed him. He offered to take us to see the country singers homes and to Kix Brooks winery. Ive only come to Nashville for CMA Fest but visiting the stars homes and spending the afternoon at the winery was the most enjoyable part of the trip for me. He took a million pictures of us with our phones.  He took us to downtown, midtown, to and from the concerts, and to the airport in addition to the tours. I preferred using him over a cab because he was the same price, if not cheaper, he could be easily reached trusted, and he gave us the inside scoop on where to go. Al was extremely accomodating, polite, affordable and friendly. He was also highly recommended by other regulars staying at Belvoir. I can't wait to come back to Nashville next year and take advantage of his services.

title: Club level amenities disappointing
comment: Hotel is very clean and staff is very good. A/C in room has a very loud fan that cycles on and off constantly. Club amenities disappointing - not the standard usually met at BPG hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is outstanding at this hotel
title: Great hotel to stay ay in Anchorage
comment: By far the best choice for Anchorage. This hotels rate among the best in service and you always feels welcome here.

title: Great location and a good hotel
comment: I like this hotel. It just needs some tweaks.

title: Love the hotel and...
comment: I do enjoy staying here. Location is wonderful and the bed is fabulous. The only thing I'd like to mention is I've stayed twice and the drain in the tub is VERY SLOW and the bar staffing didn't accommodate the number of people there. So service is very slow and sometimes i feel like i have to be rude to get a drink. I know to bring cash if i use the restaurant because if you use credit service is really slow.

title: Quiet,Clean,Great Staff
comment: Once again the West Shore Belvoir and staff were fantastic. I make frequent business trips to Tampa and I choose this facility every time. Never a bad experience. If I had to make one suggestion-get HBO.

title: Solid and Dependable
comment: Short overnight stay. Quick check-in; Platinum status immediately acknowledged and offered points for amenity. "Upgraded" to Club Level -- hotel has limited suites so these upgrades are few and far between. Rooms are on the smaller side, but are comfortable and well laid out. AC works well -- definite bonus. Acceptable gym facility. Solid and dependable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Just a few minutes from major areas of DC
title: Overall very good experience
comment: Very friendly staff. Helpful and attentive. Clean and comfortable rooms. Convenient to DC

everyoneShouldKnow: Outdated compared to the other hotel in the area
title: Need major update
comment: Stayed at the hotel last week due to convention hotel assignment. Front desk and valet are were friendly. The hotel looked very out dated and need major update. My room had old carpet that looks dirty. It also had individual air conditioner by the window which is so noisy that I had to put ear plug on to sleep. When I left at 6 am to catch my flight, there was no bellman. I got onto this taxi and driver didn't even get out of the car to help me with the luggage and same when we got to the airport. He continued to pressure me to pay cash when the credit card machine was there in front of me. Please do not use those drivers that always find a way to pressure passengers to pay cash!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff do make guests feel welcome.
title: Best Staff Ever!
comment: The front desk clerk remembered my name for the two days we were there. The room service staff was outstanding. Everyone was helpful, friendly, polite, and very professional. We will stay at this hotel again, even though there was a leak in the ceiling the morning we left (maintenance was there before we checked out). Coffee in the lobby early in the morning was a definite bonus.

title: Midtown Delight.
comment: This is a very big and busy hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Maintenance personnel lack of periodic inspection inside the room.
title: Yucky
comment: Last year, I stayed at Le Meridien L'Etoile and Belvoir Airport in Paris. Last April, I stayed at Le Meridien Times Square. At both places, I had access to BPG guest lounge for breakfast - without asking. At this property, I had to pay $30 per day for this"privilege". After some cajoling, the front desk manager gave me free breakfast coupons. Very appreciated.

everyoneShouldKnow: Charming location within a very busy corridor adjacent to UCSD.
title: Very pleasant
comment: The setting is charming and the location adjacent to La Jolla Village Mall is excellent. I would have rated everything as "excellent," except the friendly dining service at Humphry's made a mistake and overcharged $5. (I didn't have time to correct this mistake, because I didn't notice until the next morning when I had a tight schedule to keep).

title: Good NY Location
comment: A good hotel in a great location.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location. parking is sub par, but free
title: Hotel has a good location
comment: Good location. Nice facility. Parking was below expectations but free.

title: Hotel is good
comment: Overall stay was very nice, however they do have many basement and first floor rooms so if this bothers you make sure you specify at check in.

title: The Place to Stay in San Antonio
comment: Great place, great location, outstanding staff.

title: Good downtown hotel in FW
comment: Four day stay during June. Good location on the fringe of downtown by the water garden. If you are in decent shape and its not too hot, you could walk anywhere downtown. That said, its a few blocks to the heart of downtown FW.

title: Top of the World in the Rainy City
comment: Outstanding experience. Great hotel in a great location. Very clean, very well maintained.

everyoneShouldKnow: Apparently too big to expect same level of treatment as at smaller Grandbournes
title: Great Remodeling! Forgot Soundproofing and How to Treat an Elite Guest
comment: The recent remodeling was fabulous! The lobby looked great, the rooms looked great (although ours was smallparticularly considering it was an upgrade). Elevators to upper floors were fastest I have ever seen (or heardthey whoosh!)

title: Belvoir San Diego
comment: The hotel has a nice location and the staff is very friendly, however, the service took too long. (i.e. Room Service took over an hour to deliver something to my room) No refrigerators in room. The shower has very low water pressure, could not wash my long hair.....

title: BEWARE!!
comment: I have stayed at this property many times considering my daughter is a UMich student. My most recent stay will probably be my last. I am a Grandbourne gold member and have never been treated so badly in my life. The staff would not give me the room I requested (we were three people and needed the extra bed) and even called me a liar! Finally at 11 P.M. after our family decided to split up and some were staying in my daughters dorm, they called and said a room with 2 beds had miraculously shown up!!! They also never apologized for screaming at me. After a call to the manager after check-out he said he would give us a few BPG points (which wasn't even the reason for the call) however I never received any!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, good gym facilities but you need your own lock for the lockers
title: Needs More Work
comment: The BPG room we stayed in was large and clean.

title: 5 Star Staff
comment: Whether its been a week or a couple of months between my stays the staff always remember me and often have everything ready for me as soon as I walk in the door. A special recognition to Elena an Zach. I see them more than anyone else and they exceed all expectations and are by far the best out of all hotels I've stayed at. I always look forward to coming to DC because I know I'll be staying in Alexandria and feel as close to home as I can when in the road.

title: Very nice breakfast buffet.
comment: It's been years since staying at this property. I think it has improved tremendously. The service all around was great. The breakfast buffet was very nice withFresg fruits, lean meats, light croissant, and delicious grits. I think offering exchange daily room service for extra BPG points is a great idea for the guest and the environment. I will be back.

title: not up to Belvoir standard
comment: -Amenities not supplied for Platinum member ( water in room, bathrobe, etc)

title: Good hotel - poor service
comment: The rooms were very nice and clean. Excellent design. The hotel bar was awful (long wait, bad drinks), we had a private event and the food was terrible, my Grandbourne number was never recorded.

title: Excellent Location
comment: The Belvoir is nicely appointed and very welcoming. Although it is undergoing some outside construction it didn't impact our stay in any way. Being on a high floor, combined with a great bed and pillows made for an awesome sleep. We picked the hotel based on the location, which was a short walk from Central Park and conveniently located to Radio City Music Hall, where Cirque du Soleil ZARKANA was playing. Overall very positive, however the hotel was apparently sold out the night before and they didn't have any clean rooms available when we checked in. We had a short wait in the lobby, no more than 15 minutes. The Microsoft experience has computers, free for use, wi-fi (also free) in the lobby and which we used to pick up email and check in/ print boarding passes for our return flights. Overall positive experience

title: Don't Use Your Suite Nights Here
comment: This hotel has a great central location and the club lounge is very nice. However, I was very disappointed in my room. I purchased a room with a river or lake view, and used my suite nights to upgrade to a room with a river or lake view. The "suite" was simply awful. It was on the 9th floor and looked out onto the roof and a huge HVAC unit. It was one of the recently redocorated rooms. There was no desk--but a desk chair by a dresser unit. There was a murphy bed that could not be put away in the living area--making it awkward to have business meetings in the suite. The coffee machine leaked with every use.

title: Just bad....
comment: I normally have great experiences in Grandbourne properties, but this one was just terrible.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are no shops/markets w/i walking distance so stock up before arriving. If there's an issue, ask & they'll fix it!
title: Beautiful BUT: Inconsistant
comment: We love:

everyoneShouldKnow: Filthy rooms and untrained housekeeping staff.
title: Unsanitary and very dirty rooms!!!
comment: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We arrived to our room and found the bathroom partially cleaned--toilet was filthy, carpets were not vacuumed (when housekeeping was contacted, they admitted that "we didn't have time to vacuum because it was very busy last week."), and a king size bed with only one pillow. The hotel reception, though polite, did not follow through on any requests for service. We asked for our room to be cleaned three times before anyone was sent up. The housekeeping staff is clearly overworked and underpaid. Lobby is the only part of the hotel that is acceptable.

title: Great Experience!
comment: I just returned from a two week business trip to Omaha. I have to start off by saying that I have been to Omaha several times befofre and this is the first time I have stayed at the Belvoir and it wont be my last!!! I have to start by saying that I will never stay at any other hotel. Business trips are not easy but the staff and the beauty of the hotel made it just that! The rooms were beautiful and inviting, the sweet sleeper bed AMAZING!! and the fitness center well I was there every single day for the two weeks thats how great it was -new machines fresh towels, the works. I have to say the best part was knowing that after making arrangements to have the free area shuttle they offer pick me up and drop me off at the office and vice versa everyday for the entire two weeks and to know that every day at the appointed times they were there to take me to the office and pick me up all the time on time!!! I do need to mentkion some of the names of the best staff members I have ever met in a hotel- Derek -a new staff member at the front desk was extremely helpful and invaluable to the point that he offered to pick me up from my office on the ;last day after I had checked out and take me to the airport and he did! He always asked me how my day was every time I walkeed back into the hotel and after a day of hard work away from home that is definitely superbe service! he deserves a promotion for his incredible customer service skills (I should know I am in travel management myself and If Belvoir did not have him already I would have offered him a job!-Elizabeth in In room dining was another gem! she always made it a point to let me know what the chef specials were everyday and she was always so pleasant. I beleive she is also fairly new to the organization but let me tell you Belvoir is doing an amazing job with their personnel as far as I am concerned. Jay the supervisor was also very helpful and so was Dan the a,manager always checking to see what needed to be done at the Front desk and offering to help. A bonus was the laundry service was great too- Last but not least a shout out to the chef- I had in room dinign everyday of my stay and I was never dissapoiinted in fact I loved everything on the menu- my favorite was the Cracker Jack Vanilla Mousse- can i have that recipe please or I guess I'll just have to wait until my next trip to Omaha and the Belvoir Omaha to have some of this delicious creation!! Thanls Belvoir for making what could have been a very long Business trip into the shortest and sweetest of my career!!!

title: Indifferent Staff
comment: At check-in, receptionist was warm as a python.When I inquired about an upgrade, she said I might have received one if I had paid for a regular room.But,I already had reserved a Club Room.When I asked her if the room rate could be adjusted downward, she said she couldn't alter any booking.

title: Great hotel
comment: Great staff, great location, wonderful rooms,

title: Great people, great location
comment: Great staff, great location, wonderful rooms,

title: Great location
comment: in agreement with some of the other reviews the temperature in the room was not adjustable. Now that it is air for summer the room was freezing. Location is awesome room was clean and decor was nice. View from pool area was cool and enjoyed the outdoor pool. Did hear toilet flushing next door they are loud but not a big deal. Staff was nice and helpful.

title: Clean and Central
comment: Centrally located just off I5 heading south (Exit 165B) which merges onto Union Street, then turn right onto 6th Avenue and into the hotel's driveway. Valet parking attendants were readily available, but as mentioned by other guests, is expensive at $44 USD per day. We checked in at approx. 4:30pm on a Sunday, and really appreciated a friendly reception at the front desk (Michaela) who mentioned we could park until 6pm on Monday to save us from driving & paying for parking at the Seattle Center to catch the King Tut exhibit. She suggested we walk over to Westlake Center (1.5 blocks away) to catch a 5 minutes ride on the monorail that takes us directly to the Seattle Center.

title: Club lounge is always nice here
comment: Rooms are small but well kept and the club lounge is smaller than it was a few years ago but still nice. I like the marble in the bathrooms.

title: great location, friendly staff, good value
comment: clean hotel, very friendly lounge staff, terrific location, good food

title: Just OK
comment: Parking $20 per day. Drinks $10 for a little plastic cup. Umbrellas $15 (at least 2 chairs were free). Didn't like that it was such a long haul to get to the parking garage from the beach tower - should have their own parking. Good thing: private beach and close proximity. Ft. Lauderdale has really gone "down hill" since last traveled here in early 2000's.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have figured out how to make a stay in a very big hotel pleasant
title: A Treat!
comment: Have stayed in lots of NYC hotels but this was my first time here. Universally excellent experience. Staff consistently pleasant and helpful. Special praise to housekeeping staff on the 14th floor - they were a pleasure. Would definitely stay here again

title: pluses and minuses
comment: East wing rooms are very far from the pool - lack of out door seating except at pool. Poolside restaurant is good but overall food is very overpriced - $6 for a coffee and small yogurt. I was there for a conference and found the facilities to be very cold and the conference food was awful. Overall the location is good for Epcot - boat transportation is fun - but if I were just visiting Disney would stay at a different resort. Spa was great!

title: Great Location; poor service
comment: Check-in took forever (even as a Platinum member) - elevators took even longer - each time. Bathroom was really cramped, even by NYC standards.

title: Home away from home
comment: Working out of town can be stressful but your excellent staff, including Dawn, Tina, Bill, Angel and Marie have become like family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for visiting Syracuse University
title: Met my needs for a conference
comment: Room and beds were nice and clean. Towels were not very fluffy, lighting in room and bathroom were not adequate for applying makeup, water pressure in shower could have been better. Front desk staff provided conflicting parking information to me and my roommate.

title: Bad experience
comment: 1.Bathroom has absolutely NO vanity space. I had to put all of my toiletry items on the floor for 5 days. Very inconvenient.

title: Stay was ok
comment: Shower stopper was broken, didn't receive new shampoo and conditioner in my room two days in a row, no shuttle person on staff one evening, a/c in room didn't seem to get to the degree that the temperature was set on. Pool was closed the entire stay. Personnel seemed to be courtious and facilties were always neat and clean.

title: Tired Hotel
comment: Recently at the Belvoir for an industry meeting. Disappointed with the tired appearance of the rooms. Also, very surprising that there is no WiFi coverage in the meeting spaces, even if you pay $14/ day for WiFi... There is definitely quite a bit of room for improvement. WiFi should be free (at least for Grandbourne members) and coverage should be throughout the hotel, especially since cell coverage in the meeting spaces is spotty.

title: Business Trip
comment: Room was very clean and staff was pleasant.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not your average Belvoir...high expectations will lead to disappointment.
title: Really Surprised to be so Disappointed
comment: I stayed at this hotel for a conference recently and I expected the best since it is a Belvoir and part of the Grandbourne network. I was really let down.

title: close to stanford
comment: nice hotel with location next to stanford university. Rooms could stand some updating, especially club level rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: located within 5-10 minute walk to Independence Hall Square National Park. Five dollar taxi ride to Independence Hall Square.
title: Hotel is located within walking distance to Independence Hall
comment: Stayed for one night. The staff was very helpful and polite.The room was clean and satisfactory. The valet service was helpful as they were asked to retrieve some items from the car. Enjoyed access to the club lounge area. Very relaxing.I would stay here again because of the location and the experience we had staying here.

title: Nice Hotel but needs to address a few things
comment: The hotel was nice but needs work in a few areas. The room that we stayed in looked like it needed renovation. The central air conditioner was noisy. The room didn't appear to be thoroughly cleaned. When I pulled out the chair from under the desk, there was dirt under the desk and when I put a bottle of water in the refrigerator, the bottom of the fridge was full of water and the top of the fridge was dirty. Didn't look like it had been cleaned in a while. The room smelled like cigarette smoke. The bed was comfortable, the pillows too soft. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and the food was very good. The front desk seems to be understaffed. There is often a long line of people waiting which creates congestion in the lobby. There should be vending machines on the floors but they only have ice. If you want to buy a snack you have to go to the lobby and wait on that long line at the front desk to pay for it. They don't offer free WiFi in the rooms. I didn't like paying $7 a night for parking and my biggest complaint is when you are leaving the property to go anywhere you have to use a ticket or room key to leave...this created very long lines at the exit and because the instructions were not clear it took a long time to get out of there. This definitely needs to be addressed. There has got to be a better way to handle this. Maybe there needs to be a person at the gate to expedite this process.

title: Food needs improvement
comment: I stay at Belvoir hotels many times throughout the year for business. Overall, the rooms are nice and the staff was accommodating. However, the hotel restaurant really needs improvement. I have visited this hotel several times over the past couple of years and I'm always disappointed with the food.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is key, the people that work at Belvoir Suites, put service before everything! What a great place to stay.
title: Great Service!
comment: My home away from home. I am always greeted like a long lost friend and the service is the best I have encountered anywhere.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor attention to customer service and details.
title: Poor Customer Service
comment: The waitress asked me three times if I wanted the breakfast buffet and I said no and it seemed like an inconvience that I wanted to order off the menu. After waiting 15 minutes for my menu order it arrived incorrect, so I left hungry. Also she was the only waitress on duty at 0700 on a busy weekday?

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for U Penn and Medical centers.
title: Great hotel and staff
comment: The staff was the best thing about this hotel - attentive, polite, professional. I would absolutely stay here again. Loved the "green" options for room service, and the location. Wireless internet in the room was S-L-O-W and difficult to connect, even though I was on a "preferred member" floor. Lounge in the lobby should stay open later. Overall, a very good experience.

title: Room Service needs revamping.
comment: After missing the delivery of my breakfast order by a few minutes on day one, I was determined to eat on time the next day...That did not happen. My food was delivered 30 minutes late. The "hot" food was cold, not that tasty and two of my ordered items were missing! The employee refused to leave without my signature on the bill and when I asked to have the order corrected before signing, he told me the food would have to go back to the kitchen first! He then tried to cover by blaming the kitchen staff and tried to earn a tip by "advising" to complain to the front desk. Room service needs revamping.

title: Bait and switch
comment: My assistant booked a room in this hotel for me. My reservation was for a "club" room with a king bed and a jacuzzi tub, and access to the "club" room for breakfast.

title: Enjoyable stay
comment: Was attending a conference and stayed for three nights. Stay was very enjoyable. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Appreciated having computers available to use on site. Enjoyed the pool, very relaxing.

title: Honeymoon
comment: My Wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. This hotel was excellent and the staff was very helpful with planning activities. I wish we could stayed longer because we didn't have enough time during the day to do everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is nice but VERY OVERPRICED
title: My experience with this hotel
comment: I must say that this hotel was nice as well as comfortable. The staff was very attentive as well. However, this hotel was not an affordable deal because my room rate was $189.00/night + taxes and I did not have a microwave nor a fridge (which come standard at most lower priced hotels). This forced me to either go out for food or order room service. And while speaking of room service, a $39 room service bill turned into a $58 cost to my room account due to hidden fees (taxes, delivery fee, food fee, etc). Also, I was charged $5.14 for picking up the room phone to make a call in which no one ever answered (not even an answering machine). Please understand, I am no stranger to travel and the expenses involved with high-end hotels. I have stayed in many 4 star hotels in my life but have never experienced such overpricing for things as The Belvoir charged. I easily could've booked a $79-$99/night hotel a few miles away and driven in for my conference and had a much more reasonably priced experience for the money. But to be fair, the hotel was comfortable and the service was above average. The prices were just exorbitant for the services rendered. This hotel was paid for by my employer for a conference at this hotel but if I ever travel to Birmingham again on my own dime this WILL NOT be where I stay. But if you are looking for a nice looking hotel with good service and have no problem with money, then this is your place!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect too much... and you won't be disappointed.
title: Did not meet my expectations....
comment: I reserved 3 rooms due to the wonderful reviews. What a disappointment! I had to wait 40 mins. to get rooms that were not connecting as requested but on the BPG floor. The only recognition I got was "do you want the points?". I asked about an upgrade - none available. Got to room and man was painting the closet... strong odor. Asked for another room and they gave us a "Suite" which was on another floor and consisted of a room with an adjoining sitting room with a worn leather sofa. The furnishings were worn, carpeting stained and nothing special (not even a mini bar). The lounge which was only open for breakfast despite being told differently... computer broken, food was bare minimum at best. What a disappointment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location to Towson Town Center
title: Very good hotel; excellent location
comment: Have stayed at this Belvoir many times while visiting family in the area. Very predictable - nice, clean property with excellent staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great deck on the club level!
title: Great Team!
comment: No matter the need or questions the staff always came through big! Combined with

everyoneShouldKnow: I feel the front desk staff needs improvement
title: disappointed
comment: We booked 3 rooms in January for a stay in June..did not receive rooms on same floor as expected upon arrival. They moved us on day 2, an inconvenience for sure. Upon checkout 2 rooms had a credit balance which still has not shown on my credit card, but the 3rd room with a balance due has already been charged..i don't understand this.

everyoneShouldKnow: Within 5-10 minutes walking distance to the Universal Studios.
title: Sam - the front desk manager - is the best
comment: We did not plan on going to the Universal Studios when I booked the hotel. We made our reservations 2 days in advance and this was the only Belvoir available. When we arrived, we realized how close the hotel is to the Universal Studios so we decided to give it a try. I called the front desk and talked to Sam. She was very helpful in upgrading us to the package which includes 2 tickets. She even gave us an extra breakfast voucher.

title: Excellent
comment: This hotel was great! and the beds were soooo comfortable! I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here again. My only concern is that some room locations can be a bit confusing due to main building and Tower building. But, overrall, the hotel is great and located in a great area......cant beat starbucks across the street for thos of us addicts

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the place to stay for business or pleasure.
title: Top Notch
comment: This property is "Top Notch" 5 stars without the 5 star price! The staff is great and the location was excellent, just where we wanted to be. I'll definately stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Handy location for urban tourist. Was able to take light rail from airport to within 2 blocks.
title: Nice hotel, OK service
comment: Nice facility and location. Club room status was a little overrated. Pool / exercise area exceeded expectations (add photos to web page!!). When we arrived at 4PM our room was not ready and we had to wait over an hour with our luggage, and we had to make kind of a big deal to get them to offer to hold our bags. This was a bad start to our stay but it got better from there.

title: Exceeded my expectations
comment: Best fish tacos in town. Friendly staff and minutes from everything in San Diego

everyoneShouldKnow: Management needs to work on thier Inter Personal Communication Skills
title: Capital Jazz Festival Weekend
comment: I was very dissapointed to find that only one elevator was working considering the hotel knew in advance that it would be lots of people attending the event.
