On Friday, June 1 the elevators were completely out and we walked up. The management was very indifferent to the issue and acted as though because they had your money already then SO WHAT. Did not even apologize.

title: Great Hotel/terrible beds
comment: This hotel is in a perfect location for the Univ. of Iowa campus. The staff was excellent. Very friendly and helpful. The decor is very pleasant. The rooms are fine although the counter space in the bathroom was small. However, the beds were the most uncomfortable my family and I have ever slept in.

title: Great Location
comment: I stayed here over a long weekend using my BPG points.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very helpful and it is very close to 2 of Disney's parks
title: A fantastic hotel
comment: My husband and I were taking our first vacation by ourselves in 28 years. We loved this hotel. It was close to many things and it had no sugar added ice cream at The Fountain Ice creamery. (my husband is diabetic)

title: This hotel has great facilities.
comment: The valet was very helpful. Forgot the front desk girl's name but she was very pleasant. The servers and staff in The Kitchen table were very polite and made my breakfast meals enjoyable. We had a small (about 30 people) cocktail reception in the Draft Media Lounge and Antonio F., who served our drinks and pupus, was very efficient, professional, friendly and accommodating of our requests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pool looks NOTHING like pictures. It needs a total upgrade into this century!
title: Internet
comment: I have been in a lot of hotels over the years. But even one that is a lot less than 1,000 for three nights will let you use their wifi. I could not downstairs to the java shop and drag my little grand - daughter to check in with work. Plus she could not use the IPAD that I drug with us there , even though I had it in sync with my phone, we still could not use our electronic devices. This is crazy and don't says for another 60 we could of paid and used it because we thought it was over priced to begin with . Oh and another 51 dollars a night to park for guests is outrageous!!

title: Check-in was a disaster
comment: Entered hotel at 3:45 pm. Was told our room would be ready in "a few minutes". At 5pm we were told there was an a/c unit problem and were assigned another room. Totally acceptable, but why make us wait over an hour whan a comparable room sat vacant. They comp'd out self park for our 2 days.

title: Comfortable and friendly stay
comment: While the hotel has been undergoing renovations, there are no shortcomings in the service. BPG recognition is tremendous - I am given a suite on each stay. The staff go above and beyond to meet guest needs. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean. The front desk staff are genuinely happy to see you and welcome you unlike other places who just bark at you. From the doorman to the Front Desk manager to shuttle drivers, each staff member is there to serve your best needs. I'm looking forward to the Club Lounge and the Lobby renovations being completed. The gym has been renovated and looks fantastic.

title: Excellent hotel
comment: I have stayed at this property and it is great to be back . The room was very clean and confortable . The hotel staff friendly , The restaurant staff were fabulous and the service was great, the food is good quality.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't overlook it for a DL visit just because its address is in Garden Grove.
title: Still good, but not as good as it used to be
comment: This is my preferred hotel whenever I'm in the Anaheim area. I discovered it last year and couldn't believe the quality of the hotel I was getting for the price. Unfortunately, it seems as though traveling families have also discovered it and have not been treating it so kind.

title: A LOVELY HOTEL AND WONDERFUL STAFF
comment: Great hotel, neat, clean rooms, comfy lobby, and a marvelous staff. Everyone was quite helpful when we asked questions of where to go in downtown area. However, no one told us if we went to the Visitor's Center we could find a free shuttle to the Alaska Zoo. We had planned on going and were going to get a cab, when we saw the shuttle pull up at the Info Center, which saved us over $30 in cab fares.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff makes you feel welcome
title: Great job, great place to stay
comment: The rooms were clean and well maintained, food/service at the hotel were top notch and priced fairly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Trains!!!!! All Day! All Night! Loud.
title: If you love trains and motorcycles
comment: Hotel was nice. Staff was friendly. Trains that roll by blaring the horn at all times of the night and day terrible. Train tracks very close to hotel and they honk the horn numerous times with each pass through. Trains run numerous times all night and day. Staff explained they have tried everything to eliminate the sound with no success. Also motorcycles getting on the freeway tend to rev it up and the sound echos off a concrete wall and the sound it deflected directly to the hotel. I would recommend that if you HAVE to stay here that you try to get a room overlooking the parking lot so sound is minimized.

everyoneShouldKnow: Caring and Friendly Staff to insure your stay is the best.
title: Great Property, Wonderful, Helpful Staff
comment: Just stayed June 12-15, last time here was [YEAR-2], and had a wonderful, relaxiing time. And the staff was fantastic: friendly, helpful, acted as if they were happy we were there, and that they were happy to be there, too. Not what you find often in the hospitality business these days. It was refreshing and made the stay quite enjoyable. Property is kept up very nicely, clean and fresh, and the pool along with easy access to the beach is another great selling point. A special shout-out to Grant, Curtis, Dave and Steve for their extra efforts!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's located right at Broadway at the Beach in Myrtle Beach, SC.
title: Good Resort, Lack of BPG recognition
comment: This place is great for families or people just trying to get away. It's central to Broadway at the Beach, It's got a great poolside area, awesome pool bar with good bartenders, and the rooms are very spacious.

title: Very friendly
comment: Great place to visit again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for proximity to Drexel and Penn.
title: Great location and service
comment: Close to Drexel University. Staff were very helpful at the front desk, lounge on the club floor, and housekeeping,

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't get your hopes up too high.
title: Bad Experience
comment: We had booked this room to arrive at 3:00 PM so I could finish some work I had to do before going to the Ranger game. When we arrived, there was a long line of people waiting to check in. It took approx 30 min to get to the desk and then they told me at 3:30 that my room was not ready and they would call me! I asked to speak to the manager and explained the situation he gave me a room right away. We went to our room and opened the door only to find other people already in the room. We were both very startled. We had to go back down with our luggage and find the manager who then gave us another room.

title: Nice Stay... Need more late night dining alternatives
comment: Good:

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a convenient location on the Plaza.
title: Met My Expectations
comment: I reserved a double bed suite for myself and some friends for a bachelorette party.  The location is walking distance from everything on the plaza, which worked out perfectly for us.  I don't know if other reviewers on here were dealing with a different group of employees, but I found everyone to be helpful, courteous and professional.  The suite could have had more space in the common area, but I still thought it was a good value for the price, compared to what you get at other places for the same amount.  The room was very clean upon arrival, and I never noticed anything wrong with the carpet.  Paying extra for things like parking and internet seem silly to me, especially when these things are free at lower star hotels or even McDonald's!  Overall, though, we had a nice stay.

title: Mediocre Hotel but Excellent Location
comment: The room was clean but the shower curtain was really stinky. The cleaning lady kept forgetting to leave enough new washcloth. Called guest service, took them forever to get us the washcloth. Although the hotel was mediocre, its location is excellent. Few min walk to time square. Tons of good restaurants around. Easy access to subway.

everyoneShouldKnow: Expect to be treated as returning family from your very first visit.
title: Perfect Resort for and occasion
comment: As a frequent guest at this hotel we thought it only fitting to celebrate our 25th anniversary there with family and friends. The experience definitely met our expectation from the front desk where Linda greeted us to the Lobby Lounge where Julia was our server. The entire staff is truly outstanding. We will definitely continue to plan events at the Resort and look forward to our next stay.

title: Nice property in need of more consistent service
comment: The hotel is not a large Belvoir, but it is nice with very comfortable rooms. The food and service were spotty.

title: Excellent host hotel
comment: Attended the USF Social Marketing Conference June 12 - 16th and I commend the staff of the hotel for their excellent customer service. Everyone from the bellman, front desk, housekeeping, recreation, Rusty's, conference staff, were attentive, friendly and considerate.

title: Needs a Market
comment: Hotel is a great place to stay overall. My only suggestion is that it add a small market area where a guest can purchase items like pop, candy, supplies, common medicines, etc. Many hotels have these and they are very convenient if you need something. Otherwise, you have to leave the property and drive somewhere to get these items. The only vending machines I saw were for drinks.

title: Interesting
comment: Nice place, housekeeping knocked on the door at 7:30 a.m. and woke me from my deep sleep. Although I did not have my DND sign on, 7:30 a.m. is still a little early, especially for summer travelers. Also, I have 3 holds on my credit card for a one night stay; I can see where it would be relevant if I stayed more than one night, but that is a little excessive.

title: Noisy and secluded
comment: This hotels proximity to JFK is a double edge sword; great for the early morning flight we had and terrible for sleeping with airplane noise all night. The front desk staff was medicore at best and the restraurant staff was better; which is a good thing since you really have zero choices for any other dining. The hotel is very secluded with a highway on one side, airport on the other, and what appeared to be abandoned buildings on the other sides. The room was comfortable but the TV was not receiving ESPN HD which I wanted to watch for the US Open. I called the front desk and no one ever showed up to the room to fix it. Although I used BPG points to pay for the room, I feel as though I have been ripped off. Using 10,000 points for this type of experience is riduculous as this establishment does not meet the standards I have become accustomed to with Grandbourne Hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will always receive a greeting to go with your stay and constant acknowledgement that you are their welcome guest
title: consistent excellant service
comment: Have stayed @ this hotel regularly when in LA area. Staff greetings are always with a smile. Always treated like I am welcome and expected to return often (which I do). Any complaints or exceptions(few, if any) are handled promptly and with highest urgency. Service is excellant at desk, bar, restaurant, lounge, housekeeping and all with a smile and greeting. This is my chosen location whether business is downtown or near airport due to stellar service.

everyoneShouldKnow: The only place to stay when at the Convention Center
title: First Class all the way.....
comment: My wife and I have stayed here every year for about 12 years and the experience only gets better.

title: Exceptional and Consistant Service
comment: I'm a 9 year user of Grandbourne hotels for business and pleasure and this one is now one of my favourites. From Edwin at the front desk to Tyler in the pool area, the service exceeded all our expectations. The location and the amenities here are unbelievable especially so for kids. We were in the Marina tower. The new fitness area was just being completed so we didn't get a chance to use it but the machines and weights are all state of the art. Another huge plus is the view from just about any room, gorgeous! The only downside was that the beds are not queens but doubles so it is a little cramped and that the parking was the most expensive I dealt with over a 2 week period of stays all over California. But, I would highly recommend just the same as the place is well worth it!

title: Things just go wrong once in a while
comment: I've stayed at hundreds of BPG properties over the years and will continue to do so, but once in a while things just don't' work well.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a business traveler hotel, it's not family orientated.
title: Family vacationer
comment: Upon arrival we were unable to get the view room that we requested we could only get the city view, the lady on the phone from the hotel was rude and we ended up being helped by a manager who thought it would be best to keep our room and have access to the club lounge, well with kids the club lounge isn't inviting. Never a place to sit, lots of uptight business customers, and we usually got a few things and went back to our room. The evening access doesnt allow kids. The weekend is better with kids in this hotel. I asked concierge for suggestions as we had never been to Boston and Out of everything Boston has to offer they said the mall and the childrens museum. Nothing about the red socks, the freedom trail, so they need some education on there home city. The pool tile is very slippery; they had signs up for wet floor but nothing for how slippery it was. I was walking by and about slipped. We put towels surrounding the pool area so our kids wouldn't slip. We saw several other people almost slip and fall. When cleaning up the towels we placed down, another family asked if we could leave them as their son almost fell trying to stand up.

title: Family traveler
comment: My family loved NYC, Hotel is in a great location, Walking to times sq, central park, 5th ave, rockafeller, its a great location. My only complaint really is upkeep. Our first room had broken drapes and blinds, they had to move us and the second room we didn't notice that the sink leaked so all our stuff on the shelf under the sink was soaked. House keeping needs to do some detailing the shower and sink area was moldy. Kinda dissapointing for how much we paid for our room for 4 nights. The walls are paper thin we could hear the kids in the room next to ours screaming and jumping on the beds till 2 am and we could hear the other rooms phone conversations. so just an fyi. Other than that we loved it.

title: Empathetic towards customers needs
comment: My husband and I traveled from San Antonio to Dallas for a family wedding. We happened to be about an hour earlier than we expected at check-in. It was hot outside and a young man at the front desk offered us both a bottle of cold water that quenched our thirst. He also got us our room ready prior to the check-in time.You have a very nice, courteous and professional staff.

title: Good location and great staff
comment: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The location was great for walking to shops and restaurants. The staff is fantastic and they made us feel very welcome and they especially made our dog feel very welcome with lots of treats! We would look forward to staying here again when our travels bring us to Albuquerque.

title: The epitome of Southern Hospitality!
comment: Wow, what a wonderful place to stay! Everyone from the bellmen and valets to the front desk folks and concierge couldn't have been nicer! They really made us feel welcome and provided us with some great advice. We were looking for a good place to have dinner and they recommended a restaurant that turned out to be one of the best meals we've had in a long time (and we've had a lot!). Our room was very spacious and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great and the in-house coffee shop was a plus! When we checked out Jocelyn at the front desk spoiled our dog so much he didn't want to leave! We will definitely be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location near Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach is everything.
title: Poor Platinum breakfast
comment: Service is as good as any Grandbourne, I like the layout of the rooms. Location is touristy, for better or worse. Very disappointed with the Continental Breakfast offered.

title: This hotel has great location
comment: I enjoyed my stay at he b'ham Belvoir. I was disappointed the pool wasn't available

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff went out of their way to make my daughter feel special. Location is good with easy access to the enitre city via the subway
title: Great Stay
comment: This is a great stay, location is good with easy access to the enitre city via the subway. The staff is excellent in helping with all your needs from deli advice, to trains, to must see activities. The staff went out of their way to make my daughter feel special.

everyoneShouldKnow: You do not guarantee your reservations!
title: This hotel didn't acknowledge my early check in
comment: Even though I had a reservation # for an early check-in.. when I arrived at the hotel, the staff didn't even look up as she was on her cell phone to greet me. Then when she finally decided to do something she didn't know anything about an early check-in & said they didn't have a room available for me as promised w/ a Kingon the 1st Floor. When I protested she said she'd get houskeeping to clean one & would call my call in 1 hr. This didn't happen & I had to get a mgr over the phone to get me a room. She promised everything would be ok once I arrived (the 2nd time) but once again, the staff knew nothing & couldn't help me. I req'd the mgr & I got more flack until I stood my ground & finally they decided that yer my room was available - a dble & I said no... my reservation was for a king. Finally after way too much time & stress I got my room. Only to find out that there wasn't any toilet paper or kleenex. Then the staff "forgot" to give me my breakfast coupons as the buffet was included in my room.... Very Poor... Definitely not satisfied!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great City View on the upper floors facing downtown Dallas
title: LenM54
comment: Great Customer Service

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy walk from the light rail station underneath the Nordstrom flagship store - no need for taxi or rental car from airport.
title: Great Location
comment: Great location in downtown Seattle, esp for a meeting at the Washington Convention Center (right next door). Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.

everyoneShouldKnow: nothing special, just nice clean rooms
title: good choice
comment: Good: free selfparking; free breakfasts and 5-8 p.m. light meals at BPG lounge (no meat then), renovated recently

title: Cozy and welcoming environment
comment: - Customer service were excellent and staffs were very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a huge hotel. Not for someone looking for the "quaint" experience.
title: Excellent staff and rooms!
comment: I just finished my first stay here and will be returning again! The hotel is large, but service and cleanliness was not compromised by it's size. Allen helped me get checked in and was extremely polite and attentive to my needs. The room was a good size and had the coolest views of downtown Dallas. When dinner rolled around, Tami at the concierge desk was extremely helpful. She made me feel as though I was the only guest in the hotel for that brief moment, and I saw her do the same for many guests that night too. She is a definite asset to desk. And lastly, I believe Demetria in room service was the one who delivered breakfast to my room (which was delicious by the way) and had a huge smile on her face. She was so polite and funny at the same time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice infiniti pool for adults only.
title: Excellent stay
comment: Stayed for 2 nights Jun 15-17, [YEAR-0]. Was upgraded to top floor (31) with ocean view of Diamond Head. Very nice. I had asked for a suite when I checked in, but the room provided was very nice and clean. Lounge was nice and provided nice breakfast, but was only open from 6-10am and 4-8pm. Would have been nice to have access to the lounge during other hours to relax....especially since it was so windy during one of our days there. Lounge staff was great. I had stayed at this hotel a few times in years past, and they made some GREAT remodels, to include the adult only infiniti pool, seperate pool area for families with a water slide, nice lobby, and Rum Fire bar. Not sure if the resort charge is worth it at $25.00 per day, as were not able to take advantage of any resort activities, nor did we use the parking, and internet would have been included anyway as a lifetime platinum. Overall a nice hotel, great location, and friendly service. Thanks for honoring platinum status...as not all Grandbourne hotels do.

title: Evrytjing was great
comment: Stayed 2 nights at this Suites hotel to see a baseball game in Cleveland, attend the NFL and Rock and Roll HOFs. Great central location, room, staff and food service. Another great Belvoir Preferred Guest stay. The HOF, Room and Breakfast package ls one of the best dollar-wise.

title: Worthwhile, with room for improvement
comment: The hotel in general is very good: the staff is friendly and the lobby and general areas are clean and pleasant to be in.

title: Great location
comment: We were very pleased with the Belvoir and our stay. It was close to the beach, downtown and shopping areas with easy access to all! The room was spacious and comfortable. Our trip was for pleasure and we certainly found it between the hotel, the beach and the city. We would recommend staying at this Belvoir as the staff was very friendly and it was well maintained and the location was perfect!

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a great staff and is conveniently located to the Amway Center
title: This hotel has a great staff
comment: The staff and facility was fantastic. We had a beautiful room and it was so conveniently located to the Amway Center for us to be able to walk to the concert. We want to especially thank Amy who made sure our stay was memorable. She is a fantastic employee.

everyoneShouldKnow: Sean (I belive that is his name) is fantastic in the club lounge.
title: Great Location
comment: Nice, clean and comfortable. Sean in the club lounge in the morning is fantastic!

title: Hotel great - service in dining area - subpar
comment: The roooms were quite comfortable for our one night stay in Omaha. The staff was courteous and the food was great. Since we were also celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary we decided to dine in the dining room. My husband had to go to the bar to get drinks (we were not asked). We were served water (no ice). I asked for a baked potato with my meal but was brought green beans. Upon seeing the mistake my waitress said they are healthier anyway. We were not asked if we wanted dessert, By the way, we were the only ones having dinner. Next time - Room Service.

title: Steve Ohio
comment: Have stayed at this location numerous times and have never had any issue with this facility, would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay Also very easy on location being right off Interestate 270

title: Great location
comment: If you are planning to visit Sesame Place, I would highly recommend staying at the hotel. It is right across the street from the park and offers fast and convenient shuttle service to and from the park.

title: Great location
comment: Room was very neat and super clean, loved the mini suite.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is literally across the street from the San Diego Airport, but you hear very little, if any, airplane noise.
title: Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff
comment: Beautiful, clean hotel and close to everything. We especially appreciated the free breakfast in the mornings. We found the Happy Hour we were able to attend on Saturday evening a bit disappointing, though - it would be great if the offerings were fresher (hey, lots of fruit is in season right now) and the presentation a bit more creative. More modern, upbeat music would help the atmosphere, too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fidel in the lobby bar is great.
title: Does not live up to Grandbournes Quality
comment: I travel a fair deal for work and stay nearly exclusively in Grandbourne's properties. I choose Grandbourne's hotels for the quality of service and rooms. This hotel fell below the others I have stayed at. It is a fine hotel, and I will probably stay there next time I am in Fort Worth (for the points) but it has room for improvement.

title: Wonderful Hotel, Great staff!!
comment: Our stay was great. We had an amazing corner room. The hotel was so comfortable and nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: New clean hotel with friendly staff.
title: Great Hotel
comment: This is a great hotel, rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. The room decor is inviting and warm. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous.

title: Great Rate and Dogs Allowed!!
comment: Things I liked: GREAT military rate, bed was very comfortable, room itself was nice and clean, and our dogs were allowed, which was a huge plus.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is well staffed, clean and pleasureable to stay in. Restaurants are first class.
title: Extas, at what cost?
comment: I was disappointed to have the hotel try to sell me two bottles of water and use of the internet at $10 per day. The hotel is better than that. The parking was quoted at $15 per day for valet and $12 per day for self parking. I was charged $15 even though I asked for and was placed in self parking. It was not worth the $12 difference to wait through the line at check out when I could take my fast checkout that was slipped under the door and simply leave. These things considered, I liked the hotel very much. The staff at all levels were among the best I have ever encountered in a hotel. The facility was in great shape and the pool area was just fantastic. Restaurants were world class. The shuttle service was the worse I have ever experienced. The one hour wait to get on a filled to standing room capacity made it impossible to leave a Disney park and come back to the hotel for a mid day rest. My biggest complaint is with Disney, not the hotel. I have no plans to ever return to a Disny park but Belvoir is still one of my favorite hotel chains.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel with lots of activity close by.
title: We love the Sioux Falls Belvoir
comment: We love to stay at your Sioux Falls hotel. I just have a couple things on my last trip that could use some better communication.

title: Spotless hotel
comment: Spotless hotel. The staff was so friendly.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
comment: Great location and staff very friendly and very helpful with dining, maps and help with scheduling tours. Service and people in Cafe excellent also. Close to Wharf and hop off/off buses. Checked in early and only one first floor room available that early. Asked if would be quiet and she truthfully said no. Check in clerk called housekeeping and told them to clean another room facing a courtyard that would be quiet. Bed was very comfortable and rooms clean. Lobby is noisy and always busy and so is area but it is worth the convenience to be so close to activities. Enjoyed outside fire pit lounge areas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful workout room and excellent staff.
title: Great Staff; Cannot offer it all
comment: The hotel staff is great! They did an awesome job. We could not get a microwave or refrigerator in our room for our two-night stay and it was very inconvenient. Still, the staff let us use the hotel freezer and fridge. Very nice of them to do but, again, very inconvenient. The club lounge is really small when a lot of people show up to breakfast. The workout facility is excellent. The fact that they allow pets is our main reason for choosing this hotel. It was very nice to take our pet with us. Our room was right above the pool and was quite noisy during the night. Still, we just turned on the clock radio to some "white noise" and did just fine. Overall, the staff is great but they cannot offer it all.

title: I love the Belvoir Framingham!!
comment: I'm currently on a project about 6 miles away from the Belvoir, and since I am a Grandbourne person, the Belvoir is the natural Grandbourne choice. As with any hotel (and, as a consultant, I've seen a lot of hotels), I didn't know what to expect from this Belvoir. I have to say, though, that I was really really pleased with this Belvoir. The rooms are clean, the room service is efficient, the food is good, and the customer service is just stellar! I've never met a better group of hotel employees. I recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Prime location for Universal Studios, but also close to many other LA places.
title: Great location, good hotel
comment: Great location near Universal Studios and Hwy 101. Clean hotel, decent Club level amenities and wonderful valet parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent services and location and good breakfast in the Club Lounge.
title: Excellent Service
comment: Emily at the front desk did an excellent job in providing a room upgrade and late check-out for a Grandbourne member. Valet service person was excellent in providing rates and directions on how to get to other places (and I apologized I forgot the person's name.) The server at the Club Lounge during breakfast was also very polite and efficient in cleaning up the tables and answering other guests' questions. Nicole at front desk/reservation was also very helpful in changing my reservation. Overall the services were great! Also, the location is excellent if you have bussiness nearby since it's right off the main highways.

everyoneShouldKnow: The flights start to take off at about 5am- so you might consider staying further from the airport
title: No sleep- tough stay
comment: It was unfortunate to be on the same floor as students and participants in Salsa Conference and Competition. From midnight to 5am, there was constant yelling, hallway conversations, and groups gathered up and down the corridor. It was disappointing that as a business traveler, I was not proactively booked on a floor that would have allowed a decent night's sleep. Certainly separate conference attendees guest rooms and those that do not wish to be up all night. The front desk sent security in to the hallway, but unless I continued to call the front desk at each surge of crowds and noise- the efforts were fruitless. Very disappointing and exhausting.

title: Conference meeting - average
comment: I liked the hotel overall. My first impression was the bellman (an older gentleman) and he wasn't the friendliest fellow. The bed was too soft for my comfort but the room was very nice. the food in the convention center was average convention food. Would have preferred to go out and eat great seafood and local restaurants.

title: Pat was very helpful
comment: Pat from the Member Lounge was fantastic. Customer oriented,friendly, helpful

title: Better than expected
comment: We planned several 'mini' trips this summer, based on the specials I found from various sources. We used a Living Social voucher for our stay, and in all honesty, expected less than 'stellar' accommodations and service. We were pleasantly surprised and very pleased. The room location was wonderful, the staff pleasant and helpful, the breakfast delicious! Thank you for a wonderful trip!

title: Fabulous staff
comment: Checked in late and the room I had booked wasn't availible but I was accomodated with a better room. My grand daughter fell and hit her head( no fault of the hotel) and the staff went above and beyond for us. and even phoned the next day to see how she was. They couldn't do enough for us and I felt they really cared

title: Great Hotel!
comment: We were given a room on a high floor facing Disneyland. The room was very spacious and spotlessly clean. The interior of the room felt fresh and we felt really cozy & comfortable especially after a very long day @ Disneyland (15 minutes slow walk away).

title: The perfect hotel for a family get-away
comment: The hotel is in a great area and easy access to either 6Flags, Ranger Ball Park or The Cowboy Stadium and even Wal-Mart. My family and I stayed Fri-Mon. and the price was perfect and the time we had was wonderful! I Highly recommend this hotel to all my friends on Facebook and to anyone who reads this review. 2 thumbs up Belvoir Arlington Hotel :)

everyoneShouldKnow: They have NO lounge, breakfast or in room Wifi!!!
title: Platinum Does NOT Matter Here...
comment: They have NO lounge, breakfast or in room Wifi!!!

title: Over promise under delivery
comment: The front desk did not greet with BPG status and could not answer questions regarding local area. The new gym filled with fresh paint smell and a broken air conditioning. After the complaints, air conditioning was still not functioning the next day. The temporary club house, which had one sofa, a big screen TV, a few folding chairs and 3 cans of Coke, was depressing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was the amazingly friendly!
title: Amazing Visit
comment: I researched hotels in this area a long time before I booked this one. I was extremely pleased! The price for the area was great, the location was so convenient (If you come in on the train this hotel is very close) and the lobby and rooms were really good. However, I have to say that by far the strength that I witnessed over and over again was the staff friendliness. Audrey at the front desk was amazing friendly and helpful! Jamal was funny and friendly. I could go on and on. I have no idea what the bad reviews are talking about. I highly recommend this hotel. I WILL be staying again!

title: Great Choice
comment: Nice hotel, good value. The staff were friendly and helpful, particularly Zach at the front desk. We had a very nice stay and would absolutely return.

title: Amazing Staff
comment: Absolutely every member of the staff at this hotel was terrific. I always felt welcome. People could not do enough for my family & I.

title: Not worth the money
comment: We were highly disappointed with the staff at the Belvoir. They didn't clean the tables around the pool, restock the towels or take away the dirty towels. Even overnight. We had a late lunch by the pool, and when I came back down around lunch the NEXT DAY, the plates were still there.

title: A mixed review.
comment: The hotel is in a great location on the North Beach. Our oceanfront room was beautiful and large and very clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: The perfect distance away from town. If you have a question ask Mr. Ed.
title: Perfect Location
comment: The rooms where very clean and comfortable. The pool was great and the poolside bar is a big plus. The only issue I have is that there is a funny odor when you enter the front door to the lobby. Smathers Beach which is across the street also has a fowl odor to it and is loaded with seaweed. The location is great and the shuttle service is a big plus. Mr. Ed was very informative and helpful and is a major asset to this hotel.

title: Good bang for the buck
comment: The PK is an older property in the heart of Waikiki. You'll not find a better rate at neighbor hotels. The housekeeping does a great job and most of the staff is friendly. Some at the Pikake Terrace can be rude and very slow. Others are jewels which is usually the case. The nightly show is a nice way to end the day. The beach service is very nice. Chilled apples, oranges and bottles of water are a thoughtful touch. The PK is like a favored aloha shirt...a little worn but still you reach for it every time!

title: Great Service
comment: Stayed here for one night on June 9 and was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. Great service at the front counter by Richard I think. He upgraded us to a suite and my family loved the room. The self parking was cheaper here than anywhere else that I stayed at over the 14 days that I was on holidays which was a surprise considering it an airport hotel. Loved the full Starbucks service in the hotel, very friendly & convenient!

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure area and room are clean immeidately after checking in.
title: Okay
comment: This hotel had very friendly staff at front desk. Room was comfortable. But, sofa blocked the air conditioner, and when I moved it there was much dirt under. When I came back to room at end of first day, still dirty....even though room had been "cleaned". Hallways were very dirty. Fitness room was nice. Location not easy to find.

title: Great location
comment: This hotel is in an outstanding location, and is rather nice to be only an BPG category 2. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Fitness center was small...one bench with a few weights.

everyoneShouldKnow: A 5 minute walk across from the "Woody" day parking lot that is serviced continuously by the free Disney shuttles bus, saves 10 minutes of walking home with exhausted kids.
title: Great Stay for Father - Daughter Weekend
comment: Decided on a last minute trip to DL with my 6 year old daughter. We had a great time at the Belvoir, loved the 4 pillows on each bed, and the pool area was a fantastic mid-day break at 3pm. Well done for a resonable price. Thanks to Saul at the pool for making our snacks just right...fantastic service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has US historic charm - embrace the floor to ceiling windows, dismiss the few square footage of rooms. Embrace the unmatched location on (non-roadway) 16th Ave, dismiss the downtown one-way streets. BTW, my uncle used tell a joke that he lived on the end of a one-way street.. If he were alive, I'd let him know there's a hotel on it. :)
title: Great staff, nice hotel
comment: The front desk clerk, Jana (I think), knew my needs before I expressed them. when calling for additional pillows, the door rang almost immediately upon hanging up. The concierge lounge was well stocked with sodas and waters at all times, great apps during regular hours. However, even well drinks are at a cost. In Hhonors lounges, alcohol is often comp, but food is bad - so this is a good trade off. The tower rooms are smaller than newer hotels. However, this is a historic wing - the construction is cement - the rooms are practically sound proof. We did have A/C problems when checking in, but maintanance fixed it immediately.. With hundreds of rooms, hotels will always have problems (nomatter the brand), it's how they deal with them that makes the difference. This hotel obviously has great management from the top down, which reflects in the employees attitudes, the room's spotlessness, and the charm of the hotel. I work for a 5 STAR 5 Diamond international hotel chain, so I'm very picky and am plagued with the hotel inspector evaluation eye (there's a knick on that corner? the edge of the carpet is up? one ring in the shower isn't hooked? call the manager!), but this hotel is well kept and the staff is immaculately professionnal (down to the gift shop employee who doesn't even work for the company). Great Job!

title: My recent stay was unsatisfactory
comment: My recent stay at JFK Belvoir was truely disappointing. I had a meeting in Manhattan early morning and the check in staff told me there would be a shuttle bus to Federal Circle. However, they did not take me to the Federal Circle and dropped me at one of the JFK terminals and I almost missed my appointment. Second, when I had coffee in my room, the hald and half in coffee condiments were rotton. I put that in my coffee without knowing and it smelled really bad.

title: First visit
comment: I just started doing work in Stamford and chose this hotel as I prefer BPG. Based on my stay, there are a LOT of regular guests. It was like old home week.

title: Loved our stay!
comment: The Belvoir is a great place to stay while in New Orleans. It's the perfect location with easy access to all areas of the city. Our room was quiet, clean, and spacious. The view from the rooms is amazing, with floor to ceiling windows. The staff was extremely helpful whenever we called before we arrived and very friendly during our stay. We requested a refrigerator for our room due to medical reasons and they graciously did not charge us for it. There were renovations going on in the hotel that we were notified of, however we never once heard or saw any of the construction. The pool is beautiful and easy to get to. We highly recommend!

title: Excellent hotel
comment: A couple of caveats:

title: A Tired Hotel
comment: Room in the Tower building is small by today's standards. TV was broken and could not be fixed; toilet seat was broken as well. Towels are thick but small. On the positive side, it's a good location and staff was friendly.

title: with kids
comment: Great hotel, love the infinity pools and beach access. Staff very friendly, amenities clean and modern. A little disappointing that there is no fridge in room- havent seen that in years..., 10$ per day to rent in room, and 15$ per day for an umbrella on the beach. Not a lot of shade for kids when it is hot and sunny. The rest was great! would come back.

title: very nice stay :)
comment: We checked into the hotel on Saturday the 16th. I got a great deal from priceline, as we were just looking for an inexpensive place to stay so we could spend a few days at Six Flags. I called before and requested a renovated room on the 7th floor and was told I would be checked into room 728. When I got there the front desk had put me on the 5th floor. I told them I would rather have floor 7 and immediately they went to work finding a clean room for me to check into. I ended up with 705. It was a beautiful room, close enough to the elevators but not so close that I could hear all the traffic coming off of them. Our room was "river view" and it overlooked the highway and the river. I was nervous because I saw many reviews complaining about the highway noise and I thought it would affect my kids sleeping (they are 3 and 4 years old, and they need their sleep!!), but we all slept very soundly, and thanks to the room darkening blinds, my kids slept all night and didn't get up till 8:30 am!

everyoneShouldKnow: One of the worst Belvoir's in the BPG Portfolio
title: This hotel should not be a Belvoir
comment: This is by far one of the worse Belvoir hotel properties. The reception was friendly (this is the only positive). The elevators took me 2 minutes (not kidding) to get to the 6th floor. At first the door didnt open (there was a hotel engineer in the elevator with me...he said the elevators are temperamental...) The bathtub faucet was leaking (could not get it to stop), and the a/c unit in the room made a very loud rattling noise all night long. This hotel has not been refreshed...it severely needs it as well. The lounge said they could not get any more fruit because the lounge was closing in 30 minutes... just all around, not acceptable.

title: Great Hotel for the business traveler
comment: I stay at this property at least once a month for over the past two years. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the rooms are always spotless. I like the fact that there are no tubs in the room, but a real shower!! The Club room is one of the best out of all the BPG properties that I stay at over the year.

title: Buy 2 nights get One Free is a SCAM!
comment: I paid for two nights in advance. When i got my bill - all the taxes and services charges almost equalled the third night. My room was to include breakfast but when I got there, the desk staff said no desayuno!

title: Overall, great hotel!
comment: Great location, great room, great toiletries. The bed and pillows didn't meet my expectation, but overall, very nice stay!

title: Favorite Hotel
comment: They always do a great job. Great location and excellent service!

title: Not worth the money
comment: Next time in NYC will stay in the Westin or W, this hotel is not worth the money. Poor service, rooms smell moldy, and so crowded that you can not get in the elevator for 10 minutes at a time.

title: A Honolulu Charm
comment: Great location and the staff are wonderful! Very gracious and helpful. Bill, Alvin, and the concierge were great!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Take advantage of the Free shuttle on the 16nth street mall - do a tour of the whole thing to get an idea of what's around you.
title: Family's Choice Award
comment: As an BPG/SPP member, we have the terrific perk of earning reward points for business done with Grandbourne . Out of the multiple options we have to choose from in redeeming points, my family chooses the Belvoir Denver Downtown hands-down! We are coming up on our 3rd stay here, and I think they are more excited about staying at the hotel than the visit to the city? We've stayed in both towers, and there is a plus to each - can't go wrong. Personally, I'm looking forward to an outdoor cityview swim in the pool, and my morning Peets :^) See you soon!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are great. The hotels decor is up to date and beautiful
title: Love this hotel
comment: I am a frequent business traveler and most often stay at Grandbournes facilities. When I walked into this Belvoir, I was immediately impressed. What a gorgeous, up to date lobby (restaurant, bar and Internet kiosks all in the lobby area). I loved how open and accessible everything was.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent Service for front desk, bell desk, pool attendant and house keep keeping
title: Excellent Service
comment: From the Front desk, to the bell desk, and also house keeping, was very excellent service they made my vcation worth it.. Thanks you very much.

title: My Second Stay
comment: I'm in Atlanta once per month to buy and sell cars at an Auction. This Hotel is very close to the Auction but so are many others.

title: Average Hotel, Lots of things need work
comment: Stayed here at a conference with over 100 women. Price for the rooms was reasonable, however, at almost every opportunity to provide service, they failed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right across the street from THE BEACH. Only minutes away from Duvall street.
title: Very clean room
comment: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms were very clean, very spacious and oh the work out facility was GREAT! I do think the couch in the room we stayed in was a little worn....and that happens when your in a popular vacation spot, but it should be replaced. Otherwise, everything was GREAT! I worked in the hotel industry for 8 years and cleanliness is VERY important to me. I know what to look for. The room was clean!

everyoneShouldKnow: Water is too hot and can scald
title: My stay in Dallas
comment: I checked in on a Sunday evening. When I tried to call the front desk, the concierge and the operator, no one answered. The water in this hotel is so hot it can scald. This wastes money and is dangerous to the guests. I mentioned it to several employees and can only hope they will react better than their Sunday evening phone services. Also this hotel has multiple towers and the front desk does a poor job of directing guests to the proper elevators.

title: Always prepared
comment: This is my go to hotel in Atlanta, they have always shown me the utmost respect, service and attention to detail. No matter if I am checking in at lunch or midnight, the staff always greet me with a warm smile. Thankyou so much.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great central location servicing the Sonoma Valley and surrounds, and a great place to come home to at the end of the day
title: Whatever you want - they have it
comment: the Belvoir Sonoma County is an oasis in the desert; our room had a view of the marina, services were amazing, reception staff were courteous and efficient, upgrading us to a better room even though we had made a last minute booking. We were disappointed we hadn't known about this hotel earlier as we would have made more use of the facilities.

title: BEST HOTEL
comment: When I checked in I was not happy with the extra charge of $12.00 a day. But the hotel and staff are top notch. All the staff exept one was very nice and helpfull. I have two comments.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service was good and staff very friendly.
title: Not too bad!
comment: We chose this hotel because it was central between two spots we were visiting. It was close enough to the interstate and other highways that take you out to the beaches and Miami.

title: Check In - Needs Improvement
comment: I arrived at the hotel at 2:30 PM and was told my assigned room was being cleaned and to check back every 30 minutes. After 90 minutes (checking back every 30 minutes) I was told that my room was now occupied by someone else. I was told I could wait further or accept a room with double beds (which I accepted). This was way too long for an outcome that required me to make concessions. This experience did not meet my expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has both an indoor and outdoor poool
title: Wonderful Place to Stay
comment: This hotel has great facilities and lovely location along the river in Norfolk. It is easy to walk to a number of location and the new Tide Train runs nearby as well. However, what impressed me the most was the courtesy and hospitality of every staff member. they went out of their way to make my stay there very nice.

title: Platinum51
comment: This is our home time share hotel, we don't usually stay here, but this time we stayed a week. The first condo we went in we did not like & no one came to help us with luggage. We moved & the phone did not work, microwave was broken, the list went on...

title: Overall good but needs some work
comment: We attended for a conference and overall the lobby staff service was excellent but they need to extend this service to the Housekeeping.

title: Need to complete the facelift
comment: This hotel started to remodel at least a year ago, it is far from done. I recently stayed in room 501, the carpet has huge stains especially where there was something next to the dresser that the TV is on. The lamp on the desk normally has 2 outlets, this one had one removed with tape over it. I carry more then one device that requires power. You have to wonder if anyone looks around. Dishes were placed in the halls after house cleaning did the rooms and were still there at 5:30pm when returning from work. Cobwebs in the hallway by the elevator on the first floor, and even the trash can by the elevator was over stuffed and hanging open on my floor for a day and a half.

title: HVAC did not work properly
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Seattle from June 16-20, we found the staff, service, and location and all other amenities excellent. We called three times to get the room cooler, we could not sleep because it was too warm, they turned the thermostat down but the temperature did not reflect the actual room temperature.

title: Pretty good hotel
comment: I have to thank Samantha for solving my previous BPG points problem and serving as a perfect hostess.

everyoneShouldKnow: Quieter location on the north end of the boardwalk
title: Quieter end of oceanfront boardwalk
comment: We enjoyed our family vacation at the Belvoir. It is in the quieter section of the boardwalk at the north end. Most workers were friendly and outgoing. The overall look of the hotel is clean. Of course there were times that towels, trash, and drink cups were laying around, but we attribute most of that to lazy vacationers, who expect to be picked up after. Our view is, if you have towels and there is a bin to put them in on your way out, take them with you and drop them in. The only two complaints or comments we would like to be known are having to do with checkin time and food in restaurant.

title: Needs Updating
comment: The room itself was fine and the beds were quite comfortable, however the bathroom was in severe need of updating. The grout was black in places and the ceiling paint and the wallpaper were peeling. When I went to retrieve something I dropped under the sink, I was horrified by how dirty the walls were under there.

title: how long do I need to wait to check in?
comment: What a horrible introduction to the hotel--waiting 40 minutes in line to check in. When we had paid in full in advance! One person working the check in counter. Clueless travelers asking advice and directions should have been directed to the concierge. Oh wait, the concierge was off duty for the evening. Get your act together Belvoir. If it weren't the venue for our event, I would not have chosen the hotel. And, I definitely will not stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location. Bad amenities (no free in-room wifi, no refrigerator, no microwave.) Just the basics.
title: Overwhelmingly Underwhelmed
comment: I am always underwhelmed when I stay at a Belvoir hotel. There is never a refrigerator or microwave...no free in-room wifi....and the tv reception is crappy. This time I was on the 12th floor, and could never get the air conditioning cool enough. The water pressure was weak in the shower and when flushing the toilet, and I had to call down to get a hair dryer! Really? The only thing the Belvoir downtown Denver has going for it is the location. It is a great area to walk down 16th street mall.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay!
title: Top Favorite
comment: We enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back. Room was super comfortable and clean. Staff was friendly, professional and international. Concierge was very helpful with local attractions. Pool is nice, hot tub was a bit dirty. Hotel shuttle is great and convenient. Smathers Beach could be cleaned on a daily basis, a lot of smelly seaweed present! Overall a relaxing hotel in a great location!

title: Rooms/ Customer Service Lacking
comment: My husband an I had to go to three rooms before we found one worth paying for. In the first room, the TV was dead, after changing out the TV, it only got analog channels, no cable. When we requested a new room, we got attitude from the front desk. The second room hit us with the distinct smell of sewage the second we walked in. The third room wasn't air conditioned initially, and was the smallest. Overall, it was clean and in working condition, so we stayed.

title: Business type Hotel
comment: Good for short business stays.

title: Excellent Staff
comment: The Belvoir Ft. Worth is clearly an older hotel that has had some cosmetic upgrades. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. The other furniture was a little beat-up, but serviceable. So if a gorgeous room is important to you, this hotel may disappoint.

title: Great
comment: Incredible location, great beds and bedding, and a helpful and friendly staff. Excellent hotel for the price paid.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff, sleep experience, and location
title: Going Home
comment: I have been staying at this hotel for over 10 years, and as my Title suggests it is like going home. The staff, desk, concierge, and room are consistantly effective and friendly. I left money on my desk mid-stay for the room staff, but as I had not specifically noted it as a tip it remained where I left it-I added some dollars and a note for the next day-nothing assumed. The sleep experience is even better than at home-time to upgrade my bedding to Belvoir standards again. BTW, I was working in Springfield but choose to stay in the hotel.

title: Great conference facilities.
comment: I present an engineering seminar at this location for the AGMA every year. My family always accompanies me as well because of the marvelous vacation facilities at this hotel. The conference staff & facilities are well above par. Our meetings are always very successful. Many participants bring their families along thus increasing the desirability of this location for engineering seminars.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Blues Artist Robert Johnson recorded an album here!
title: friendly staff
comment: Love the staff at this hotel, everyone was super nice. From the person who chatted with me in the gift shop to the check in staff who told us all about the history of the hotel, everyone was very friendly and helpful.

title: Consistant Quality
comment: I stay at this property on a regular basis. Each time I visit, I know I will receive the same quality service delivered by a professional and friendly staff. Staff members Yeni, Tina and Grace go the extra mile to make each guest feel special because to them, each guest is special.

title: Understaffed and dirty
comment: The hotel is sold out and the common areas are FILTHY. The concierge room was disgusting and had no services on Friday night or Saturday morning. The hotel is understaffed and service is very slow, friendly and accommodating, but very slow. Ants in meeting room restrooms.

title: Great Stay
comment: We were a bit hesitant after reading some of the reviews about this hotel, but it was fantastic.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will get satisfactory resolution for any issue you have.
title: Everything is great in this hotel.
comment: I will say that hotel exceeded my expectations. Very polite staff, superb facilities, exemplary environment. Only distraction was gross misuse of breakfast and evening refreshment facility by ineligible guests by using card from friends from one club level room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location for Broadway shows and shopping and sightseeing. Wonderful place to stay. Very clean and comfortable
title: Very helpful and courteous
comment: A friend & I visited your hotel the dates of 6/7/12 to 6/11/12. My friend became ill during our stay. Your staff was so quick to help and called an on-call doctor. He was there very quickly and was so very nice and helped my friend. He even called back the next day to see how she was. The hotel is so nice and located in a perfect area. The housekeeping staff were very nice and accomodating. I would definitely recommened your hotel and hopefully I will be back soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Close to all attractions.
title: Front desk staff confused about specials
comment: My wife and I went there for our 40th anniversary. I made reservations with the 800 phone number. I was told I could choose 2 of 5 choices, per night, as they were running a special. When I got to the hotel the front desk person let me choose free parking and $25 food credit. She said I could have the parking for both nights stay but the food credit was for the whole stay, not per night. We ate breakfast at the hotel our first morning, but not the second. When I went to check out the gentleman said I had a $50 food credit for both nights. I informed him what the young girl said when we checked in and he said no it was $25 food credit per night. We didn't eat at the hotel the second day, but there was a charge on my bill for food. When I told him that was not my charge, he took it off of my bill, but also took off the second day food credit because we didn't eat at the hotel the second day. When I informed him we would have gladly eaten there but the young girl told us it was $25 for the whole stay, he said there was nothing he could do. As I finished paying my bill the next person in line stated that they too were not give any food credits.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: I was very impress by the amenities provided: microwave, fridge, free wireless internet, razor, shaving creme, shower gel, sponge, conditioner, shampoo, Q-tips, and cotton balls. I was very impressed!

everyoneShouldKnow: No air conditioning. Avoid during the summer months.
title: No air conditioning????
comment: This is a nice property and would be great in the winter. Summer is a different story. They have no airconditionaing. It was very hot when we were there and when we ask how to turn on the air conditioner we were told to open our screen door and there was a small fan we could turn on.

title: Struggling right now.
comment: I booked the club level wiith access to the club. I was put on the 8th floor ipo the 10th and my key wouldn't open the club door. I was told I had to be platinum to get in. When I showed them my confirmation they activated my key but made me feel like they were doing me a favor.

title: The worst, never again
comment: First of all, taking 10 sometimes 15 minutes to wait on the elevator, bad enough. Beds were very uncomfortable, But when I asked for a cup of coffee, and I was charged $4.20 for a small cup of coffee in a paper cup, that's just plain criminal, you can bet I will never stay at a Belvoir again EVER!!!!

title: Nice Facility in Good Location in SLC
comment: This hotel is good but not great, but it is a good price in a convenient location if your reason for being there is to do business in downtown Salt Lake City. Very attentive staff.

title: the elevator does not work!
comment: the elevator seems possessed and skips floors or takes an excessive amount of time. Staff seems good but understaffed for the full house that was there when i stayed.

title: Some small issues noted that need addressing.
comment: My room constantly smelled of body odor after being serviced. And it wasn't a pleasant smell. It was one that lingered.

title: Close call
comment: More than 24 hours in advance booked a shuttle. Shuttle was more than 20 minutes late - had I not allowed more time I might have missed my flight. Also noted while checking room upon departure that there was food reminants under the bed and between the bed and nightstand! Finally, the bathroom linens were heavily frayed and a pillow case was ripped - not what I would expect at a facility of this caliber!

title: Nice Location
comment: This is a great place to stay its so close to all that Disney has to offer.

title: Great Location, Renovated Rooms!
comment: The rooms at this hotel have been renovated, The price seems to be right. The location is close to Times Square and Central Park. Unfortunately, as a Platinum BPG member, I did not get an upgrade at this hotel. But I was so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms at this hotel, it was fine. I had stayed at this hotel many years ago before the renovation and it has completely changed. Great Job - Belvoir!

everyoneShouldKnow: OLD / Not well maintained. But, has large rooms.
title: Not Impressed
comment: I found the overall hotel old, the hallway carpets looked old and dirty. The club room did not offer the level of service that I find normal at other Belvoir properties. The staff person managing the room was not friendly, they did not offer beer / wine in the evenings, no hot option for breakfast, food not replenshished timely.

title: Overcharges
comment: Disappointing. Twice I ordered room service and both times the prices charged on the bill were MORE than the in room menu. Overcharges ranged from $1 to $2 per item.

title: room cleanliness
comment: I got a room on the 2nd floor last week and it smelled like someone smoked in there for 2 weeks straight. I don't know how housekeeping could have released that room as cleaned. i was moved to another room but it had 2 twin beds instead of the queen in the first room. The staff was courteous and gave me free breakfast for the rest of the stay but I was disappointed in the overall condition of the facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nicely appointed hotel convenient to the theatre district.
title: The refurbishment is well done
comment: Overall, the refurbishment is very well done. The colors, materials, beds and other amenities are excellent. My only criticism is the water flow in the shower. I understand the need for water conservation, but these showers are "barely flow" rather than slow flow.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: The hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful. Our overall stay was excellent. The hotel was pet friendly, which made all the difference.

title: Nice Stay
comment: Would be happy to return. We enjoyed our stay very much.

title: disapointed
comment: I had not stayed here since the opening and had high expectations. This was not met. The houskeeping was slopy and un reliable, room was not up to standard and most requests / complaints were not delt with

title: Nice stay
comment: My stay at the Belvoir for a conference for work was nice. My room was neat and clean everyday, the facilities for the conference were very nice as well. The pool and exercise room were great.

everyoneShouldKnow: An unexpected gem of a hotel where you'd least expect it.
title: Unexpected Gem of a Hotel
comment: Excellent hotel with great amenities. Renovation was nicely done. Staff is very professional and goes out of their way to assist travelers. Way more than I expected from a Belvoir. Hard to find anything negative about this hotel but some constructive criticism: dining options at the hotel are limited with lunch and dinner only available at unaffiliated attached restaurant, which has great food, but is too expensive. Other reasonable dining options are nearby but not within walking distance. Executive lounge is only average and for some reason not available on Thursdays. Executive lounge attendants are friendly but too talkative / familiar with guests.

title: Typical week
comment: I have been traveling to Philadelphia for a few months now, and typically stay at this hotel. I just received Gold status but still dont see any of the benefits. If there is a conceirge floor, they dont tell you. Nor do they even acknowledge a welcome gilf? thought both of those came with status?

title: recent stay
comment: Staff was phenomenal, very helpful in every respect from the front desk to the room service.

title: Great Short Stay
comment: Only stayed 1 night, but we were more than satisfied with our short stay. At first arrival and throughout ck-in, we were greeted courteously and professionally. After ck-in I crossed paths with Andre, I mentioned we were in town for a baseball game and my husbands birthday. What a surprise to find a cake waiting for us when we returned from our night out. We will be back...

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendliest of employees and comfy beds!
title: Absolutely LOVED this hotel!!
comment: I was very impressed with everything about this hotel, starting with arriving very late Friday night and checking in was absolutely great. I am impressed how they come around from behind the counter to give room key and give all good little information about the hotel. Then the room.....I LOVED the bed....the two nights there I slept so good, those beds are the best!!! Everyone there is very friendly and helpful.....I will stay here every time I come to Phoenix!

title: Nice Property
comment: I mix business and pleasure taking 6 kids with me on this trip. The front desk was friendly and easy to workwith as was all other staff members I came in contact with! The rooms were clean and confortable with very little outside noise. I look forward to visiting again.

title: Disappointing
comment: This hotel was in need of a makeover. The elevator walls were dirty, the furniture worn, stain on the bedroom wall, no towel holder in bathroom, bathroom door was swollen & wouldn't shut without slamming it. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. Easy access to highway.

everyoneShouldKnow: Seal between adjoining doors is poor
title: Why could I smell everything from the next room?
comment: We stayed here because we were in town for a concert at Columbus Commons and this was right next door. I loved the location and the room was nice but every time we were in our room we kept smelling a very strong sweet smoky smell and we couldn't figure out what was going on. Finally, when we were trying to go to sleep but couldn't because our eyes and nose were burning, we tracked down the smell. The people in the next room were either burning incense or smoking something and then burning the incense to cover it up and the smell and probably the smoke was coming through the adjoining door. Even though it was shut and locked we were still getting the smell. While I don't really care what people in the other rooms are doing, I was rather perturbed and upset that the seal between the doors was so bad that whatever my neighbors were doing was keeping me from sleeping. I called to the front desk to complain and I also said something to the front desk when I checked out but they both seemed rather unconcerned that this happened. I don't normally splurge on one of the better hotels when I am just spending one night but I was with my daughter and we wanted to make it a relaxing mother daughter event and I was disappointed that this happened and we had to put up with this. One a good note, the bed was very comfortable and the room was nice otherwise.

title: Often Traveller
comment: The room was comfortable and spacious. Staff was always helpful and friendly. Great location in the downtown area. The concierge was extermely helpful arranging for dinner reservations, trasnportation, directions to other locations and venues. The fitness center is one of the best on-site hotel center's I have ever experienced.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff Takes Great Care of You!
title: Great Hotel, Caring Staff, Comfortable Rooms
comment: My husband and I have stayed several nights at this hotel as he has had monthly procedures at the University of Chicago Hospital. The staff are friendly and helpful, our rooms have been handicapped ascessible and very comfortable. We love the view! We've enjoyed the access to the Chicago River Walk and dinner at the Chicago Burger Company on the lower level. This hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and is just 15 minutes away from the University of Chicago Hospital.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service!!!! Everyone is nice and accomodating. Can't say enough about the personal touch these folks give on everything. I feel like this is my home away from home.
title: I love this place
comment: This Belvoir is awesome. Everyone is very friendly and they remember my needs. Clean comfy beds and snacks when done at the office are the best. Even smells nice when you walk into the building.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are beautifully decorated and clean.
title: Wonderful place to stay!
comment: Going in here only seeing what the reviews said and what the pictures looked like on the website...we were very pleased. We were greeted upon arrival by friendly staff and the lady that checked us in was wonderful. Everyone from housekeeping to the pool staff always greeted us with a smile. Very clean. Fitness center was very nice. Enjoyed the paninis from the deli. Didn't eat at the restaurant because we wanted to venture away to eat. I gave it a 4/5 overall because it was near perfect. Easy access to Disney, Winn Dixie (for snacks), and other restaurants. We would stay here again and recommend it for families. Our kids are 15 & 17. They liked our suite a lot. Thanks for your hospitality. Keep up the wonderful service. It does not go unnoticed!

title: Not a 4 Star
comment: Booked a last minute one night trip to Dallas. When I book a downtown 4 Star Hotel I expect to be able to valet park. Not this time valet was full. The parking garage was overcrowded due to non hotel guest using the garage. Room was nice with a good bed and nice flat screen. However, I would expect a refrigerator with pay per use snacks and drinks especially if you are only going to have one snack machine in the entire hotel located in another tower on a floor that requires a separate elevator. The in house magazine says snack vending on every other floor. Not! Among other things no wash cloths, TV went in and out the entire night and the room would not get anywhere close to the 65 that was on the thermostat. Not that I wanted it 65 but 72 would have been good. I guess the part that really got me was the valet. Valet should figure it out. Stack the cars, park them remotely and move them when you can. If you say you have it then you should have it. If you don't, you shouldn't then tell the guest you can go pay $19 and park your self.

title: Beautiful Hotel with the best location in NY. However, customer service needs improvement.
comment: I chose the Belvoir NY for its location and because I am an employee of Grandbourne hotels. The hotel is beautiful and well kept. However, I was really disappointed with the level of service. I ordered room service and I specifically told the agent taking my order that I needed breakfast to arrival at 6am. She told me that a hot breakfast would not be ready that early in the morning, but if I ordered the basket of muffins and bagel with cream cheese I would receive it at 6am. On the next day, my order was not ready at 6:10am. I called room service and they told me that it was on its way. At 6:15am I called room service back to cancel my order because I had a plane to catch. I was very upset that I had to leave hungry and probably late for my flight. When I mentioned the incident to the front desk agent during check out, her response was lousy. She told me that I work in a hotel and I know how things like that happens. Yes, I do work in a hotel, but I am still a customer. I could not believe how someone at her position would treat any customer with such indifference.

everyoneShouldKnow: Per other reviews, front desk sets a poor tone for the property.
title: Not terrible, but....
comment: I try to avoid Belvoirs, because I never know what to expect, and am often disappointed because the brand is so inconsistent in quality.

title: Good time
comment: We just recently stayed - Our only complaint is there were several stains (one really big) on the rug in our room (1018) as well as in the hall on the 10th floor.

title: Nice but...
comment: Found the room worn out, a small bug in the bathroom. Worth part, I call the front desk to remind me about the internet access and the lady was rude to me, don't know why.

everyoneShouldKnow: Right next door to one of the best steakhouse's in Tampa Bay!
title: Great Location
comment: This hotel is convenient for me because I work in Clearwater/St Pete and like the night life near downtown Tampa. Dollar-for-dollar, you can't beat this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: You will need to take taxi or walk to nearby restaurants, if not eating in the hotel.
title: Air conditions are weak
comment: we stayed at your hotel for 4-nights in the south tower, and the air condition was marginal at best. We call for maintenance to look at it, and they check it out, but was not able to recover the a/c. They brought us a box fan for our comfort. When checking out I was informed to request the north tower , or central tower, because they were newer buildings.My wife and I came home with are Alergy out of wack, very disturbing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its becoming run down and the rooms are just not clean (incl. bath walls) TV is poor quality. wear your shoes when walking around room. Curtains were hanging off the brackets (broken) dusty rooms, dusty lights. lightbulbs burnt out. Shower head coming out of wall. Motel status for sure.
title: Not Impressed
comment: To be honest...I understand the rate was good ($89) and Its not rated 4 star or even 3 BUT I do expect a few things to be the same no matter how many stars....a CLEAN bathroom and clean walls (I don't like to look at toothpaste markings on the faucet spout) from previous guest or hair on the comforter or an AC unit that barely kicks out cold air. We went camping the following night and I honestly had a better nights sleep and cleaner bathrooms there. You need to prepare yourself for the worst and stay only one night! Pool is a seperate bldg. that closes at 8:45pm. Needs a renovation badly! For young kids there is NO DISNEY channel. This is a MOTEL status hotel to be honest.

title: Good hotel, but eat somewhere else.
comment: Service was VERY, VERY slow in the Draft bar. I sat at the bar for 10 minutes and nobody served me. I then moved to a table and waited at least another 5 minutes before anybody said boo to me.

title: Guest check in
comment: My check in was great. However, I added my sister's name to the room so she can pick up the key the following day. I gave her room # 3035 instead of 5035. The check in staff was mean to my sister when 3035 wasn't under my name. Then my sister asked her to look under Mandy Chan instead. I was surprise the staff would be mean to my sister.

title: Convention Appropriate
comment: Stayed for first time. Hotel is really not in a central location for tourism, more appropriate if part of a convention that's next door. The pool area is good, but closes down too soon ? Needs to have more party atmosphere, especially on a Fri night. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Marina and Bay towers are not close together at all. Be careful when booking. Also, when getting the shuttle from the airport, go to the "rental car shuttle" area- you may have to wait a little bit.
title: Come for a Conference, Stay for the View
comment: I recently attended a week-long conference at the Belvoir San Diego Hotel & Marina. We were treated like royalty! Stephen in Banquets was an especial help to me, providing me with materials I needed to set up displays. Angelica in HR was also extremely helpful and Marisa, our meeting planner went above and beyond the call of duty to make our event shine. The food was excellent and plentiful. The only minor issue I had was that because our attendance was so big, our meals had to be outside in the pavilion and on the lawn- which were a bit of a hike from the meeting rooms. The location is great- right near the airport; although you can definitely hear the planes taking off, it's not an overwheming noise. There is an airport shuttle (comfortable and frequent) and a separate shuttle which can take you to the Gaslamp Quarter for $1.

title: Very accomodating!!
comment: Everything was great! I brought friends for a women's event and they were very impressed with our accomodations. I love that as an BPG member we get special treatment. And of course with being with ladies we liked having the mall at our back door!! I especially want to thank Tristen for being so helpful when I requested by phone a late checkout. That was wonderful!! I have nothing but good things to say. I would defininately stay there again if needed.

title: Simply Excellent
comment: Staff was simply excellent. Especially Valet, Bellman, Concierge; all performed above/beyond service even though our stay was short in duration. And the courteousness was remarkable. Hotel was great location, rooms large, stay very comfy. First time at this property, will likely now become our preferred Houston venue.

everyoneShouldKnow: Isn't BPG friendly hotel. Can't use BPG Suite Upgrades.
title: This hotel is NOT BPG status Friendly
comment: Greatly disappointed with lack of BPG recognition and amenities at this hotel

title: A very nice place to stay
comment: I stayed here for a week-long conference. The location is excellent - very close to the French Quarter and the trolley.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place and in a great location
title: Class Reunion
