comment: During our class reunion several classmates and myself stayed at the Belvoir Atlanta Hotel the service and staff were very accommodating the rooms were nice and clean. When I arrived the front desk agents made me feel very welcomed, I can not wait to stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want your room cleaned and serviced, you should request service at the desk.
title: Housekeeping needs a Sweeping
comment: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times for business and was looking forward to returning for a weekend meeting.

title: Inconvenience to staff
comment: While I appreciate that the hotel spent millions on the renovations, the area for investment needs to be staff. Throughout my stay I felt like I was an inconvenience to the staff. They consistently provided me with inaccurate information about the Club Lounge, and I felt they wanted to barter for my late check-out time. As a BPG Platinum member I was disappointed my the level of service at the hotel and it was remarkably different from the stellar service I receive at other hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not the best value in Chicago.
title: Far too dirty for a Belvoir
comment: This is a fairly typical property with the comfortable bed and service charges for virtually everything except the air you breathe. My room had someone else's hair in the shower and something mysterious around the toilet seat bolts. Thank goodness I bring my own disinfectants and cleaners. I was participating in a conference so a number of people needed to be fed at the same time, but there really is no excuse for dirty utensils and glasses waiting on the tables. The conference food was ok but have had better even at a conference.

everyoneShouldKnow: service is exceptional...and the most comfortable beds...
title: What a fabulous staff!!!
comment: Everything went above and beyond my expectations. The rooms are beautiful, slept like a baby on those mattresses. Breakfast was great...the staff at the restaurant was fabulous. Special shout out to Daysi.(she should get a raise) She made our stay so special. Elena and Melvin at the front desk were so great giving us directions, etc. The shuttle drivers were outstanding. It almost feels like a family there and they included us. Such a special time. I didn't want to leave. Hope I get to go back someday.

title: An amazing hotel
comment: I found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. The rooms were clean, the views were amazing and the upgrade to the Concierge Level was well worth the $50/day extra.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Place for Special Events and Overnight Accommodations!!
title: Great Place for Special Events and Overnight Accommodations!!
comment: We had our wedding reception at the Belvoir last year and could not have been happier with the whole experience. The wedding coordinator (Erin) and banquet staff were all a pleasure to work with and made our event better than I ever could have imagined. They paid attention to every little detail and went above and beyond our expectations. We had many overnight guests stay after the wedding, and all of our guests commented on how great everything was and how happy they were with the overnight accommodations. We just returned to spend the night for our one year anniversary. They have since completely renovated the whole hotel. The new lobby area looks amazing and the rooms were updated, clean, and comfortable. Everyone at this hotel is so friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for special events as well as overnight stays.

title: Good hotel
comment: I stay here often and I do like the hotel. Staff is very good and helpful. The one downside is that the condition of the hotel is deteriorating. I often of late find problems with the rooms...with 24 nights spent here in the last 6 months, I have been in alot of rooms. Need to improve awareness of properly working room features...otherwise I find the hotel very convenient and definitely recommend. One slight observation is that they do treat plantinum members well, although I slipped to gold this year and I definitely feel the difference!

title: A++++ Service and Facilities
comment: Where do I begin...... the service was amazing and the rooms well appointed. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The GM was always available to guests and would often stop and inquire about our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Deal DIRECTLY with the hotel and not the third party layers. The hotel will do you right.
title: Hotel rating
comment: It would be great if the key cards would work. We had Floor Manager try a number of times and she could not get the key card to work. In the elevator, a staff member had to try several time before the key card would work.

title: Mediocre
comment: Bed was comfortable, but they didn't change the sheets unless you put a card on the bed. Didn't know this till we left after 4 nights. The bottom sheet was put on wrong so it kept slipping off. I remade the bed. Our coffee pot did not work the first morning. I left a note to replace it. It had not been replaced later that day, so I called to tell them and they said they would get it replaced by that afternoon. Still no coffee pot when we got back to the room in the late pm. So I called again and they finally brough one up. The guy that gave us the room said it had a fantastic view to the resort. Well, if you call the roof of the building fantastic, then I guess it was. Our room keys quick working on the third night and I had to go to the desk to get it fixed but didn't have my id with me, ofcourse. Then had to wait for security and he again asked me for my id. Well if I had my id with me it would have been taken care of at the desk! Food and drink prices were out of sight. We had dinner one night at Shula's steak house and the food was luke warm. Not at all happy with our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff does not try to please it's customers
title: Disappointed in Belvoir Colonial Hotel
comment: About once a year my friend and I get away for one night to the Belvoir Colonial in Wakefield for a "Mom's Day Off" from our responsibilities of running our houses and taking care of our children. On June 23, we stayed at the Belvoir Colonial in Wakefield, MA and the hotel lost power from about 6:30 until 10pm that night. The generator did not work, the hallway was pitch black and it was not an enjoyable experience at all. The staff said there was nothing they could do about the power loss but also admitted that the generator did not work when it should have. I would like a refund because I feel like the hotel did not provide a very satisfying and enjoyable experience for my friend and I.

title: Convenient
comment: This hotel is centrally located in Arlington to the Ballpark and Cowboy Stadium. However, it is very expensive to eat here. Dinner is outrageously expensive, nothing on the menu for kids. Find local restaurants before your stay. Also there is no sundry store in the hotel so be sure to bring everything you might need.

title: Going to be great
comment: Overall, the stay was great. Very friendly staff. Hotel is under construction to upgrade which I can't wait for. It probably needed it a couple of years back but it was tolerable. The room is old; the rest of the hotel was nice..

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location on the island and most perfect setting
title: Better than ever
comment: Spent last week at this hotel. It was my 4th visit in the past 9 years.

title: Great View From Club Lounge
comment: Very nice staff and willing to help. love the Club Lounge, what a view. The hotel was sold out so no upgrade but other wise had a great stay!

title: Great Service and Support
comment: I facilitated training at this hotel for an entire week. Maxine made things fall into place and was a terrific resource.

title: great hotel in a great location
comment: Service was excellent, food excellent,

title: A Bit Surprised
comment: We have stayed in numerous Grandbournes resort and were definitely disappointed here. No valet parking on arrival, no staff to assist with luggage to our room, strange rules like having to have a paper card to charge anything to our room. That was very inconvenient particulary when at the pool. The pool was lacking in staff and had to go to the bar for anything we needed. We were accustomed to a much higher level of service than received here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location - close to main shopping areas, spas and easy walking distance to Zoo.
title: Great location and friendly staff
comment: The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly. The gym was one of the best hotel gyms I have been in - fantastic. I wasn't happy with having paper cups in the room instead of crockery for the tea/coffee. There was a lack of normal teabags in the room.

title: Very rude
comment: The staff checking me in was very rude and not helpfull at all. I will never stay here again unless I can't find another hotel.

title: dissapointed
comment: this was my second time staying at this hotel and this experience was terrible. The sink in the bathroom was clogged,the sliding door between the bedroom and bathroom did not work,so there was no privacy.the telephone in the bedroom did not work and i complained everyday but no one came to fix it.instead they gave us a free breakfast buffet on sunday.the parking lot is dark and isolated and there is no free wifi access in the room

everyoneShouldKnow: The friendliness and the service is wonderful.
title: Wonderful treatment
comment: I had an incident with the bathroom door handle and they were right there to fix it..and gave me and my family a complimentary breakfast...The employes from the Office to the Maids were so friendly and helpful...It was a delight.

title: Large Room, Poor upkeep
comment: Positives:

title: Great Experience
comment: My wife and I stayed here last weekend and were more than satisfied with our experience. Everyone on the staff was very courteous and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. From the woman who checked us in to the concierge to the restaurant staff- all provided great service. On-site parking was a breeze. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and we will definitely be back.

title: first time here
comment: nice clean hotel, very friendly staff, attened a conference at this hotel and thought they did an excellent job, would recommed to anyone

everyoneShouldKnow: Find another, it certainly is not the only one in town.
title: Needs Improvement
comment: First Belvoir I have been in that was so run down. Fairly clean I guess. Stains on carpet, noisy air conditioner.Bathtub looks like it had been painted and paint was chipping, scratched.Told staff I did not want/need help with my things but they just would not go away. Front desk staff was fine with one exception of a lady that acted as though I was not there when I was standing right in front of her.

title: Reunion in the Desert
comment: My wife and I were recent guests at Belvoir Wild Horse. We enjoyed our time at the resort. Staff, pool and amenities were great! The only slight negative was that the walk from the parking lot to the room was a little longer than anticipated. However, I would not hesitate to stay here on a future trip. Walking trails are great and the golf course is beautiful! Overall, a great place to stay!

title: Better than Expected!
comment: Good location; nice QUIET rooms; complimentary water; and most impressively, room rate quoted included parking AND all taxes - a joy to find an additional $60 or so NOT added to the final bill.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great remodel...this hotel is definitely a "value added" hotel...you experience service and quality well beyond the cost of the stay.
title: A great stay!
comment: We have stayed at this hotel many times both before and after remodel. The location is excellent and the rennovations are amazing. The rooms are very pretty and comfortable for families and the pool area is large and offers soemthing for every age. We recently went over for the weekend and were celebrating my 3 year old's birthday. Melissa at the pool heard it was his birthday and came over with a cupcake, balloons and a little stuffed animal. It made him feel so special. The chefs in the restaurant and the pool staff all joined in to sing to him. It was WONDERFUL. Congratuations on a great remodel I highly recommend this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice facilities in a great location
title: Superior in every way
comment: Lovely location; efficient, helpful and pleasant staff; good facilities. Airport shuttle a nice plus and good connections to city via economical bus route service.

title: Nice hotel near airport
comment: I only spent one night here, but it was a nice hotel. I primarily chose it for its proximity to the airport and I could take a shuttle to catch my flight. The room was bright and clean and the staff was accomodating.

title: Expected More
comment: Reservation was bungled and I had to change from the Dolphin to the Swan half-way through my stay. Wi-fi is frustratingly bad and the pillowtop on the matresses are very lumpy. If you shower after 9am in the Swan you will have cold water.

title: Couldn't be better
comment: This was our first time at this hotel. We know New York well and wanted to stay in the area of Canal Street. The location was superb. Room was just the right size, and the bathroom also was sized correctly, with an excellent shower. Staff was accomodating, friendly, and extremely helpful. Although we had internet access in the room, the computer "pod" in the lobby was an excellent idea. Overall we are very pleased with this hotel and will definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

title: Gabel 416
comment: We have two concerns that affected us negatively:

title: Great hotel, Green Initiative needs work
comment: The hotel and room were comfortable and met our expectations. I liked that they offer a Green Initiative, where you can decline daily maid service for new towels and linens. Instead, you receive a $5 food voucher or 500 points for each day you participate. We received the voucher the first morning, but the two subsequent mornings of our visit I had to go to the front desk to request our voucher. A minor inconvenience, but still something that they should address if they are going to offer this incentive.

title: Great hotel for the Money
comment: I booked this Hotel for the convience of it being located near Cooks Childrens Hospital. I called the day of arrival to book our room. They still were able to offer me a discount of the hospital rate. Check in was fast and the hotel was very nice. They gave us a King room located on a corner. Lots of room for my little boy to play. Beds were a little hard, but hey for the price and only one night we managed!! Will stay here again if we have to go back.

title: Poor service, poor responsiveness
comment: Would expect a full-service Belvoir to do much better than it did.

title: Perfect Weekend
comment: It was my birthday weekend, and they made me feel so special. To the fantastic room that we were given to the special treat that we received. I was surprised and thrilled with the special effort that was made for us. We have stayed at the hotel several times and this is why I will keep going back. I recommend it to everyone

everyoneShouldKnow: Not able to handle a big group sports event. Location is great.
title: disappointed
comment: We were in town for the NYS football tournament. I felt that your hotel was extremely ill equipped to handle 100+ teenage football players and their families. 1st day the washer and dryer was broken and not being fixed until the next day. That is a little tough with a bunch of sweaty, smelly football uniforms that are needed the next day. The staff did offer to have uniforms cleaned for us, which was nice. They said it is a little expensive, which I was willing to pay BUT we wouldn't get uniforms back until 6 pm the next day when we had a 1:15 game. We had to go find a laundromat. Staff got me an address of one that was closed down. Not very helpful! There were 4 of us in a room with 4 towels. 2 were football players. I had to call 3 times for more towels since the kids showered a few times a day. 2 of the 3 times I waited for at least an hour to get those towels. Once I was told towels were in the dryer. You guys should have been more prepared for this. Also, how can you start the complimentary breakfast at 7 when a few teams had to be at fields at 7? So I wound up paying the extra $20 for complimentary breakfast and didn't get it. I would love to get a refund for that for the 4 days! Also, one day you started the breakfast earlier and ended earlier without notifying guests. Not fair. If you want to make a guest happy, you will credit me (at least) for the "complimentary" breakfasts and even a little more of a credit would be nice since I had to drive around and find a laundromat since the one given to me by your staff was closed down. Hope you do the right thing to make me feel better about my stay with you.

title: Great place to stay
comment: One of the best Belvoirs I have stayed at. The amenities are great and the location is close to the Riverwalk. Only negative was the hot tub was normally not hot enough.

title: Poor service
comment: Arrived at 4:30pm (room check in is supposed to be 3 pm) and had to wait almost 2 hours for a room. You need to better organize your rooms after other guests check out.

title: Problems Solved
comment: In short, there was a problem with my bags, and Sean, the manager resolved the problem promptly and professionally

title: Terrible
comment: Every time we asked for something the service outrageously unsatisfactory. This included being told room service would take 30 min but took an hour and 10, causing us to be late for our conference, finding a live fly in the salad from room service, having to call the front desk multiple times for things, staff having bad attitudes, not getting our fridge delivered for 24 hours and being charged for that day, the restaurant not being open at a time that our conference broke for a meal (and not enough time to go out), the list goes on. I would never stay here again.

title: Tulane visit
comment: Beautiful lobby, excellent location, nice front desk staff. I turned Platinum that day, not much to-do about that. I was still considered gold I suppose, until the stay was completed.It was a bigger deal to me. We had a nice, though small room on the 35th floor. Excellent views.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The hotel is simply great. The view on the ocean side is amazing. The pool is excellent and the beach is only a few steps away. My only complaint was the rewards program. I booked my stay through US Airways vacations and they wouldn't give me credit for my hotel stay with the BPG rewards program since I didn't book my hotel directly through Grandbourne. That's just lame.

title: everything was nice, except
comment: The overall experience was excellent except for one thing. There never was trash bags in the room. But overall everything and everyone was great and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect much other than a great location.
title: Time to step up your game
comment: This is a very tired hotel with good bones. The location is excellent and the room was perfectly nice but...

everyoneShouldKnow: You will need to take the shuttle into town... and the beach across from this hotel is and always has smelled like a sewer. So you will need a car... or the shuttle, which is very nice and easy to use.
title: Great stay ... so much better than before~
comment: This was my 4th stay at the Belvoir Suites. I stay here to check it out for clients... and I enjoy the rooms. The free shuttle to downtown Key West is very convenient. Yet... in the years past, the staff was rude, not helpful in any way, and just the whole feel at the hotel was that no one was happy. This time, my husband and I both thought there must be a new manager. The front desk was awesome... very professional... a complete 180 turn around from the last visits. Rooms were clean and all of our needs were met. Perfect!

title: disappointed
comment: This is my 3rd or 4th stay here and the only time I have a complaint. I stayed in the north end on the 15th floor.There are three elevators on that end and only one was working the whole time I was there.The ice machine did not work on my floor but a nice worker walked me to the other tower so I could get some.Also,the audio on the TV would sometimes go out. I also wanted to lay out be the pool but there was no place available & the pool was packed.

title: This hotel has a friendly staff
comment: I would recommend this hotel! The staff was very friendly and very helpful. I love that I could just walk across the street to the Galleria and shop!

title: Only if there is no alternative . . .
comment: This was a second chance stay; never again! Valet attendants were inattentive upon check in, I interrupted a jam session attempting to hand over my keys. Front desk attempted to make up for that with a tray of goodies, which was appreciated. However, the restaurant hostess ensured we were unwelcome again as we inconvenienced her to seat us. Club level was literally over the top as another, and exceptionally rude, guest with a chip on his shoulder was covering for the missing attendant. Who, upon his return, partially disrobed in the middle of the eating area in order to tuck his shirt back in and pull up his socks - unbelievable!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for walking to most sites.
title: Dirty Dishes and needs maintenance
comment: I was disappointed in my stay in this hotel. My shower curtain holder had rust on it. The room was just ordinary with nothing to really make it stand out, which as a Belvoir, I expected better.

title: GOOD HOTEL
comment: A/C RUNS GREAT IF YOU LIKE IT COLD. ONCE TURN A/C ON, HIGHEST SETTING AVAILABLE WAS 78. SO IF YOU GOT COLD AT THAT SETTING THE CHOICES WERE TURN IT OFF OR COVER UP.

title: Belvoir Lake Buena Vista
comment: xcellant stay at the Belvoir Lake Buena Vista. The Belvoir just went thru a renovation and everything is great. Sliding doors could use a little work for sound proofing but wasnt bad. Hotel over all was comfortable and quiet. The only real complaint I had was witht he internet sevice and support. Spent 2 days trying to get their IT department to fix a problem witht heir system that prevented my laptop from accessing the internet. Service wasnt very knowleadgable about their equipment. I would also add the resort and parking fees to the negative list. Almost another $20 a day.

everyoneShouldKnow: That you must pay for parking on top of your hotel bill!
title: Our 21st wedding anniversary!
comment: This was a small get away planned to celebrate our 21st anniversary. I orginally booked to stay somewhere else and my husband decided this would be more comfortable! I have a chronic pain illness and comfort in the bed and coolness in the room were two things that were of utmost importance! We checked in and went to our room which other then being across from the lounge appeared suitable. After sitting in the room for a half hour or so we notice the room was not cooling down as we were both hot from being out in the Texas heat. As night fell the hall became noiser and the 2 and a half to 3 inch gap at the bottom of our door allowed for excessive light and noise in the room.. so much for resting peacefully. The bed was was fairly comfortable although I must say have had more comfortable beds at some ower level hotels then this one which for being a Belvoir and upper class hotel I expected more. The hotel itself was very nice and staff friendly however parking was a nightmare as you pay either an outrageous price to valet park or pay the $12 or $13 dollars a day to park in the garage. There are limited paid parking spots around the hotel which we did find to be free on the weekend! I am not saying dont stay here I just wasnt as thrilled as one should be considering the hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not take the elevators and you have to ram the door to get in and wiggle the toilet tank to fill and flush!
title: Disappointed
comment: When we checked in, we waited for the elevator and rode it to the 9th floor where we received the red and green light to enter the room, but could not enter. I rode the elevator back down to the front desk and was instructed some door handles were installed the wrong way and I needed to lift up on the door handle instead of push down. I told the gentleman it seemed as if the door was locked from the top bolt, but he insisted it was an installation problem with the door handle. I rode the elevator back up and tried again unsuccessfully openening the door. This time I took the stairs down 9 flights to again ask for assistance and that we were now going to be late for our opening NYS ceremonies. I told the gentleman again that it seemed to be locked from the inside top latch. He accompanied me to the room and called the technician. It was latched from the inside, but we were also told it jams/sticks to the top bolt. It did indeed stick because many times we were faced with the same situation and literally had to ram the door to get in. Besides the door, we had to wiggle the toilet tank in order for it to fill up with water so we could flush it. It was an inconvenient experience. Not to mention the right elevator would freeze, not open or partially open as well as skip floors when riding in it. :( Disappointed!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not really convenient to downtown Charleston but is convenient to roads to both Charleston and areas north along the shore.
title: Shuttle Service could be improved
comment: It is very nice that there is a free shuttle to downtown Charleston that runs every four hours. However, the service could be improved. We signed up and caught the 6:00 pm shuttle with no problem. We were let off at the visitors center which was a good location. We were given a ticket to use to return on the last shuttle at ~10:00 pm. We arrived well ahead of the 10:00 schedule and waited. Another couple joined us right at 10:00. At 10:20 we called the hotel and were told that the shuttle would be there in 15 minutes that it had been delayed due to a run to the airport. At ~10:45 the shuttle arrived and the driver indicated that the previous driver had told him that there were no passengers for 10:00. We got back in good order but it begs the question, why were we given the ticket and asked to call if we were not going to use the shuttle and then the in house communication indicated that there were no passengers. This disconnect leads to a credibility gap and hurts the hotel's reputation. The drivers were very apologetic and courteous but the inconsistent story marred the experience.

title: Staycation
comment: Treated exceptionally well! Stayed overnight for my daughter's birthday. Staff and facitlities were amazing.

title: Great Hotel Stay
comment: I have had the need to stay at many hotels while travelling with my children for sports and this hotel was extremely accomodating. The room was also extremely clean and my requests were met expeditously.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel for Disneyland vacationers & families with children
title: Clean and comfortable
comment: This hotel was a great location for Disneyland vacationers. Close to parks and either walking distance (we did not do since we have young children) or shuttle bus. Shuttle was $10/adult for 3 day pass. They say it comes every 20 min, but expect to wait up to 30 min. This hotel is the first stop to the parks, so you do make another stop at one other hotel. It is, however, the first stop after leaving the park which is nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the best location on Poipu, lots of beachfront property and close to restaurants and shopping.
title: June in Kauai
comment: We were so excited to return to the Belvoir Kauai. We had been there last year during their reconstruction and were eager to see the finished facility. This hotel definitely has the best location on Poipu. We took advantage of the new ocean front pool which was wonderful. We had a great experience right from the beginning at check in. Amy Victorino was personable, and welcoming at the front desk. The breakfast buffet had the best view in Poipu. The price was reasonable and the food was delicious. We especially appreciated the friendly omelette maker. Thanks also to staff member Owen who told us about the turtle cove within walking distance of the hotel. He was right we walked to the location and saw about a dozen turtles right near the shore. We had booked through kayak so our bed choice was not guaranteed and we ended up with 2 double beds.They offered to change our room but we were happy with our fourht floor room so did not change. Next time we will book directly through the hotel. A great beginning to our vacation before we headed to the other side of the island. Mahalo!

title: Started off great...Ended on a sour note
comment: Arrived 20 June and departed 24 June.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are warm and friendly and the location is fantastic
title: Wonderful as usual
comment: Once again a lovely stay. I have stayed at this hotel many times since 1992 and to me it just feels like home. The staff as usual were wonderful and helpful and tried to solve any problem that I had with a smile. Special thanks goes to Sharen on Reception and Tommy on the Tours & Activity desk. I look forward to being able to stay again at the hotel

title: Not a happy platinum
comment: Checked in on Monday 6/18 and had to be placed on the second floor on the wing instead of the main tower. was told the club floor was full. (really?) Anyway went to the lounge and found out that had no access. Went to the front desk and asked to grant me access. The clerk looked at my record and told me I am not a platinum. Asked her to double check my BPG number she said that my status had expired which I know it did not. Asked them to look up on the file to find my correct BPG number. They said they could not find it. Went back to my room, logged in and made sure my status is still Platinum and got my number. Went back to the front desk they finally updated my record. Gave the key card to the clerk asked her to rekey my access. She said there was no need she already gave me access. So I went up to the lounge only to find out the key still did not work, I went back to the front desk and questioned how could it be so many errors which caused me great inconvenience. The clerks insisted that she gave me access and refuse to go to the lounge with me to verity. Finally my card key was replaced but no explanation or apology.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is a vacation in itself! You can rent boats and jet skis from the hotel, go to the spa, enjoy excellent food, or just relax at the pool.
title: A Little Piece of Paradise
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir for a conference and stayed a couple extra days to sightsee. The hotel was beautiful and the view from the room was amazing. Everyone I met on the staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge helped me find things to do when I wasn't at the conference, and the hotel has a shuttle that goes around the city for only $1 per day! The rooms and grounds were very clean. The exercise room is enormous and goes both inside and outside! I noticed they had activities for kids to do at the pool including movies at night on the weekends. The hotel really isn't in walking distance of restaurants, and the hotel's 3 restaurants could get pretty pricey. The food was excellent though, definitely worth the money! My only complaint is that there are no refrigerators in the rooms, but you might be able to ask for one. I didn't ask. I had a great experience and would definitely stay here again.

title: Staff and Hotel Great with Some Room Annoyances
comment: Checkin staff took extra time to assign us a room that perfectly suited our needs and the housekeeping staff as well as the concierge, bellmen and auto valets were all very accommodating and considerate. The patio door was rough to open and one drawer in the clothes dresser continued to open. The bathroom size was somewhat small. But the minor annoyances in the room were overcome by the overall feel of the hotel and the wonderful staff. We attended a wedding and the ballroom, the outside patio and the starlight room were all perfect venues for the ceremony and celebration.

everyoneShouldKnow: Platinum members, no special service, no upgrades,
title: 5 star but 2 star service
comment: club lounge, over crowded, no control, screaming kids.

everyoneShouldKnow: $23 parking charge, $10.00 in-room Wi-Fi charge PER ITEM USED!!! Room was not serviced!!!!!!!!!!!
title: Room Not Serviced - No apology
comment: My family of 4 were in Columbus last weekend to volunteer for the Ohio State Special Olympics on the OSU Campus. We had to be up very early each day and did not return to our room until late in the day each evening. We did not expect much, just fresh beds and towels at the end of each day.

title: Nice Resort, Amenities, Staff
comment: The staff, amenities and resort were all very nice. We have been gold members for several years and was disappointed to see that friends of ours staying at the same time with no status were upgraded to a suite. Also, the rooms (4160) A/C would keep going back to 72+ degrees and blow out hot air. It was 110 outside and this was very disruptive to our sleep at night and relaxation during the day. We called the front desk and they told us to turn it to low...that didn't work.

title: rooms needed cleaning...
comment: This hotel "got the job done" but I had to call down to have my bed made after realizing, late night, that there was a twin-sized top sheet, no fitted sheet, and no additional top sheet to accompany the ill-fitting one, positing as a "made bed." When we arrived, there was also a hair clip & food crumbs on the floor. It made me realize, they did not clean my room before checking me in. UGH. The cleaning staff who remedied the situation was perfectly delightful, however. I also found it odd that there was NO SAFE in the room. Overall, the location was good, all else was fine- not luxurious, but would be fine for business travel on a budget.

everyoneShouldKnow: When a problem was brought to their attention they resolved it to the best of their ability.
title: Why I was not satisfied with my stay at this hotel.
comment: Upon arrival, my expectations were met. The hotel was convient to the conferance I was attending, the room was satisfactory and the staff was outstanding. As my stay continued a series of events occured that clouded my stay. Dinner at the restaurant one evening resulted in bread ties in my soup. Needless to say, I was no longer hungry. Upon returning to the room, it was not cleaned, after a further delay the room was cleaned and when I returned the tub was not clean, Apparently when cleaned by housekeeping the tub had backed up and was not properly rinsed. In addition, bugs were found in my bed on two ocassions and charges were made to my bill from the bar, I had not gone to the bar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wake up early if you want breakfast in the club lounge and don't hype your kids about using the pool
title: Thought it had improved...
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Brookfield last weekend, because it was the only BPG hotel available that weekend. Upon check in, we were given a room in the Milwaukee section, which was an upgrade from our stay last year. Nicer, newer, much more well kept room. We were also given access to the club level although we were one floor down, as we are gold members. We arrived late and thought we would take the kids to the pool. The pools were extemely crowded and appeared to have some sort of junior high boys birthday party going on. There were about 15 rowdy boys eating pizza and making a complete mess in the pool area. They also made us feel uncomfortable as if we were ruining their party. I was very surprised that the hotel would allow this in a "business" hotel. We went out and returned hours later in the evening, the party was still going on, and the pool area was trashed. The next day staff had come to put out towels on the chairs and open the pool. The trash still remained all over the tables, pizza boxes and such. It was gross. We never used the pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to Disney's Boardwalk and to Epcot
title: Poor customer service
comment: Bed mattress was soiled and smelled very badly - requested it be changed but it was not. Only given extra layers of linens over it. Also needed dry cleaning services and had to speak to them 3 times before it was picked up. Cafe in lobby is very slow in the morning - very long line with no sense of urgency from the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location; hotel is adjacent to one of the best beaches in Hawaii and very close to good restaurants and shops!
title: Back to our honeymoon hotel
comment: It's our 4th time staying at this hotel, and Belvoir has made numerous upgrades and changes since our last visit ([YEAR-4]). Though most of which were great, there were some that didn't feel right to us. One thing that disappointed us was the changes made to the old Shell's restaurant--we loved the open-air dining and the clear, unobstructed view of Kiahuna beach. The whole place has been changed (to Rum Fire) and is now completely enclosed (not sure if they open the windows on certain days, though). The breakfast buffet at Rum Fire was also a disappointment--the selection is not what one would expect paying $23 pp (caveat: we only ate there once during our stay).

title: Disappointed
comment: I was never able to get computer access. On the first day, I was busy and when I tried to get access at 10:30 at night, I just got put on hold. The next day a repairman came to my room but it was several hours before the problem was repaired. Not only was the computer cable upplugged, but the coffee maker plub was plugged into the lamp. Seems like a house keeping person woud have spotted this. Also, I am a Grandbourne member. When I called for a late checkout, I was only extended to 1 PM. My friend who is also a Grandbourne member was extended to 4 PM. Not a good stay.

title: Great Visit to Key West
comment: Wonderful place! Super nice people on staff! The shuttle back and forth to town was a huge plus!

title: Disappointing Weekend Away
comment: Issues with room key, broken elevator, indoor pool closed due to chemical imbalance. Lobby is chaotic like Grand Central, room service trays left outside of hotel room doors. We will not be back and do not recommend this hotel to others. Contacted GM, Front Desk Spvsr and Manager on Duty - ZERO response.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's located about 2 good blocks from the beach, the parking garage is not attached to the hotel and there is a daily fee to park.
title: Birthday Break
comment: We recently stayed 4 nights in June to celebrate our birthdays. Check-in was easy and without incident. Our BPG membership was recognized and the room type requested was ready upon our arrival. Rooms on the Club Floor were much better than rooms located on the lower floors. The food served in the Club Lounge was plentiful and the attendants were very caring. They even provided cake for us to celebrate our birthday! Check out was also quick.

title: The staff here are wonderful
comment: We were booked into a King room. The hotel had no more kings available, so they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite, which was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: BPG Gold Members do not have access to Club Lounge and would not let me pay for access
title: Unfriendly Front Desk Staff
comment: Location is good. Beach is clean and Private. However, front desk staff was not very nice. Gold BPG members are not allowed in club lounge (was not stated in their webpage). They need help with customer service.

title: Great 30 year anniversary
comment: My wife and I spent one week here,June 20-27,for our 30 years of marriage.There could not have been a better place to enjoy our time.There was not one employee that we came across that did not offer a smile and greeting.The customer service at this hotel is excellent.The people who work here do honestly enjoy what they do,which makes the services they perform even greater than any other.We passed employees even on the street who took the Belvoir name on their name tag to a respect that should be commended by any and everyone.Tiffany,assistant manager of food services,was so gracious and pleasing every time we saw her and always on top of her job at hand.Darlene was our waitress for breakfast at the RumFire most of our stay and was excellent.Paul,the bartender,was great and friendly even when he saw us the day we were leaving at another location outside the bar.Sunny and Josh(scuba),that gave my wife lessons in their special activities were fantastic.My wife really enjoyed these activates along with the snorkling and surfing lessons that were taught by a young man whose name regretfully I do not remember.Concierge Ryan helped me set up a surprise romantic dinner on our 30th.To top this dinner, our waiter (GeoFranco) was more than a waiter.He made the dinner more memorable than anyone could imagine with his knowledge and respect for his job at hand.Even in the wind and rain and another function going on, he surpassed his job.There are so many people to acknowledge that we had contact with that if I could list each name with a star rating they would all receive all 5 stars.This Belvoir has got to be the best on so many levels.We look forward to our next stay.The people who work at this resort, should be held high and respected in the eyes of anyone and everyone.As you can tell we truly enjoyed our stay and thank you for the great experience.

title: great room but not flexible for stay time
comment: I had reserved a room a couple days prior. The room was wonderful. I was upgraded from my booking due to overcrowding. The suite was spacious and clean. Here's the con: I was in between flights and though I checked in at 8:30-9 pm no accommodation could be made for a late check out time. This was unfortunate but not unforgivable. The staff was friendly otherwise. The layout of the hotel is a maze-like but people were more than willing to help me find my room. A good but pricey experience overall.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay here it is dirty, people are rude, employees complaining about their supervisors. Needs complete facelift. Peeling paint, dirty windows and lobby. Would not accept AARP Card.
title: Worst hotel experience ever
comment: I made reservations 4 months in advance. Check in was at 3:00 p.m. Could not get in our rooms until almost 5:00 p.m. Was told they were short handed...not my problem. I think our rooms were given away because of the amount of people there for a competition. They simply overbooked. Other people around us were just as upset as we were and they also had to wait 2 to 3 hrs. Rooms were upgraded and discounted $50. but the upgrade...there was no continental breakfast the next morning, too busy with all the students breakfast with the competition group. When we did get in our room it was dirty and we were looking forward to looking at the view over the city, but the windows in the room were so filthy we couldn't see out of them. The whole place seemed unkept & desperately needs a facelift. We loved the plaza and had a good time. Once of my sisters flew in from N. Carolina & the four of us were looking forward to a nice stay also. Unfortunately the nice stay didn't happen. When shopping on the plaza we told the merchants we brought from about the poor service & not to recommend the Belvoir on the Plaza to anyone. My sisters & I have decided to stay at another hotel in the area next time we are there...just like the couple we talked to who cancelled their room for Sunday night did because of the poor service. Would not accept AARP Card either. At least the doorman and parking attendant were very friendly.........thats the only good thing I can say about the place.

title: Excellent Stay!!!!
comment: The staff and hotel is just outstanding. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff exceeded my expectation.

everyoneShouldKnow: The two towers are far apart.
title: Bay Tower
comment: The Bay Tower was much less glamorous than the Marina tower. While the restaurants and services in the Marina tower were excellent, my room in the Bay tower was less than desirable. The room was large, but hallways were dim and dungeon-like, my TV remote didn't work, the bathroom smelled like mildew, the towels were dusty, and there were strange gurgling sounds in bathroom (plumbing issues?) On a good note, beds and pillows were very comfortable.

title: Hotel needs updating
comment: This hotel is "worn out," "tired." and needs some updating. I was disappointed with this Belvoir Hotel. They need to put some money into sprucing it up.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service was not to the Sheridan Level I'm accustomed to. Very Dissapointing.
title: Hotel
comment: Not the typical Sheridan rooms nor service.

title: Unwanted Guest
comment: It is tough to get beyond a 3" cockroach climing the wall above the head of your bed. We checked out 4 days early. The staff was very helpful and understanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't leave anything behind. You'll never get it back.
title: This hotel cannot accomodate large groups
comment: I stayed at this hotel on business, and had to leave in a hurry. I left a drawer full of personal items, and called as soon as I realized what I had done, hoping that someone might help. The first time I called was before check-in, and I was told that there were too many large groups staying at the hotel, so no one could help me. I left several messages and finally the next night received a call from an unfriendly security guard telling me that nothing was found. He reiterated that things had been too busy around there for him, or anyone else to be able to help me. The hotel should be staffed to operate at full capacity, in my opinion. One positive..the bartender was extremely nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Only a large family would like the place.
title: Not up to Grandbourne standards
comment: First of all, not a place to stay for business. No late check-out available and have to be out by 1000am. That is, if you can avoid the knocking on the door to pack and leave.

title: Could do better with BPG Plat Upgrades
comment: Overall, a mediocre experience on this stay. Not bad by any means, but not great. No suite or other meaningful upgrade offered to BPG Platinum member. Sluggish bell staff and valet responsiveness. Staff was friendly and nice.

title: Great Location! Great Service!
comment: Great Location! Great Service!

title: In-room internet access is problematic
comment: I stay at this hotel at least a couple of days every month. It's a great hotel, with great staff. When I stay there it's for work, not play, so internet access is very important to me.

title: Try it
comment: always enjoy my stay

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice location and a beautiful hotel plus very friendly staff.
title: Excellent hotel
comment: We are BPG members and absolutely loved our stay. We loved being able to have the green choice option as well. We've already recommended it to family and they have already booked their stay.

title: Customer service is off the chart
comment: Needed a larger rooom upon check in, none available, Joey found us a standard room close to ours and it made the trip. Billy B in The Californias restaurant is excellent, sit in his section!!

title: So-so, better properties in the area
comment: I stay at this hotel quite a bit (approximately 10x over the past 6 months).

title: Impressive Staff
comment: I stay in a lot of hotels and the facilities were pretty good considering the area. What really made this a stand out for me was simply the people.

title: Review June [YEAR-0]
comment: We are BPG members, the hotel was very nice. Our room wss clean and the views overlooking San Diego were increadible. The staff was very nice. We will stay their again in the future for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: rooms facing the highway have parking lot lights beaming into the rooms...
title: poor light planning
comment: Requested a king size bed and provided 2 full size beds located on the highway side of the building on the 6th floor. The room was good except for a light in the parking lot beaming into the window. The window shades cannot close to block the light. Tried to change rooms, but only offered other rooms on the same side of the building. Had to move lower to try and avoid the light; however, on my 3rd day, somehow the light was adjusted to beam into 2nd floor room as well. By the way, the 2nd floor room was dungier... Had a musty smell and the decor was older... some mold in the bathroom caulk...

title: A good hotel... but not great.
comment: As Belvoirs in the US go, this one is good, but not great. I stay here because of the hotel's rates and its convenient location. As usual, the bed was fantastic.

title: Great Hotel
comment: I found my room to be very clean, the white bedding is a nice touch, it just makes the room look brighter and cleaner. The atmosphere and decor in the hotel is very nice and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. I agree with some of the other reviews the navy decor really stands out and is very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is incredible. From check in to check out we were greeting in every corner of the hotel by friendly staff who were willing to assist with our every need.
title: Our home for a home search
comment: We were in town with two small dogs to search for a new home. The Belvoir staff made us feel like we had already found it. Everyone was friendly and eager to help from the moment we arrived.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its huge and room cleanings are late and or slow. Room upgrades are not easy and have to be paid for....
title: Sherton WIld Horse extended stay
comment: We recently stayed a week at this resort. My wife and I had our two little kids, ages 2 and 6 months. I was on a work conference, so I didn't spend much time in our little room, but my wife did. The biggest problem she had was getting the room cleaned in a timely manner. Getting the kids to nap before the room was cleaned was a chore. Also the pool area was infested wiht birds that would steal food right off your tray and dish. It was like a scene out of the movie "The Birds". The staff were very frendly and wanted to help, but we were anxious to get back home.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will have to drive to reach things unless you set up in advance the local shuttle arrangement which is great too.
title: Family & Business
comment: This is the second time my family and I have stayed for a business conference and we are actually thinking of going here on vacation to hit some local beaches and visit family. Very convenient if you have a car and understand LI traffic. The rooms poolside are perfect for my family. We have a three year old and a 10 month old so the less stuff we have to lug around the better. The restaurant is excellent and food is fantastic. My husband have been in the restaurant business for 20+ years Manhattan and San Fran restaurants so we were really impressed. The staff here are SUPER Friendly and accommodating as long as you are nice to them. I have seen some disgraceful behavior by the guests and the staff still treats them with respect. I would have told the guests to take a hike.

title: Great enviroment!
comment: First of all I loved the shuttle from the airport to the hotel. My shuttle driver was friendly and informative. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. Of course the restaurant and bar staff were attentive and very courteous. All my needs were met with pleasant smiles.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away from the sales department
title: Sales staff
comment: Very rude, she continued to pack her purse because it was closing time for her. Quoted a different rate by Heidi yet did not honor her quote....very disappointed....very sad because the room and the night staff were very nice

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are looking for a great place to stay after the baseball game. Everything is within walking distance.
title: Great location
comment: The security was good and the bell service was fantastic. The location is ideal for baseball games, within walking distance. The staff was able to recommend safe and reasonably priced transportation and great dining.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location to shopping and dining nearby. Well maintained, clean rooms. Staff attentive and welcoming
title: Better Each Visit
comment: The hotel remains popular and attracts a range of guests. The new full time manager Damon provides a stability and attention to details which guests appreciate. The Club floor lounge is more popular and is very well maintained. The three women who host guests in the Club are always welcoming and helpful with ideas on how to enjoy the ABQ area. They are definite assets! A relaxed feel

title: Jacquelyne A. Crowell
comment: We love the Dolphin. The best incentive is the appreciation they show to teachers and those in education through their discounted rates. Our group of 21 adults and children all enjoyed our recent visit. This was our 7th stay at this wonderful resort.

title: Recent Stay
comment: Fabulous hotel cleaning staff, went out of their way to get my room ready daily

title: Dinner served by Matt C
comment: On June 16th we had the pleasure of dining in the restaurant. Our sever for the evening was Matt C. We found his knowledge of the menu, patience with taking our orders, (we were preoccupied with catching up and not much with our dinner selection) his suggestions and engaging personality made our dining experience a pleasure. Matt provided excellent client service and we wanted to acknowledge that he served us with distinction. Thank you

everyoneShouldKnow: It has the potential of being a great stay and is close to many activities.
title: A disappointing experience
comment: We have stayed at this hotel previously and had a very good experience; however, this visit did not quite measure up. We were confirmed (in writing) in a corner room with a lake or river view; however, when we arrived we were assigned a room overlooking the city. We were very disappointed. Also, our valet experience upon checking out was disappointing. The attendant seemed to want to help pack our car, but when I told him how I wanted it packed, he did not comply with my wishes. I had to unpack everything and repack it. Also, our windows were not washed as advertised. I spent a Suite Nights Reward for the upgraded room, which was not what were were confirmed in.

title: Incredible Ineptitude
comment: This is by any standard the most inept and incompetent hospitality experience I have ever encountered. I believe there are prisons more accommodating than this.

title: Convenient hotel with lots of great features
comment: This hotel exceeded my expectations in regards to comfort, and amenities. Wireless internet was included in the resort price which is a rare component of most hotel stays. I loved the many restaurants right on site especially Pikabu. However on the last night of my stay I noticed the floor space adjacent to the balcony windows was very damp secondary to rain coming in through during a storm. Also there was a very large cockroach climbing on the wall. I reported these issues to the staff. Overall for the exception of the above, the hotel was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is located in walking distance to the falls. There is a nominal charge for parking, but it is well worth it.
title: A Positive Experience
comment: I was very happy with my experience at this hotel. Check in and out were quick and easy. The staff was very friendly and willing to assist me with whatever I needed. The rooms were clean. I really liked that TGI Fridays and Starbucks were attached to the hotel. I would stay at this hotel agan :)

title: Vacation
comment: My wife and I recently stayed here for vacation and as a BPG member with gold status; I expected the rooms to be better for the price listed. The room was mediocre and needs to be refurbished. We stayed on the BPG 30th floor with a good view but asides from that, I felt like I walked into a motel 6. The bed looked nice but was uncomfortable. The room was small for the high price listed. Aside from the important part which is the room. The staff was great and the hotel was at a great location. I guess parking around downtown are all ridiculous so all said, you might get a better bang for your buck staying a little outside of the downtown area and take public transportation which is a lot cheaper anyhow.

title: General impression
comment: Well managed hotel. Front desk is courteous. Mike at the club lounge is exceptional. Good value for the money. Definitely will come back. I missed the second day pay your age program though.

title: Hotel has good location.
comment: The manager screwed up my reservatons and they were going to charge me extra for one day. They wee rude. Fortunately I had a copy of my reservations made on online. It was their mistake.

title: Walking distance to DisneyLand
comment: My wife and I are Grandbourne members so we make it a point to stay at Grandbourne properties. We've never been let down and our recent stay here was no exception.
